loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 40 year old, married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife and children in a small, simple house. Hani works as a public sector employee  where he earns a low income. His income is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs. Hani decided to open a small grocery store six years ago. It is a good business and helps him with some of the family's expenses. Hani received a loan from FATEN to help him expand his store and buy more products to sell. This loan will help Hani improve his business and also his income. Hani appears in the photo while at work in his grocery store.

loans.use: to expand his store and buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en: Dilshad is a 42 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. For some time now his rickshaw hasn't been working properly so he has been unable to generate any income. He would like to repair it as soon as possible. He finds it difficult to repair the rickshaw due to a lack of money. Therefore, Dilshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Dilshad is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw to provide transportation.

loans.name: Nery Guadalupe

texts.es: Nery tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 15 años, 12 años y 10 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Nery trabaja como empleado en una institución cercana a su localidad. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Nery is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his life companion and their three children (ages 15, 12, and 10). All of his children are currently in school.

Nery is employed at an institution near his town. He wants to improve his living conditions, so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel so that he can lay down a concrete floor in his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel so that he can lay down a concrete floor in his home.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Hala is a 24-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother of two small kids. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a small income. He also has a farm where he plants seasonal crops. He uses green houses to reduce the costs and ensure he has good quality. 

Hala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband buy seedlings and new materials for building green houses. By taking this loan, Hala and her husband will be able to improve their farm and increase its productivity.

loans.use: to help her husband buy seedlings and new materials for building green houses.

loans.name: Lourdes Eliana

texts.es: Lourdes Eliana tiene 65 años de edad y tiene tres hijos, ella vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y se siente alegre por vivir en esta ciudad. Lourdes Eliana es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de artesanía de papel reciclado y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde tiene un equipo básico para hacer sus artesanías, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Huayna Picchu" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar papel reciclado.
texts.en:
Lourdes Eliana is 65 years old and has three children. She resides in the beautiful city of Cusco, which in southern Peru, so she is happy to be living in this city.

Lourdes Eliana is an enterprising woman who has been able to move her family forward. Her main business activity is making handicrafts out of recycled paper. She has a small workshop in her home where she has basic equipment for making her products.

Lourdes Eliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Picchu”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy recycled paper.

loans.use: to buy recycled paper for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, age 26, is a marred woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a milk-selling business with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. She initiated their own business by buying a buffalo to support the family when her husband was the only bread winner at the time. With the passage of time her sales increased, so did her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, Nadia is respected in the home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 55000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Rema is a 31-year-old married woman from Qalqilia. She is a mother for five kids--three sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. He also has a small farm where he plants thyme. It is a very profitable project.

Rema took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy thyme seeds for his farm. By taking this loan, Rema and her husband will be able to improve their farm and increase its productivity.

loans.use: to help her husband buy thyme seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Reyad

texts.en:
Reyad is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids, a boy and a girl, in a small humble house in the city. He has a small farm where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables. Reyad uses green houses to reduce the costs and insure he has good quality crops. 

Reyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy row materials for building new green houses.  By taking this loan, Reyad will be able to improve his farm and increase its productivity. 

Reyad appears in the photo on his farm

loans.use: buy green house materials

loans.name: Sajda

texts.en:
Sajda is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store from her house with her husband. She has 8 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Sajda is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Nusrrat

texts.en:
Nusrrat is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a cloth trading business for six years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community.  

Nusrrat requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: buy cloths to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 40-year-old single man from a small village called Qabatia near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Ibrahim works with his brothers as farmers on their land, where they plant olive trees.  It is a very profitable project but seasonal.

Ibrahim took a USD 1,000 loan from FATEN to help him and his family buy olive seedling  for their farm.  By taking this loan, the farm will be improved and its productivity will be increased.

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: buy olive seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy gypsum supplies

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is a 30-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a small simple house. Salem works in selling socks and shoes from a small stall.  It is a good job but the income is not stable. 

One of Salem's sons has a chronic disease and he always needs medicine.  Salem took a USD 1,300 loan from FATEN to help him to buy medicine and pay the hospital expenses for treating his small son.   By taking this loan, Salem will be able to pay these urgent expenses.

Salem appears in the photo.

loans.use: pay medical bills for his son

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en: Sumera is a 30-year-old married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Sumera’s husband, who is a driver by profession.  He   provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for three months to meet the family expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Sumera has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. This will help him to purchase new tires along with some auto spare parts.  Sumera is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: buy rickshaw tires and spare parts

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en:
Kaniz is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been doing a tailoring business for the past 5 years to support her family. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well.

Kaniz, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  She has requested for a loan of PKR 40000 to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, laces and ribbons in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. Kaniz hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Gulam  Fatima

texts.en: Gulam Fatima is a vigorous  53-year-old lady.  She has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to increase her revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk for the past 7 years.  Over time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently Zakiya is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Zakiya is hopeful that this will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 43 ans divorcée mère de 2 enfants de 14 et 25 ans. L'un d'eux va encore à l'école Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour agrandir son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie is a 43-year-old woman, who is the divorced mother of two children, aged 14 and 25 years old. One of them still goes to school. She opened a restaurant that she has managed for years. Thanks to this business, she takes care of her family. Buying the products for her food-selling business at retail does not bring a lot back for her. Thus, the importance of this loan for her business, as it will permit her to increase her stock of foodstuffs (bags of peanuts, one bag of rice and the little things necessary to cook her dishes). This will allow her to avoid daily costs and reduce her taxi fees, which will also increase her profits. She will reinvest a part of her profit to grow her restaurant, and with the other part she will support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of foodstuffs (bags of peanuts, one bag of rice and the things necessary to cook her dishes).

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a housewife in the small town of Dhupguriin in Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her husband and three children in a kaccha (made of stone & straw) house. Her husband is involved in farming and cultivates many kinds of vegetables to sell in the village market.

Neither of them is very educated but their children are still studying in a village school in the secondary level. Due to their low income, Laxmi is unable to manage her family's expenses and her children’s educational expenses. Her Husband struggles hard all day but fails to earn sufficient income for the family. So Laxmi requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate mustard in the same field to enhance the family's income. She is very ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed in her goal for more income. She dreams that she will build a grocery shop with her business profit in the future. 

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for making her self-sufficient.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate mustard.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30-year-old married man from Deir Al-Balah city. He lives with his wife and four kids, three sons and one daughter, in a small simple house.

Ibrahim works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Ibrahim decided to open a wholesale grocery store ten years ago. It is a good project and helps him take care of part of the family's expenses. 

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to expand his store and buy more products to resell to the local traders. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to improve his business and also his income. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand his store and buy more products to resell to the local traders.

loans.name: Aminata  Bocar

texts.fr: Madame Aminata Bocar est une promotrice qui habite dans le même quartier que le guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont le plus grand a 35 ans et le plus petit 22ans. Agée de 59 ans, elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des produits divers. Elle a comme charge particulière les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle comme sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 22h. Évoluant dans le secteur de l’ambulant, elle souhaite ouvrir un magasin dans le marché et diversifier ses produits afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. Aminata Bocar is a developer who lives in the same neighborhood as the bank. She is married and the mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 35 years old and the youngest 22. 59 years old, she has more than ten years of experience and is asking for this amount in order to buy and sell various products. As her private responsibility, she takes care of the daily expenses of her family. She starts her day at 7 in the morning and finishes at 11 at night. Growing in the sector of traveling sales, she wishes to open a store in the market and diversify her products in order to be able to increase her revenues and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase various products meant for sale.

loans.name: Barbie Group

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Lalnunpuii is a divorcee and says, “A divorce is like an amputation: you survive it, but there is less of you”. Ten years have passed since then and she takes care of herself and her two daughters. She is pictured with her hand raised. She is the featured borrower profile member for the group. Five tribal women from Aizawl joined hands and formed the Barbie Group. All of them are financially independent and engaged in generating income for the family.

After the separation of her marriage, she moved back to her parent’s home and started her own business. She runs a petty shop and sells all essential commodities. She sells detergent soap, detergent powder, biscuits, bakery goods, candles, onions, ginger, small sachet shampoos etc. Sometimes, she places an order for good quality rice from the neighboring states and sells it.  Customers usually demand better quality rice and she makes sure that it is available in the shop. The rice from the neighboring states can sell out instantly and is in high demand. 

She gets the supplies for the shop from the main market from wholesalers and sells them at a good profit. Her main source of income is the petty shop.  The shop is generally re-stocked twice in a month at the minimum. She opens her shop every morning at 7:00 am and closes at 5:00 pm. 

With the loan, she is planning to get more materials for her petty shop, expand the shop, and generate more income. She aspires to become one of the successful woman shop owners in the neighborhood and wishes to have a house that she and her daughters can call home for themselves. At present, she lives at her parent’s house. She is delighted to work with Kiva and wishes to continue the relationship. She says, “Thank you so much Kiva”. The other members of the group are also engaged in petty shops and tailoring.

loans.use: To buy more materials and expand her petty shop.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. Her husband is 57 years old and for his occupation, he sells firewood in the market. Both of them are illiterate and just know how to sign their name. Mala is a housewife.
 
Her husband sells firewood in the market to the village people. Firewood is used in rural areas for cooking purposes. To sell firewood, they need to purchase wood and logs and then cut it into pieces to sell in the market. Mala decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for INR 8,000 so that they can purchase better quality firewood & sell that in the market to earn more money. She hopes she will be able to run her family smoothly with the profit generated from her business. She dreams of building a pacca house (concrete) in the future with this profit.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to sell in the market.

loans.name: Shilpi

texts.en:
Shilpi is a 28-year-old married woman from Dhupguri.  She has her two school=going children and her husband. She looks after her family and helps her husband with his business.

Her husband is involved in the milk business. He buys milk from different dairy farms and she sells that milk door-to-door in her neighborhood but they want to purchase more milk and for that, they need more capital. So, Shilpi applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She wants to enhance her business. She hopes she will improve her financial status and build a concrete house with her business profit. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: To purchase more milk from the dairy farms to sell

loans.name: Lily Group

texts.en:
Vanlalnghaki is the featured profile member of the Lily group. She is pictured with her hand raised. Vanlalnghaki lives in Aizawl, the capital town of Mizoram in the northeastern part of India. She is a mother of two children. The family relies entirely on her husband’s meager income. Her husband is a government employee. Though her husband is a government servant, his income alone can not meet the family’s expenses because he does not get his salary on a regular basis.Therefore, they fall short of money to pay the children’s monthly school expenses and to meet the family’s basic requirements. 

Hence, Vanlalnghaki started her own business to raise more income for the family. She buys betel nut and leaf in a large quantity and usually prepares it at home at nighttime. Her husband helps her with the preparations and packing and then the next day, he takes some of the prepared tobacco (pan) to the office to sell. In the mean time, Vanlalnghaki distributes her packed tobacco to her clients and to some other small petty shops including her regular customers. With her WSDS loan, Vanlalnghaki wishes to expand her tobacco business by introducing attractive packaging and raising the tobacco quality. Since, it’s almost like a staple food in Aizawl, there’s a huge demand. Due to a shortage of money, she can't buy more stock though she has lots of demands. But with the loan, she will purchase more stock and start supplying in bulk. Like her, the rest of the group members are engaged in petty shops.

loans.use: To buy more variety of tobacco to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has a motorcycle transport business in Oloitoktok town. He is also a farmer and grows crops for resale. He is 31 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with two children. He also supports two members of his family. 

He will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to buy a plot of land and build a house, and also provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 22-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Khaled's father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all his needs. Khaled is a university student; he studies business administration and is in his last year. He would like to finish his studies and find a good job to help his family with part of their expenses. 

Khaled took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Khaled will be able to do his homework and write the seminar easily. 

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen, age 37, is a married woman. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Four years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy raw materials, including threads, laces and zippers. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including threads, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has a hotel (primitive restaurant) business that she has been running for seven years now. She is 41 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she will be using it to buy more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and baking powder for use in her hotel. She will also buy some furniture for her hotel. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business and also repay the loan.

She repaid her previous loan successfully, and her future hope is to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, wheat flour and baking powder.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is 36 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with 4 children. She is a farmer in Kangundo town, where she keeps cattle and grows crops to sell. Right now her monthly income from her farming business is KES 16,000.

She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and cattle feed. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to pay school fees for her children and to repay the loan. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to educate her children to a tertiary level and to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cattle feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer living in Nandi Hills with her husband and four children, one of whom is in school. She has been doing farming for 10 years where she produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, crops, and she also has a retail business. In farming, she enjoys milking the cows the most.

Mary chose Juhudi Kilimo because their service delivery is very fast as compared to other organizations. During the training, she learned how to develop a savings culture. It will help her build a dairy unit for the good production of her dairy cow. This will bring in more profit. The dairy unit will will boost milk production. This will improve their living standard

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a forty-year-old married lady. She is a mother of five children between the ages of seventeen and ten years old. She learned about VisionFund Kenya from a neighbor who is also registered. For the past ten years, Rose manages a tea plantation in Bomet, Kenya. Her monthly income is approximately KES 10,000.

She has been advanced a second loan of KES 30,000 after successfully repaying the previous one. She intends to use the funds to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor (tea harvesting). The proceeds will be used to cater to her family's basic needs. Her dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the tea plantation.

loans.name: Viviane Ruth

texts.fr: Viviane est une femme de 38 ans, célibataire, mère de 3 enfants de 15 ans qui vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et vend des beignets en matinée depuis 8 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquérir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour. Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle. Grâce à lui, elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (2 sacs de farine,2 bidons d'huile et le bois de chauffage) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie réinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Viviane is a 38-year-old woman, a single mother of three children aged 15 who attend school. She is a vendor of fritters which she has been selling in the morning over the past eight years, in one of the capital's neighborhoods.

Her expertise in this area and the prices she practices have enabled her to acquire and retain customers, whose numbers are increasing daily. This leads her to request this credit loan as her working capital does not allow her to fully satisfy her customers. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to increase her stock by buying two bags of flour, two cans of oil and some firewood.

The profits received as a result of the credit loan will be partially reinvested in her business and the rest will be saved for her children's education.

loans.use: Buy two bags of flour, two cans of oil and firewood

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima est un homme de plus de 40ans qui évolue dans le service bureautique. Il demande ce prêt d’un montant de 200.000 pour acheter une imprimante des fournitures de bureau et satisfaire les services de ses clients tels qu’imprimer des documents et vendre les articles de bureau. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants dont le plus grand a 24 et le plus petit a 2ans. Il a une expérience de plus de 24ans et commence sa journée à 07h pour la terminer à 22h. Il voudrait avec l’aide des financements de l’institution ouvrir un mini labo numérique et diversifier ses services. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent. Il a choisi ce métier par amour.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima is a man of more than 40 years of age who provides computer services. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 XOF to buy a printer and office supplies so he can provide services to his customers such as printing documents and selling office supplies.

He is married and the father of six children, the eldest of whom is 24 years old and the youngest two. He has over 24 years' experience and starts his day at 7 am to finish at 10 pm.

With the help of funding from the institution, he would like to open a digital mini-lab and diversify his services. Thus he will be able to increase his income and put money into savings. He chose this profession out of passion.

loans.use: Buy a printer to satisfy his customer's service requirements

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old and is married to Margaret. He is a father of five children, ages 13, 9, 6, 2 and one month old. For the past four years, he operates a butcher shop in Bomet town, Kenya. His monthly income is approximately KES 20,900.

He learned about VisionFund from a loan officer. He has acquired a second loan of KES 20,000, which will facilitate the purchase of bulk meat from the slaughter house. He plans to use the increased gains to pay school fees for his children. His hope is to open more butcheries in the town.

loans.use: to purchase meat from the slaughter house.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 31 years old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She is a farmer in Kangundo town where she keeps livestock and grows crops for sale. She has been in the business for five years and it has been profitable.

Magdalene will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings (tomatoes and vegetables) for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to educate her children to the tertiary level and to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta  est une femme qui est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est divorcée  et mère de 3  enfants âgés entre 35 et 22 ans. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus pour femme. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. Bineta sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 500.000 F pour renforcer son fond de roulement et diversifier ses produits. Elle gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle voudrait aussi avec l’aide des crédits de l’institution diversifier ses activités et augmenter ses revenus ainsi elle pourra épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
Ms. Bineta is a 51-year-old woman, who is divorced and the mother of three children between 22 and 35 years of age.

She is merchant of fabrics for women. She has an experience of over 20 years, and starts her day at 8 am to finish at 5 pm.

Bineta is requesting this loan for 500,000 XOF to bolster her working capital and diversify her product offerings. She manages daily household expenses and her children's tuition.

With the help of funding from the institution, she would like to diversify her activities and increase her income, so she can put money into savings.

loans.use: Buy fabrics for women to resell

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
Dorcas is the representative from the 'Onua do' Group. She is the mother of three children, who live with her and her husband. They live in the Teshie neighborhoods in Accra-Ghana. She is very excited to receive her third loan from ID-Ghana.

Dorcas has had her business for around seven years. She started it with some savings that she had and she used the capital to buy plastic products. She started selling them from her house and from walking around. After years of doing business, she needs to invest more capital. So she attended the ID-Ghana program in Teshie.

Dorcas is planning to use her new loan to purchase a variety of plastic products, such as bowls, plates, chairs, and tables. She will use her business profits to continue investing in her business and to save for her future plans. She will achieve her dream of having a successful business and stable income to support her family. The rest of the members are involved in groceries and food. They thank Kiva donors for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastic products, such as bowls, plates, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married 63-year-old gentleman and supports a family of twelve. He has been a carpenter in Narok, Kenya, for the last thirty years with a monthy income of KES 11,000. 

He learnt about VisionFund Kenya through a neighbour who is a registered member of the organisation. He has acquired his first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund which will facilitate him in the purchase of timber for his carpentry business.

He plans to use the proceeds to educate his children. His hope is to expand his business, thus creating employment opportunities for others.

loans.use: to purchase timber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 50-year-old gentleman who is married and supports a family of five. For the past seven years, he runs a butchery shop in Bomet town, Kenya. He earns a monthly income of KES 13,500.

He learned about VisionFund Kenya from a registered customer. He has been advanced a first loan of KES 30,000 which he will use to purchase some goats for slaughter. He will use the proceeds to repay the loan and to cater to his family's basic needs. His dream is to purchase a piece of land and to build some rental houses.

loans.use: to buy livestock for slaughter.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 43-year-old married woman who runs a business selling milk. She has 3 buffaloes and two cows that provide milk. She sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk from them on a daily basis.

Salma has two children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food and clothing. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy one more buffalo to carter to more customers. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which will ultimately help to generate more cash. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Diadia

texts.fr: Monsieur DIADIA est un homme âgé de 29 ans qui évolue dans la fabrication des marmites, métier qu’il a héritier de son père. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants âgés entre 17 ans et 4 ans. Il gère les charges et dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Il sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000 pour acheter de l’aluminium qu’il utilise comme matière première dans la fabrication des marmites. Il a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour rentrer à la maison vers 19h du soir. Avec l’aide de l’institution il voudrait aussi agrandir son atelier et moderniser son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Diadia is a 29-year-old man who makes pots out of aluminum, a trade he has inherited from his father. He is married and the father of four children between four and 17 years of age. He manages household expenses and his family's daily expenditures.

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 XOF to buy aluminum, which is the raw material used in manufacturing pots. He has over 20 years' experience in this business, and starts his day at 8 am to go home around 7 in the evening.

With the help of the institution he would like to expand his workshop and modernize his business, so he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buy aluminum to make pots

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is 33 years old and married. She has four children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family.

Seven years ago, she started a business stitching clothes to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and used her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.

She requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy spools of threads and packs of buttons, needles, and ribbons in various colors. This will allow her to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls in her village.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads and packs of buttons, needles, and ribbons.

loans.name: Estelle Joelle

texts.fr: Joëlle est une jeune femme de 27 ans célibataire mère de 2 enfants de 1 et 10 ans. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 05 ans déjà. Il a fait la vente en détail de l'huile de palme. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Joëlle is a 27-year-old, single mother of two children, aged one year and ten years old.  

She has been working as a trader in a local market for five years now.  She sells palm oil to the public, and has a good knowledge of her suppliers and customers, built up over her years of experience.  Unfortunately, she often runs out of stock as she must sell all she has before she can afford to buy more due to her very low working capital.  She would like to increase her stock holding to avoid this situation.

Joëlle will save a part of her earnings to expand her business, and the rest will be used to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of drums of oil for resale.

loans.name: Francine Elisabeth

texts.fr: Francine est une jeune femme de 39 ans mère de famille. Apres sa formation elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis un an dans un quartier de la capital. Son activité fonctionne a merveille. Depuis un certain temps elle n'arrive plus a satisfaire sa clientèle faute de stock de marchandise. Elle sollicite vote aide afin de rembourser son crédit  augmenter son capital et envoyer ses enfants a l'ecole
texts.en:
Francine is 39 years old and has children.  After finishing her training, she opened a hairdresser's salon in a district of the capital city, and she has been running this business for one year now.  Her business is exceptionally successful.  She does, however, lack stock, so is often unable to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Francine has requested this loan to increase her working capital, repay her loan and be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of hair extensions for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nataga

texts.fr: Nataga est une jeune femme de 52 ans mariée et mère de 03 enfant dont l'ainé a 35 ans et le plus jeune 20 ans. Elle gère une activité fleurissante de  vente de vivre depuis 30 ans dans un marché de la place. Les demandes de ses clients se font grandissante et elle n'arrive plus a les satisfaire. Elle sollicite votre aide afin d'agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nataga is 52 years old, married and mother to three children, the eldest is 35 years old and the youngest is 20 years old.  She has been running a very successful food sales business at a local market for 30 years.

However, she is no longer able to meet the ever-expanding needs of her customers so, she has requested this loan.  Nataga would like to expand her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stocks of merchandise.

loans.name: Galenur

texts.en:
Galenur is 40 years old and married. Her husband is 52 years old and a farmer. Galenur has two children. One of them goes to school. The other one works in a mill. Galenur lives in the small town of Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri District. Both Galenur and her husband have completed their education up to grade 5 and 6, respectively.

Her husband's income is too small to run his family and to take care of their two children. Like every mother, Galenur dreams of giving her best to her children. So she plans to help her husband. Keeping this in mind, she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her husband. She plans to take the loan so that she can purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to raise more potatoes to improve her financial condition. She wants to invest in the potato business because it is in great demand in her area. With the profit from her business, she hopes to give a better education to her children for a good lifestyle.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Bisakha

texts.en:
Bisakha is 35 years old and married. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have prevented her from receiving a good education. Now Bisakha is a mother of two children and both of them go to school.

She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market and in her neighborhood. Her husband is a farmer. Both Bisakha and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children and so that their future is not affected by poverty and ignorance. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dreams come true. Now, Bisakha lives in a Kaccha house (made of straw & mud), but with this loan, she will try to make a Pakka house (made of bricks & cement). Bisakha and her husband are successfully running their business and have taken a hold on the market for selling milk products & vegetables.

Bisakha is grateful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk & milk products.

loans.name: Dios Me Fortalece Group

texts.es:
Dios me Fortalece está conformado por once integrantes, padres de familia responsables de veinte hijos, son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron cursar sus estudios y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor,   y cumplir sus sueños como es formar a sus hijos en profesionales y de provecho para la sociedad.

Gracias a sus esfuerzos y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Paula y tiene por actividad económica una  pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, maíz, verduras, hielos, fósforos. Jugos, galletas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su productos, el negocio lo tiene ubicad en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Dios me Fortalece agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The group "Dios Me Fortalece" is comprised of eleven members who are responsible parents of a total of 20 children.  They are from Malpaisillo which is located in the northern region.  They are known for being hard-working, responsible people who are determined to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, they were unable to get an education and had to go to work to help cover household expenses.  Nowadays, they struggle daily to give their children a better future and to see them become professionals and good citizens.

Thanks to her efforts to get ahead, the coordinator of the group is Paula.  She runs a small grocery store and sells small amounts of food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, corn, vegetables, ice, matches, juices and cookies.  She works 12 hours a day selling her products out of the store set up in her home.  The purpose of the loan is to use it as work capital to buy and sell more products so she can earn more income.  The "Dios Me Fortalece" Group is grateful to Kiva lenders who help people with low incomes and poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, corn, vegetables, ice, matches, juices and cookies.

loans.name: Mikpamahu-Pouce Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MIKPAMAHU-POUCE est composé de neuf personnes qui vivent dans le même village. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin de diversifier leur activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Antoinette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 38 ans, n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Antoinette est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Mathieu. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Antoinette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont assumées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Antoinette vend du pétrole dans sa région depuis une quinzaine d’années. De façon secondaire, Antoinette achète des noix de palme qu’elle transforme en huile végétale et revend. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire, Antoinette ensemble avec les membres du groupement MIKPAMAHU-POUCE sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mikpamahu-Pouce Group is made up of nine people who all live in the same village.  This is the third time that the group have requested a loan to diversify their businesses, from the field partner Alidé.

The group representative is Antoinette, and she is seen in the photo with her hand raised.  She is 38 years old and has never attended school.  She is married to Mathieu who grows vegetables, and the couple have five children, some of whom currently attend school.  Antoinette lives with her husband and their children.

Antoinette and her husband jointly provide for the expenses of their household.  To do this, Antoinette has sold oil in her local area for around fifteen years.  In conjunction with this, she also buys palm nuts which she transforms into vegetable oil for resale.  She buys all her supplies in the local area.

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers and improve her income, Antoinette, and the other members of the group, have requested this third loan from Alidé.  The previous loans have all been fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy oil and palm nuts.

loans.name: Mahoudo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHOUDO est composé de vingt-deux personnes qui vivent dans le même village. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé afin de diversifier leur activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Joséphine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 42 ans, n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Joséphine est mariée à un marchand du nom de Bertin. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Joséphine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont assumées par Joséphine et son mari. Pour ce faire, Joséphine vend des noix de palme et de l’huile de palme dans sa région depuis vingt ans. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans son village. Dans le but de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et pour augmenter son fonds de roulement, Joséphine ensemble avec les membres du groupement MAHOUDO sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé
texts.en:
The Mahoudo Group is made up of 22 people who all live in the same village.  This is the second time that the group have requested a loan to diversify their businesses, from the field partner, Alidé.

The group representative is Joséphine, and she is seen in the photo with her hand raised.  She is 42 years old and has never attended school.  She is married to Bertin, a trader.  The couple have four children, some of whom currently attend school.  Joséphine lives with her husband and their children.  Together, the couple provide for the expenses of their household.  To do this, Joséphine has been selling palm nuts and palm oil in her local area for 20 years.  She buys her supplies in her village.

In order to respond to the needs of her customers, Joséphine, and the other members of the group have requested this loan from Alidé.  Their previous loan was correctly and fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Liney Cecilia

texts.es:
Liney es una mujer pujante, carismática y luchadora, a sus 53 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con empeño y dedicación.
Hace 6 años, con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía del hogar, decidió abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, la cual funcionó bien durante algún tiempo pero, poco a poco las ventas bajaron y esto la obligó a cerrar su negocio, sin embargo, tuvo la fortaleza de seguir adelante y comenzó a vender productos por catálogo de una marca muy reconocida a nivel mundial, gracias a ello sus ventas son constantes y así apoya a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar productos con descuentos (cremas corporales, productos de aseo personal, vitaminas, suplementos dietarios y otros), esto le permitirá vender a un mejor precio y obtener un margen de ganancia más alto, además tendrá disponibilidad de inventario suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
Liney tiene como proyecto para un futuro cercano, abrir un almacén en un local comercial, en el que pueda vender de toda clase de productos y así aumentar la rentabilidad de su labor, con la que espera tener la capacidad de brindar educación universitaria a sus dos hijos para que se conviertan en profesionales íntegros y exitosos, y disfrutar junto a su familia de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liney, 53, is a determined, charismatic, courageous woman who is married and has two children who she is raising with hard work and dedication.  Six years ago in order to generate more income for the household economy, she decided to open a small grocery store which worked well during some time.  But, little by little, sales began to drop and she had to close the business.  Nevertheless, she had the strength to continue on and began to sell a worldwide known brand of products by catalogue.  Thanks to her work, sales are consistent and she is able to help her husband with the household expenses.

She wants to use the loan to buy discount products (body lotions, personal hygiene products, vitamins, dietary supplements and other items).  This will allow her to sell at a better price and earn more profit.  It will also mean she will have sufficient stock on hand to satisfy customer demand.

In the not-too-distant future, Liney wants to open a store in a local shopping center where she could sell all kinds of products and increase her profit.  She hopes to earn enough to give her two children a university education so they can become successful professionals.  She also wants to enjoy a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: To buy discount products (body lotions, personal hygiene products, dietary supplements, etc.)

loans.name: Ketty Luz

texts.es:
Ketty es una mujer activa y emprendedora, tiene 35 años de edad y se ha dedicado a diferentes actividades comerciales, poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia y conocimientos para desenvolverse en este campo de acción, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y adicionalmente presta el servicio de madre comunitaria, cuidando los niños de las madres cabeza de hogar del sector, que deben salir a trabajar para conseguir el sustento familiar.
Con el crédito que solicita actualmente, desea comprar surtido para la tienda (granos, lácteos, galletería) y otros insumos para brindarle alimentación a los niños que cuida en su hogar comunitario; esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de artículos suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y además le brinda la oportunidad de seguir realizando su labor social, con la que beneficia a muchas personas de su comunidad.
Ketty manifiesta que su felicidad es poder colaborarle a los demás, por ello su mayor anhelo es tener la capacidad y la posibilidad de seguir con su labor, de igual forma desea fortalecer su tienda para generar ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ketty, 35, is an active, enterprising woman who has been involved in different business activities.  Little by little she acquired experience and knowledge in this line of work and now she owns a small grocery store.  She also works offering her service as a community mother, caring for children whose mothers are heads of household and must work to support their families.

The loan she is currently requesting is to buy goods for the store (grains, dairy products, baked goods) and other supplies to feed the children she cares for in the community home.  This will allow her to have sufficient items on hand to satisfy customer demand and also allow her the opportunity to continue her social work in the benefit of many people in the community.

Ketty says she is happy to work with others so her greatest wish is to have the capacity and possibility to continue her work.  She also wants to strengthen her store business to generate enough income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store (grains, dairy products, baked goods) and other supplies to feed the children she cares for.

loans.name: Nafer Enrique

texts.es:
Nafer es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 38 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió las labores del campo por medio de su padre, gracias a ello hoy en día se desempeña como agricultor independiente y, en algunas ocasiones realiza trabajos como jornalero, así complementa los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (pesticidas, abonos, fertilizantes) esto le permitirá continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y mejorar las ventas de la cosecha recolectada, aumentando los ingresos por venta.
Nafer manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad a su labor, generando mayor rentabilidad al negocio para brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Nafer, 38, is a humble, hard-working farmer who learned agriculture from his father.  Now he is an independent farmer who sometimes works as a wage earner for extra income to cover household expenses.

The loan will be used to buy wholesale farm supplies (pesticides and fertilizers) which will allow him to continue caring for his crops and to improve sales at harvest time, to increase his income.

Nafer says his greatest desire is to continue his work and generate more profit so he can give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy wholesale farm supplies (pesticides and fertilizers).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 39-year old married woman. Her husband is 42 years old. Anita is a dedicated mother but she is unable to pursue an education for her only son. She lives in a small town in the Dhupguri region. Anita is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer. Due to their poverty, her son has been working as a mason since his childhood without receiving an education. 

Anita has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can help her husband in his cultivation and the expansion of the business. The field in which she is standing in the picture belongs to them and they will cultivate potatoes in this field. Anita always wants to be with her husband in every situation so that their family can run smoothly and their son is not affected by poverty or suffer in the future. They always wish to give their best to her son and improve their financial condition. She hopes to build a concrete house later for her son with her business profit. 

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva because without them, she would not be able to see the light of prosperity in her life.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Meet Jeniffer, a resident of Nandi Hills in the north rift of Kenya. She is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. She has been farming for seven years and her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and mixed crops. She says the most enjoyable thing about farming is feeding the livestock. Her biggest challenge is chopping and crushing homemade feed.
.
Jeniffer chose Juhudi Kilimo because they give asset financing to farmers who want to grow economically and she wants to grow economically by buying more poultry. During the training, she learned how to manage her finances. The poultry she buys will increase her egg production and, thus, her income will increase and she will be able to pay for her children's school fees and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is fifty-two years old, married and the mother of five children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for the past six years and knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Ghazala earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy spools of threads along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces in different colors to meet her customers' increasing demands. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces in different colors .

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is thirty-nine years old, married and the mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Shahnaz’s husband. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his ambulance. He has been providing this service privately in their community for many years in order to pay family expenses but now the vehicle requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. For this reason, Shahnaz has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR on behalf of her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will enable him to provide quick and prompt service in emergencies. Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married lady aged fifty. She is blessed with five children aged thirty, twenty-two, twenty, eighteen and sixteen. For the last twenty years, Susan has sold vegetables and fruit to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This loan of 50,000 KES is her third loan from Vision Fund. With it, she intends to purchase more vegetables and fruit for the business. The anticipated profits will be used to reinvest and boost her savings account.

Her dream is to improve her living standards and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es estudiante del tercer año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, es una alumna regular y comenta que tiene como meta seguir estudiando y poder graduarse, y de esa forma ser una buena profesional.
Le gustaría trabajar de manera independiente y para que por medio de su trabajo pueda ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma seguir en busca de su meta.
texts.en:
Claudia is a third year Business Administration student. She is a regular student and she says that her goal is to keep studying and to be able to graduate and become a good professional.

She would like to work for herself so that through her work she can help her family. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in making college payments so she can continue on towards her goal.

loans.use: to make college payments.

loans.name: Yubernei

texts.es:
Yubernei es un joven emprendedor, dinámico y activo, a sus 22 años de edad, es propietario de una distribuidora de gaseosas y cervezas, la idea surgió desde su núcleo familiar, pues vieron la oportunidad en el sector, ya que no existe otro establecimiento similar, lo que para ellos ha sido una gran ventaja, pues ha logrado reconocimiento y muy buena aceptación en la comunidad.
Con el ánimo de seguir acreditando su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas y cerveza), esto le permitirá además de satisfacer la demanda, iniciar su vida crediticia, lo que le abre puertas para seguir luchando por el cumplimiento de su sueño, pues Yubernei desea abrir otra sucursal en otro barrio y así poco a poco expandir su negocio y generar mayor rentabilidad, con lo que podrá brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yubernei is a young, dynamic and energetic entrepreneur. He is 22 years old and owns a beer and beverage distribution company. The idea to start this business came up when his family saw an opportunity, since there are no such businesses in the area where they live. This has represented a great advantage for them, because the business has gained good reputation and acceptance within the community.

Thinking of enhancing the reputation of his business, Yubernei is requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk (beer and beverages). This will help him to fulfill the customers’ demands and establish a credit history, which would open doors for him to continue fighting to reach his goals. Yubernei would like to open one more establishment in a different neighborhood in order to expand his business and improve his profits to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy beer and beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Luci

texts.es:
Luci es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres. Su padre trabaja en una penitenciaría nacional y su madre es repostera.
Ella trabaja en una consultora hace más de un año, a la vez que está estudiando su carrera universitaria.
Su máxima aspiración es llegar a cumplir todas sus metas y poder así ser una abogada de éxito que ayude a las demás personas. Anhela ser la mejor abogada del país.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma  poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luci is single. She is 20 years old and she lives with her parents. Her father works in a national penitentiary and her mother bakes pastries. She has worked in an office for more than a year while she has been going to college. 

What she aspires to the most is to meet all of her goals and thus be a successful attorney who helps others. She longs to be the best attorney in the country. She is asking for this loan to invest in making her payments so that she can continue going to school.

loans.use: to make college payments.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, dos hijas de de 3 años (gemelas) y su hijo de 7 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de refrescos y antojitos típicos desde hace un año. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad  y gracias a su carisma muchas personas la prefieren y dan buenas referencias de ella. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado  que se encuentra deteriorado para lo cual comprará material como: tejas, hierro y madera.
texts.en: María is 36 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion, two 3 year old daughters (twins) and her 7 year old son. María has worked selling beverages and traditional snacks for a year. She sells as a street vendor in the main areas of her community and thanks to her charisma people prefer her and give her good references. María is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof on her home because it has deteriorated. She will buy materials such as roof tiles, iron rods and wood.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles, iron rods and wood to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: Saleem is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her area. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 3rd loan cycle, and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her late twenties, is married and has got three children, two og whom are in school. She has had a beauty salon service for three years now. Rehema opens her business from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Rehema's third loan request. She used the previous loans to buy business working equipment like cosmetics, hair products and other related items. Rehema paid back all of her loans successfully. She used the profit to cover her household expenses and school fees. She also plows some money back into her business for capital growth. Rehema is now requesting her third loan, which she will use to buy hair products and cosmetics for her business. She dreams that, in the coming days, she will be a successful woman with a nice family house. 

The members of her loan group Parachichi, which totals seven members, will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair products and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is 33 years old and a married woman and mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Khursheed’s husband, who is a taxi driver by profession. He has been driving a taxi for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Khursheed has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Khursheed is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some spare parts.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en: Asiya has successfully built her business sewing clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is very experienced in her business and has retained good number of customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to keep up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a 50-year-old lady and a mother of two. She has run a retail shop for the last twelve years with a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She applied for a new loan KES 20000 from Visionfund Kenya which she plans to use to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products like juices, sweets, margarine, flour, sugar etc. The anticipated profits will be reinvested in her business for expansion. 

Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more radios and others items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Fleming

texts.en:
Fleming is 35 years old, married and supports a family of five.  He has been a maize farmer for the last 3 years, earning a monthly income of KES 9000. 

He is requesting a second loan of KES 45000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he intends to use to hire a tractor for land ploughling as well as purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for land ploughling as well as purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip used his previous loan to buy welding materials for use in his welding business. It was profitable, and he has been able to repay the loan well. He supports five people in his family. This being his fourth year in the business, his monthly income right now is KES 25,000.

He will be using the loan to buy a welding machine. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his four children and repay the loan.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to expand his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 45 years old, widowed and has two children. She is a farmer and also sells plastic shoes in Kangundo town. She has been in the business for 10 years and right now her monthly income from her business is KES 35,000.

She will be using the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will also buy stock shoes for resale in her shoe sales business. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and provide the needs of her family.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to improve her business and see her children get educated to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for planting and shoes for resale

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 31 years old and has a quarry from which he supplies building blocks and stones to construction sites.  He is married and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with one child, age 5.  He also supports three people in his family. Right now his monthly income from his business is KES 40,000.

He will be using the loan to expand his quarry business by buying more equipment so that he can increase his production. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to repay the loan and provide for his family.

This is his 1st loan term with VisionFund kenya and his future hopes are to open another business, support himself in agriculture farming and support his children.

loans.use: To buy quarry equipment to increase production

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline has a poultry farming business in Kangundo town. She also sells fruit, and it has been profitable. She is 58 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

She will be using this loan to buy poultry feed for poultry. She will also buy bananas and mangos to sell in her fruit selling business. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her grandchildren. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to see all her grandchildren educated.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed, as well as fruits to sell

loans.name: Fidele Rosaline

texts.fr: Fidèle est une jeune camerounaise de 25 ans, célibataire et mère d'une fille de 6 ans qui va à l'école. Elle possède et gère un kiosque dans un coin de la ville depuis 7 ans où elle vend des crédits de communications, biscuits, friandises, . Dynamique et accueillant, elle considère que son stock de crédits est déjà insuffisant pour sa clientèle grandissante. le crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter le crédit de communication en gros auprès de fournisseurs (grossistes d'Orange et de MTN). Les bénéfices escomptés vont lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et avoir un mini kiosque d'une part et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Fidèle is a young Cameroonian woman.  She is 25 years old, single and mother to a six-year-old girl who currently attends school.  She has owned and run a stall, in an area of the town, for seven years.  She sells telephone credits, biscuits and sweets.  Fidèle is dynamic and welcoming but she feels that her stock of telephone credits is much too low for the demands of her customers.

Fidèle has requested this loan in order to buy telephone credits from wholesale suppliers (Orange and MTN).  Her earnings will allow her to increase her working capital, buy a mini stall and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy phone credit.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary runs a hardware in Kitengela town. She sells welding materials, construction and plumbing materials, such as pipes, and the business has been profitable. She is 41 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children.

She will be using this loan to pay school fees for her child who is in high school. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to pay school fees. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she has paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hope is to become successful in her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a lady of 41 years, married to Edward and a mother of two children. She is a tailor, and also runs a dressmaking school in Kinoo, in the outskirts of Kangemi. She has been in this business for 14 years now, and gets a monthly income of 60,000 shillings.

This will be Faith's third loan with Vision Fund Kenya, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for dressmaking.  

In future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy materials for dress making.

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en:
Motaz is a 22-year-old single young man from Deri Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Motaz's father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all his needs. 

Motaz is a university student where he studies public relations and marketing in his last year. He would like to finish his study and find a good job to help his family in part of their expenses.
 
Motaz took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Motaz will be able to do his home work and complete his study easily.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 49 and has a shoe shining and shoe repair business. He has been in this business for 14 years and it has been profitable. Together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children.

He will be using this loan to boost his business by buying shoe shining materials such as brushes and several types of shoe polish. This will enable him to make more income to pay school fees for his children.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund kenya and he hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy shoe shining materials.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr: innocent est un homme de 30 ans, célibataire et père de 2 enfants. il possède et gère un cafétéria depuis 1 an dans un quartier de la ville. il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant des pattes, du lait, des œufs afin d'augmenter sa clientèle et d’accroître son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Innocent is a 30-year-old, single man who is father to two children.  He has owned and run a café in an area of his town for one year now.

He has requested this loan in order to build up his stocks of basic foodstuffs by buying pastes, milk and eggs.  This will help Innocent to build up a strong customer base and improve his business finances.

Innocent will use his earnings to reinvest in his business and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs for his café.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
