Stephen is 32 years old and married. Together with his spouse, they have been blessed with three children aged 9, 7 and 5 years old. He has a retail shop in Kangundo town. 

He will be using the loan to purchase sugar, salt, soap and plates for resale. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to save more and also to repay his loan.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid off his previous loan successfully. His future hope is to have a big business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, soap and plates for resale.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a 23-year-old hardworking woman, from the village of Matsimi. She lives with parents-in-law, brother-in-law, and husband, who works in the military service.  The family has some income from agricultural activity.  

Lela works hard on the family owned agricultural land, where maize and watermelon are grown. They sell these products. Accordingly, this family gets income seasonally, and Lela has a great desire to start an activity that will be a stable source of income for the family. 

With the requested money, she wants to purchase a high-pressure apparatus for car washing. She has already arranged the place, and will put in motion this service in the event of loan financing. 

The new business will give the family a chance to get financial stability and monthly income. 

Lela is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to do her bit for the family's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase a high-pressure apparatus for a car washing service

loans.name: Daisy Group

texts.en:
Lalthlamuani is a divorced mother living with her three children and one grandson in Aizawl, the capital state of Mizoram in the northeastern region of India. She is the featured borrower of Daisy group and is pictured with her hand raised. To raise three daughters and a grandson without a stable income isn’t an easy task, says Lalthlamuani. Her daughters help her in doing household chores as she is usually busy knitting clothes. 

Her main income generating source is knitting. She is well known for her fine knitting skill in her locality. She knits school uniform sweaters and ladies' sweaters. She has regular customers who come and place orders to knit different kinds of patterns and designs. Lalthlamuani’s eldest daughter helps her in selling the clothes that she has knitted and also engages in other garments-selling business to raise the household income, while her two younger sisters are still pursuing their studies in the pre-secondary level. 

With the WSDS loan, Lalthlamuani wants to expand her business by buying more knitting materials such as yarn, knitting sticks and a knitting machine so that she can continue this business further. She wishes to send her two daughters to a good university after they graduate from pre-secondary. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members are also engaged in petty shops, piggery and garment businesses.

loans.use: To purchase knitting materials.

loans.name: Weke Buke Group

texts.en:
Zaina is a business woman who manages her life by running a business selling fabrics. She is a married woman who ais in her mid 20s and has two children.  One child is in school.  She ihas worked in this business for ten years now, where she works from 8am to 6pm. Due to a competitive field and low capital, Zaina makes a very small profit per month. 

This is her fourth loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  Zaina is working hard to help her husband to make family life happier and better. Despite her low education and capital, she uses strong business relationships with her customer to win her share of business. 

She is a good customer of Tujijenge. Zaina used the previous loans to buy fabric to make her capital grow. She manage to pay back all of her previous loans successfully.  Zaina earned a profit which she used to cover part of her child's school fees and household expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a good house and improve her business.

Zaina will share this loan with her loan group "WEKE BUKE" which consist of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fabric.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis Mai 2010,est constitué de 23 membres qui sont tous de la même zone. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Fatou qui se tient debout a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans.Elle est mariée et mère d'une fille.Elle évolue dans le commerce de l'arachide.

Avec son financement,elle compte acheter 04 sacs d'arachide a 10000f l'un et les 10000 constituent les frais de transport.

Les objectifs visés pour son bénéfice sont de contribuer au besoin alimentaire,la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was founded in May 2010, and is made up of 23 members who all live in the same area.  Their main business activity is commerce.

Fatou (standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 51 years old, married and has one daughter.  She sells peanuts.

Fatou will use her loan to buy four sacks of peanuts for 10,000 francs CFA each, plus 10,000 francs CFA for transport costs.

Her intention is to use her profit to help provide for the food, health and schooling needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy sacks of peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a quarry business in Kangundo town.  She supplies building blocks to various construction sites and it has been profitable.  She is 41 years old and widowed, with one child.  Right now her monthly income is KES 35,000.

She will be using the loan to buy more quarrying equipment such as chisels. She will also employ more people so that the production can increase. She will use the anticipated profits to take her son to college.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to educate her son so that he can be successful and independent.

loans.use: To buy quarrying equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tissue-paper, soap, slippers, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Muthiani

texts.en:
Muthiani is 46 years old and runs a retail shop in Kangundo town. He has been in the business for 11 years. He is married and, together with his spouse,  has been blessed with four children, age 15, 12, 9 and 7 months old. His spouse also provides additional income and he is also a farmer.

He will be using the loan to purchase sugar, cooking fat and soap for resale. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to repay his loan and save more.

This is his fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hope is to expand his business and be successful and rich.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking fat and soap for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKADI est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  SOKOURANIDA de la ville de Koumantou. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  bananes à l’image de  KADIATOU qui est la 1ère femme assise devant  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 régimes de bananes avec les grossistes  de Koumantou. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de11.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is made up of seven married women, who are, on average, 32 years old, and have five children.  They all live in nuclear families in the Sokouranida district of the town of Koumantou.  They know one another through business, friendship and neighbourhood ties.

In order to strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their third loan.  The previous two loans were fully and correctly repaid.

The women sell bananas.  Kadiatou (sitting on the far right of the photo) also sells bananas.  She will use her loan to buy 30 bunches of bananas from wholesalers in Koumantou.  She sells the bananas at the market or from door-to-door, to various customers, for cash or on credit.  Kadiatou expects to earn a monthly average of 11,500 francs CFA which will be invested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Paskali is 58 years old and runs a retail shop. He has been in the business for 10 years now. He is married and, together with his spouse, they have been blessed with nine children. One is in school and the others are above 18 years old. His spouse also provides additional income. Right now his monthly income from his business is KES 10,500.

He will be using the loan to purchase more stock of flour, sugar, salt and milk for resale. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to save more and repay his loan.

This is his fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hope is to expand his business to wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, milk and flour for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man from Deir el Balah city.  He lives with his wife and two sons in a small, simple house. 

Mohammad works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income.  This income barely covers all of his needs.  Mohammad is also a university student where he studies science and is in his last year.  He would like to finish his study and find a good job to improve the family living conditions.  

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for school.  By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. 

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
Scott is now 24 years old and is happily married to Emily.  He is currently supporting his wife and his younger sister who live with him and his child.

His curio shop is doing well and currently, his income has increased to ten thousand shillings.

This will be Scott's third loan with Vision fund Kenya, he plans to use the entire loan to buy more curio handcrafts for resale.

He hopes to be a successful business man in future.

loans.use: to buy handcrafts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and gin for her business.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru: Мафтуна 24-летняя продавщица из района Шахритус. Она замужем и уже имеет двоих детей. Муж Мафтуны является мастером, предоставляющим услуги по ремонту домов. Сама Мафтуна занимается торговлей на местном рынке. Полтора года назад она начала свой маленький бизнес по купле и продаже лепешек и по сей день самостоятельно ведет этот бизнес. Мафтуна за счет прибыли с продаж помогает мужу в обеспечении семьи. Сейчас ей необходимо увеличить количество товара, чтобы продолжить деятельность. Для осуществления цели она просит кредит.
texts.en:
Maftuna is a 24-years-old saleswoman from the Shahrituz region. She is married and has two children. Maftuna's husband is a craftsman, offering services in home repair. Maftuna herself is engaged in trade in the local market. Eighteen months ago she started her own small business in buying and selling flatbreads and still runs this business on her own. From the profit from sales, Maftuna helps her husband to support the family.

Now she needs to increase the amount of goods to continue her activity. In order to achieve her goals, she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy and resell flatbreads

loans.name: Fassokanou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    FASSOKANOU est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  BAFARANI de la ville de Koumantou. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de MAMA qui est la 2ème femme assise  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 kg de maïs et 150 kg de mil avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Fassokanou Group is made up of four married women who are, on average, 24 years old, and have three children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the Bafarani district of the town of Koumantou.  They know one another through business, friendship and neighbourhood ties.

In order to strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, the women have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their first loan as a group.  

The women sell cereals.  Mama (sitting second from the right in the photo) also sells cereals.  She will use her loan to buy 150 kg of maize and 150 kg of millet from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She sells her products at the market and from door-to-door, to various customers, for cash or on credit.

Mama expects to earn a monthly average of 21,000 francs CFA, which she will invest in her business and use to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She has a tailoring business, which she has been doing for five years. Her spouse also provides additional income. 

Margret is requesting her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy thread, buttons, and textile materials for sewing. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to save more and repay her loan. In the future, she hopes to have a big tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет и работает в городе Павлоград, Днепропетровской области. Она торгует женским и мужским спортивным трикотажем на одном из местных рынков.  Опыт работы – 17 лет, бизнес налаженный. 
Наталья планирует вложить 8 000 гривен в закупку мужских и женских спортивных костюмов, курток и толстовок для реализации этой весной.  Весь товар, в основном, производства Турции и Китай.
texts.en:
Nataliya lives and works in the town of Pavlograd, in the Dneprotrovsk region. She sells women's and men's sports knitwear in one of the local markets. Her work experience is 17 years; this is an established business.

Nataliya plans to invest 8,000 hryvnia to purchase men's and women's sports suits, jackets and hoodies for sale this spring. This inventory, is mainly produced in Turkey and China.

loans.use: to purchase sportswear, jackets and hoodies

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    KANOU est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  TABAKORO de la ville de Koumantou. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  bananes à l’image de KADIA qui est la 3ème femme assise  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50 kg de riz avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 6.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kanou Group is made up of six married women who are, on average, 33 years old and have three children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the Tabakoro district of the town of Koumantou.  They know one another through business, friendship and neighbourhood ties.

In order to strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, the women have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their first group loan.

The women sell bananas.  Kadia (sitting third from the left in the photo) also sells bananas.  She will use her loan to buy 50 kg of rice from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She sells her product at the market and from door-to-door, to various customers, for cash or on credit.

Kadia expects to earn a monthly average of 6,500 francs CFA, which she will invest in her business and use to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 41 years old and does farming in Kangundo town. His wife also helps him in farming, and they have been blessed with three children, aged 14, 12 and 10 years old. Right now, his monthly income from his business is 33,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

He will be using the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and goats to add onto what he already has. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and repay his loan.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he repaid his previous loan successfully. His hopes in the future are to become a large-scale farmer and give his children a good education up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and goats.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her father appears in the photo.

Israa is a 19-year-old single young lady from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Israa's father works as an employee in a local firm, where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all the family needs. 

Israa is a university student and studies commerce. She would like to finish her studies and find a good job to improve the family's living conditions.
 
Israa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Israa will be able to do her  homework and write the reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Manal is a 20-year-old single young lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Manal's father works as an employee in a local firm, where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all the family needs. 

Manal is a university student studying elementary education. She would like to finish her studies and find a good job as a teacher.

Manal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Manal will be able to do her  homework and write the reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Dúo Nuevo Gotita De Cielo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Gotita de Cielo
Este dúo está integrado por doña María Consuelo, tiene 32 años de edad, se dedica a hacer manualidades para fiestas de cumpleaños, ella  está solicitando el crédito para la inversión,en compra de materiales,  para diseñar sus arreglos, ya que con el capital que cuenta no le es suficiente para cubrir sus pedidos, ya que son diseños que entregan sus manualidades  a cada ocho días, el deseo de ella es encontrar más tiendas en donde ella pueda entregar sus manualidades y darse a conocer, y espera mejorar cada día el ingreso de su hogar para apoyar a sus esposos en los gastos de su familia, sobre todo que sus hijos tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
Gotita de Cielo Duo

María Consuelo is a member of this duo. She is 32 years old. She makes a living making handicrafts for birthday parties. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to plan her arrangements since the capital that she has is not sufficient to cover her orders since she has plans to deliver her handicrafts every eight days. 

Her wish is to find more stores where she can deliver her handicrafts and make herself known, and she hopes to every day improve her home’s income to support her husband in the family expenses, and over all that her children have that which is necessary.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the production of piñatas.

loans.name: Tomash

texts.ru:
Томаш – из Берегово. Он работает слесарем на местном заводе. Более того, как фермер, разводит свиней. Томаш и его семья живут в собственном одноэтажном доме. 
Сумма в 24 000 гривен нужна Томашу для того, чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия. Он давно хотел утеплить свое жилье, так как заметил, сколько средств уходит на отопление внутренних помещений. Поэтому планирует вложить полученные от КИВА средства в замену окон и теплоизоляцию стен снаружи, создав, таким образом, более комфортные условия для проживания своей семьи и сэкономив на расходах на электроэнергию.
texts.en:
Tomash is from Beregovo. He works as a machinist in a local factory . Beyond that, as a farmer, he raises pigs. Tomash and his family live in their own one-story home.

Tomash needs a sum of 24,000 hryvnia in order to improve his living conditions. He has long wanted to insulate his home, a he has noticed how much money he spends on heating the interior of the premises. Therefore, he plans to invest the funds from Kiva in replacing windows and insulating the outside walls, creating in this way more comfortable conditions for his family and savings on energy costs.

loans.use: to insulate his house

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and has a retail shop that she has been running for two years now. She is married, and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with six children. She has been in the business for two years, and right now, her monthly income from her business is 27,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She is also a farmer.

She will be using her loan to purchase more stock of sugar, salt, soap and milk for resale in her retail shop. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay her loan.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hope is to educate her children to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as sugar, salt, soap and milk for resale

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a farmer in Kangundo town where she keeps livestock and grows crops for selling. She is 42 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. Her spouse also provides additional income. She has been in the business for 15 years and right now her monthly income from her business is 21,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She also has a grocery business.

She will be using the loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale in her grocery store. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay for the school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future, Annah hopes to construct a permanent place for storing cattle feed and to buy dairy cattle.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John does farming in Oloitoktok town, where he grows crops for resale. He has been in this business for six years now, and it has been profitable. He is 46 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with six children.

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loan successfully. His future hope is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ma. Joramie

texts.en:
Ma. Joramie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Joramie is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ma. Joramie has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Ma. Joramie requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like shells, wire, etc., for her business.

Ma. Joramie has been in this business for 15 years. Ma. Joramie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like shells, wire, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cash crop seeds like cashew nuts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, viene de una familia muy humilde que con sacrificio salió adelante y está cumpliendo sus metas-
Está casada y cuenta que su esposo siempre le ha apoyado en todo y que gracias a ello también está estudiando. Sigue la carrera de escribanía, con lo cual espera realizarse como persona y también como profesional. 
Su sueño es poder terminar la carrera y comenzar a trabajar y de esa forma ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de universidad , como ser copias, libros y demás, y también para sus gastos de transporte.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of Caacupé. She comes from a very humble family that, with sacrifices, came out ahead and is reaching its goals.

She is married and says that her husband has always supported her in everything, and that also thanks to him she is studying. She is continuing to study for the notary public career, with which she hopes to find herself as a person and also as a professional.

Her dream is to be able to finish her studies and begin to work and so be a professional who is useful to society.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in paying her university expenses, such as copies, books, and more, and also for her transportation expenses.

loans.use: for university and transportation expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ladies' slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she will buy pepper, red oil and pumpkin to resell.

loans.name: Mikhailo

texts.ru:
Михаил – мелкий предприниматель на рынке города Хуст. Он занимается торговлей мужской обувью уже около 10 лет. Место на рынке арендует, пока выкупить не может. Работает на собственном микроавтобусе «спринтер». Недавно Михаил сделал в доме, где живет его семья, посильный ремонт, значительно улучшив условия проживания. 
Сумма в 8 000 гривен необходима Михаилу для того, чтобы приобрести партию весенней мужской обуви для реализации этой весной. Полученные средства будут вложены в развитие бизнеса. В будущем Михаил мечтает накопить достаточно средств, чтобы обеспечить своим детям, которым сейчас 13 и 14 лет, достойное образование.
texts.en:
Mikhail is a small-scale entrepreneur in a market in the town of Khust. He has been trading men's shows for about ten years. He is renting his spot in the market while he is unable to buy it out. He works on his own Sprinter microbus. Mikhail recently made feasible repairs in the home where his family lives, significantly improving living conditions.

Mikhail needs a sum of 8,000 hryvnia in order to purchase a parcel of spring men's shoes for sale this spring. The earned income will be put into developing the business. In the future, Mikhail dreams of saving enough money to support his children, who are now 13 and 14 years old, with a decent education.

loans.use: to stock up on shoes for subsequent resale

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она торгует на крупном местном рынке женской трикотажной одеждой. Торговое место у нее собственное, что помогает существенно экономить на арендной плате. Работает в этой сфере торговли уже давно, около 17 лет. Людмиле – 54 года, она вдова, у нее 4 взрослых детей. 
Людмиле нужна сумма в 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар, а именно, сарафаны, блузы и весенние трикотажные изделия на продажу. Несмотря на периодические спады торговли, связанные с сезонными факторами или политическими событиями в стране, Людмила не сдается и продолжает усердно трудиться, чтобы поддерживать свой бизнес и обеспечивать себя и свою семью всем необходимым.
texts.en:
Ludmila is an entrepreneur from Melitopol. She trades women's knitted clothing at a large local market. She has her own trading spot which helps her save significantly on rent. She has been working in this sphere of trade already for 17 years. Ludmila is 54 years old, a widow, and has four grown children.

Ludmila needs a sum of 12,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seasonal goods, and specifically, sundresses, blouses and spring knitted clothing for sale. Despite periodic setbacks in trade, connected with seasonal factors or political events in the country, Ludmila has not given up and continues to work hard in order to maintain her business and support herself and her family with all the necessities.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Kinole Group

texts.en:
Zaituni, who is in her late fifties, is a widow with five children, and only one is still at school. The rest are grown-ups. She has been running a fruits and vegetables business for ten years now. She works from 4:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Zaituni's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her genge stock, and now the genge has a good stock and can meet the customers' demands. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for supporting their group. She used the profit to install electricity in her house, bought a TV set and sofa set, paid school fees and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to restock the missing items in the genge shop. She dreams of building another house.

Zaituni will share this loan with her loan group "Kinole", which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her genge (grocery) shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 34-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married to Emely, and they have four children, aged 9, 7, 5 and 2 years old respectively. He is a dairy farmer, a business he has done for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

He is taking a first loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase more animal feed so that his cows can produce more milk for resale to the villagers. He plans to use the profits for improving the lives of his family members.

His dream is to own many cows and produce milk in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed for his cows.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old, married to Ernest and, together, they are blessed with four children, two of whom are in school.

Grace is in a farming business, something she has been practicing for 15 years. She has applied for a third loan from VisionFund Kenya to add to her saved money in order to purchase land. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy a cow.

In the near future, Grace hopes to apply for bigger loans from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner, and has a buy-and-sell scrap materials business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Marilou requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда уже пользовалась финансовой помощью КИВА. Полученные ранее средства помогли Надежде улучшить состояние бизнеса, так как она смогла существенно расширить выбор товара у себя на точке. Более того, Надежда смогла за счет повышения количества реализованного товара увеличить и собственный доход. 
Надежда планирует осуществить закупку дополнительной партии товара под реализацию, а именно, мужского белья, носков, колгот и тапочек на сумму в 13 000 гривен.  Увеличив объемы реализованного товара, она сможет увеличить и свой доход, а, значит, и вложить в бизнес и потратить дополнительные средства на семью.
texts.en:
Nadezhda has already used the financial support of Kiva. The previously received money helped Nadezhda to improve business conditions, since she was able to significantly increase the choice of goods in her stall. Moreover, Nadezhda was able to increase the amount of goods sold and her own income.

Nadezhda plans to purchase an additional batch of goods for sale, and specifically, men's underwear, socks, stockings and flip flips for 13,000 hryvnia. Increasing the volume of goods sold, she can also increase her income, and hence to invest in the business and to spend additional money on the family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, specifically men's underwear, socks, stockings, and flip flops

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на местном рынке, продает женскую и мужскую одежду. У Натальи есть свое собственное торговое место. Работает в этой сфере она уже около 10 лет. 
Наталье необходима сумма в 25 000 гривен, чтобы закупить сезонную женскую одежду, а именно футболки, кофты, халаты и белье для реализации на рынке весной. Она планирует развивать свой бизнес и дальше, а также улучшать быт своей семьи за счет полученной от своего бизнеса дохода.
texts.en:
Natalya lives and works in Melitopol. She trades in a local market, selling women's and men's clothing. Natalya has her own trading spot. She has been working in this sphere already for ten years.

Natalya needs a sum of 25,000 hryvnia, in order to buy seasonal women's clothing, and namely t-shirts, sweaters, bathrobes and linens for sale in the market during spring. She plans to develop her business even further, and thus to improve the life of her family resulting from her business income.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 52 years old lady, married to Martin who is a farmer.  They have five children aged 26, 23,19,10 and 7 years old. Sylvia sells bicycle spare parts - a business she’s done for 15 years now, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is taking her first loan with Vision fund Kenya of KES 10,000 to use to buy more cartons of spare parts and lubricant oils for bicycles.  She will use her profits to repay her loan.

She has a dream of selling spare parts for motorcycle and vehicles.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts in bulk to sell to the people who repair bicycles in Usenge market.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 41-year-old lady, married to John, who is a farmer. They have three children, aged 12, 10 and 7 years old respectively. She operates a retail shop, a business she’s done for five years now. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is taking loan of KES 20,000, her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, to buy sacks of foodstuffs and other goods. She will use her profits to expand her shop.

She has a dream of owning a wholesale business and bringing up a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of sugar, boxes of sweets, soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Medarda works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Medarda is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell through her vending business.

Medarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, Maggi cubes, bitter ball, etc.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 43-year-old from the Kisumu City, which is located in the Nyanza part of Kenya. She is married and has one child, aged 14 years old.

She operates a general store and mobile money transfer business, which she has been operating for the last 20 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Roselyne has applied for her fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to expand the business by adding more stock and increasing her mobile money transfer cash float. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Her dream is to have a stable family and continue to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to expand the business by adding more stock and increasing her mobile money transfer cash float.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 45-year-old lady from Migori. She is married to James, who is a civil servant, and they have five children, aged 20, 16, 12, 10 and 7 years old respectively. She sells sportswear and equipment, a business she’s done for five years now. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is taking a loan of KES 20,000, her sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya, to buy more sportswear and equipment. She will use her profits to expand her shop.

She has a dream of owning a mega-shop to enable her to supply the whole region.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of sportswear to resell to different schools in the region.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy works hard to support her family.  Nancy is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Nancy requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.  Nancy has been in this business for 12 years now.

Nancy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, Vita, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tegla

texts.en:
Tegla is 41 years old and supports two of her children who are aged 25 and 15 years.  She sells fruits and vegetables in Kabarnet market and has been in operation for a period of over 10 years earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

With her first term loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, she intends to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.  The profits she earns will be used to educate her children.

Her dream is to expand her current business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is now 41 years old, happily married and his family of 6 members is doing well.  

Reuben still does his photography work in Kabarnet Town and his income has improved to KES 20,000 per month.

With his seventh term loan of KES 78,000 from Vision Fund Kenya he intends to use this amount to expand his photography business by buying more films and paper for printing the photos.  With the profits he earns he uses the amount to improve the living standards and repay the loan.

His dream is to excel in his business.

loans.use: To expand his current business

loans.name: Pritse

texts.en:
Pritse is 32 years old and married with one child.  With one child currently in school, Pritse works very hard to provide for them.

Pritse runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.  Pritse has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, beers, snack foods, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Pritse would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jovica

texts.en:
Jovica is a 31-year-old male who is still single and living with his entire family.  He lives with his parents in an area where the unemployment rate is very high and the majority of the population lives under very poor conditions.  Jovica’s mother is a house -wife and his father receives a pension.  Jovica is a very hard worker who likes his work as a camera-man in a private TV station and is proud to contribute to his family’s needs.  His salary is much needed by the family, since like most people living in Kosovo, the salaries are very low and the cost of living is high. 

His family has not been able to façade their house as all the money needs to go to living on a daily basis or for some other type of unexpected emergency. In an effort to help create a healthier and more comfortable living environment for his family, Jovica is requesting a loan to façade and insulate the house, which will also save them money on the heating costs in the winter.  He is really grateful all of the help from the lenders.

loans.use: To insulate and façade house

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 56 years old, married and supports her two children, aged 16 and 14 years old.  She has been selling fruits and vegetables for a period of over 14 years, earning an income of KES 15,000 monthly.

With her first-term loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya, Jane wishes to purchase more stock of mangoes and tomatoes, among other fruits for resale. The profits she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for resale.

loans.name: Yuri Johanna

texts.es:
Ella es en la infancia fue una niña de grandes talentos y habilidades, le gustaba mucho el baile, era muy dinámica y siempre compartía con la familia, es la tercera de cuatro hijos, fiel compañera de la madre, en la adolescencia vivió una etapa muy fuerte por la pérdida del padre, de hay la vida cambio mucho, se volvió una mujer fuerte y con ganas de cumplir todas las metas propuestas sin importar los obstáculos que se iba encontrando en el camino, en la madurez ha sido una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, ha tenido varios tropiezos en la vida como la pérdida de las 2 hijas que era lo que ella mas deseaba en la vida, pero que aun así sigue luchando por los sueños y las metas que es crear una nueva familia con el esposo, tener hijos y poder terminar la carrera que  siempre le ha gustado que es la enfermería, para así ejercerla y brindarle a la familia y a la comunidad protección y ayuda para un mejor futuro. 
Ahora después de haber hecho el primer semestre de enfermería se da cuenta que es lo que en realidad quiere, le gusta la enfermería, ya que es una vocación con la cual nació y quiere tener la oportunidad de terminar los estudios para así poder ejercer lo que ella siempre ha querido. 
En este momento seria de gran ayuda el convenio de kiva para que el valor de las cuotas mensuales le quede un poco más económico, ya que el valor que esta cancelando normal es un poco costoso.
texts.en:
As a child, Yuri was a very talented and skilled girl. She enjoyed dancing, was very dynamic and spent a lot of time with her family. She is the third of four children and a faithful companion to her mother. Yuri had a difficult time in her teens when her father died. Life changed a lot and Yuri became a strong woman with a desire to achieve all of her goals, regardless of the obstacles that she meets on her path. As an adult, Yuri has been plucky and hard-working. She has had various setbacks in life, including the deaths of two daughters, children she had so wanted in life. Yuri continues to fight for her dreams and goals, which are to have a family with her husband and to have children. She also wants to finish her studies in nursing - a subject she has always liked - and to practise her profession and give her family and the community help and protection so as to have a better future.

After having completed her first semester, Yuri realises that this is what she really wants to do. She enjoys nursing as it is her calling. She would like to have the opportunity to be able to finish her studies and practise her profession.

At this time, this Kiva loan would be of great help to Yuri as it will be a little easier to make the monthly repayments than making the full payment which is quite expensive.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for one semester.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo tiene una edad de 42, trabajadora y muy luchadora que con el esfuerzo de ella y su esposo han podido salir adelante enfrentando las diferentes dificultades en la realidad de nuestro país, precios de los insumos altos, baja de precio del café, mano de obra cara, entre otros que por la falta de empleo suelen aprovecharse. Ella es casada y de su hogar tiene 2 hijos pequeños quienes trabajan con su padre en sus parcelas de tierra cultivada de café dando la atención de limpieza, aplicación de fertilizantes, abono, entre otros. Su familia es muy unida y ambos en compañía de sus dos hijos luchan para salir adelante y seguir fortaleciendo el patrimonio, de la misma forma enseña a sus hijos el valor y sacrificio que ellos hacen diariamente para salir adelante. A pesar de su humilde economía y descendencia son una familia muy amable y educada. Doña Consuelo es una mujer muy respetada en la comunidad, su nivel de estudio es de primaria incompleta la cual curso hasta el cuarto grado siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar a temprana edad. Ellos cuenta con manzanas de tierra en producción y están cultivando más, misma que está ubicada contiguo a su casa de habitación permitiendo esto una mejor atención a sus cultivos.
Sus sueños son superarse como familia, darles una mejor educación a sus 2 hijos para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida en su futuro y enseñarles a trabajar. Por lo que actualmente Doña Consuelo solicita ayuda para poder satisfacer su necesidad la compra de abono, fertilizantes, foliares para así poder atender sus cultivos de café y poder mejorar el ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 42 years old and is very hard-working and plucky. She and her husband have made an effort to get ahead and face the different difficulties - such as the high price of supplies, low coffee prices, expensive labourers and more - which are a reality here in Honduras. Consuelo is married and has two young children who work with their father on the plots of land growing coffee, cleaning the crops and applying fertilisers, manure and other products. Consuelo's family is very close and she and her husband fight alongside their children in order to prosper and to strengthen their inheritance. Consuelo is also teaching her children values and sacrifice, which they do every day in order to get ahead. In spite of her poor financial situation, the family is a happy and well-brought-up one. Consuelo is well-respected in the community. She completed only up to four grade at primary school while her parents taught her to work from a young age. Consuelo and her husband a plot of land where they grow their crops. This land is close to their home, allowing them to look after their crops well.

Consuelo's dreams are to prosper with her family and to give her two children a better up-bringing so that they may enjoy a better quality of life in the future. She also wants to teach them how to work. Consuelo is currently applying for a loan in order to buy manure and fertilisers in order to look after her coffee crops better and thus to increase her income for the family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to give excellent care to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Marta Corina

texts.es:
Marta Corina es una joven, casada y con tres hijos que residen en la ciudad de condega a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, ella vive en su propia casa de habitación junto a sus 2 hijos desde hace más 15 años.

La joven Marta Corina se desempeña como obrera en una fábrica de puros en este municipio en el área de producción en la elaboración de puros, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes para poder tener un ingreso fijo y así poder sustentar los gastos familiares, su esposo trabaja como obrero en el país vecino de costa rica y el también ayuda en el sustento de su familia.

Esta clienta se presentó  a las oficinas de ceprodel con el fin de solicitar nuevamente un financiamiento para poder comprar 10 láminas de zinc y así poder reparar el techo de su casa ya que por cuenta propia ella no puede comprarlo porque sus ingresos son bajos, de serle aprobado el financiamiento ella podrá mejorar su casa de habitación y de esta manera ella les dará una mejor condición de vida a su familia.

Ella ya ha tenido 10 ciclos crediticios en ceprodel y los ha pagado bien y se muestra muy agradecida con la institución ya que así ella ha podido ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta Corina is a young woman who is married with three children and they live in the city of Condega, about 35km north of the city of Estelí. She has lived in her own house with her children for more than 15 years. Marta Corina works in a cigar factory in the municipality, in the cigar production area. She works Monday to Friday so she can have a regular income and so cover the family's living costs. Her husband works as a workman in the neighbouring country of Costa Rica and also contributes to his family's upkeep. 

Marta Corina visited Ceprodel's offices to ask for a new loan to buy 10 zinc sheets so she can repair the roof of her house. She does not have enough money of her own to buy the zinc because she is on a low income. Once the loan is approved she will be able to improve her house and so provide her family with better living conditions. She has had 10 loan cycles with Ceprodel and has paid them all off properly. She is very grateful to the institution as it has helped her to continue to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a 33-year-old single mother of one beautiful child aged 3 years old.

She has a boutique business in Ndunyu Njeru, which she has been running for two years. She has applied for this first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy a stock of clothes to sell. With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her baking business.

In the near future, she hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 37 years old, married, and has one child. She is from Kakamega. Her husband is a businessman. She sells new clothes, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Dorothy is requesting her second loan from VisionFund Kenya for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bales of new clothes to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more clothes and repay her loan. Her dream is to become a wholesaler and raise a stable family.

loans.use: to purchase bales of new clothes to sell

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Carla del Socorro es madre soltera de una hija que estudia la universidad, la señora tiene un puesto de comida en el mercado desde hace 20 años, empezó su negocio como ayudante de cocina en el negocio de su mamá y luego ella decidió ahorrar para independizarse con su propio negocio, labora fuertemente de lunes a domingo para el sustento de su hogar. solicita el financiamiento  para compra de granos básicos e ingredientes para su negocio.
texts.en: Carla del Socorro is a single mother to one daughter who studies at university. She has had a food stall in the market for twenty years. She began her business as a kitchen assistant in her mother's business and then she decided to save to go independent with her own business. She works hard from Monday to Sunday to support her household. She's requesting the loan to buy basic grains and ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, sauces, vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a single lady of thirty nine years old. She does not have any children but supports her mother.

She is still selling second-hand clothes, and her income is fifty thousand shillings.

This will be Sabina's seventh loan with Vision Fund Kenya, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy a new stock of clothes for her business. In the future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Marina

texts.es:
María Marina es una joven de 21 años de edad, muy trabajadora y con deseos de superarse. Es una persona humilde y muy respetada en su comunidad la cual está casada y vive junto a su esposo y su única hija quien esta pequeña y aun  no asiste a la escuela. Ambos trabajan en la caficultura y demás cultivos como la siembra de maíz y frijol. Desde pequeña le gusto trabajar la agricultura con sus padres siendo ellos quienes le inculcaran el oficio ya que después de cursar su primaria completa no pudieron seguir apoyándole para que continuara ya que los recursos económicos no eran los mejores. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 3 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa habitación a los cuales se trasladan caminando para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.
Sus sueños y esperanzas buscar la superación cada día, salir adelante a pesar de los diferentes obstáculos y aprovechar cada oportunidad que se le es presentada para crecer. Como madre de familia apoyar a su hija en todo lo necesario, darle la oportunidad de estudiar para que ella pueda tener un mejor futuro y una mejor condición de vida. María Marina actualmente solicita apoyo financiero ya que necesita asistir sus cultivos de café esperando ser apoyada por los inversionistas en la plataforma KIVA para cubrir la necesidad de comprar fertilizantes, abono, foliares, entre otros que ayudaran al cuidado y desarrollo de sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
María Marina is a 21 year old young woman. She is very hard working and has a desire to get ahead. She is a humble and very respected person in her community who is married and lives with her husband and their only daughter who is small and does not yet attend school. Both work at farming coffee as well as other crops like maize and beans. Since she was young, she liked working in agriculture with her parents since they introduced this job to her since after finishing elementary school they could not keep supporting her to continue school since their economic resources weren't the best. Her coffee crops are located 3km distance from her house which she walks to in order to tend and maintain the plants.

Her dreams and hopes are to look to overcome each day, to get ahead despite the different obstacles and take advantage of each opportunity that is presented to her to grow. As a mother, to support her daughter in everything necessary and give her the opportunity to study so she can have a better future and a better quality of life. Maria Marina currently is requesting the financial support since she needs to attend to her coffee crops and is hoping to be supported by the investors on the Kiva platform to cover the need to buy fertilizers, among other items that will help with the care and development of her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Meet Cosmas, a resident of the Kisii area of Nyanza, Kenya! 

He is a family man with 4 children. He is also a farmer who has been farming for 15 years, with his primary income source being eggs, milk, and a retail shop that he has. In farming, he enjoys feeding the cows and milking. His biggest challenge is that farming costs are very high at times.

Cosmas says that he chose Juhudi Kilimo to finance him because it is an institution with the efficient tools required to help farmers to improve their livelihoods. He says that this loan will improve his family's living conditions, and help to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 34 years old. He is married to Naomi and together they have two children aged six and three years old.

He operates a motorcycle transport business as well as assisting his wife to run their busy stall in the market. The business deals with the sale of household goods as well as school uniforms. Paul learnt about Vision Fund via electronic media.

He has been advanced a fourth loan of KES 100,000 which he will use to restock the stall with metallic household goods. He will use the proceeds to buy another motorbike for his transport business. 

He hopes to educate his children to higher levels of learning, and his dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to restock his wife's retail stall

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 51-year-old lady from Kakamega County. She is a widow with five children, ages 18 16, 14, 11 and 4. She operates a grocery store business.  She has done this for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She is taking her fourth loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she intends to use to expand her business by adding more stock of fruits and vegetables and part of it to educate her children. The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay the loan and add more shares to VisionFund Kenya.

Her dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to resell to her clients.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
This is Faiza. Her previous loan was a big help since she managed to renovate her residential house. She thanks Kiva lenders for boosting her business.

She would like to apply for a loan of KSHS 50,000, to buy more stock of nails and bicycle tires for her spare parts business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs .

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of nails and bicycle tires for her spare parts business.

loans.name: Kokatia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    KOKATIA est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  SOKOURANIDA de la ville de Koumantou. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des habits à l’image de BALAKISSA qui est la 1ère femme assise devant  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 6 pièces de pagnes  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Kokatia group is composed of four married women. On the average, they are 25 years  p;d, with six children. They live in nuclear families in the Sokouranida district of the town of Koumantou. They know each other as neighbors and friends and through their work. In order to bolster their financial capacity and better manage their business, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their third loan. The second prior loans have been duly reimbursed. The group members sells clothing, which is the case of Balakissa, for example. She is the first one seated from right to left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy six sets of traditional colorful “pagnes” fabric from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells at the market and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientnele. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 10,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and pay off her loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Dúo El Guite Group

texts.es: Dúo el Guite este dúo esta conformado por la señora Ana Leticia de 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de papas fritas desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para elaborar papas fritas, ya que su sueño acorto plazo es tener un negocio mas grande y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: One of the members of the "Dúo el Guite" group is Ana Leticia who is 30 years old. She has been selling french fries for several years. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to make french fries. Her short term dream is to expand her business and be able to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and materials to sell french fries.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a lady of twenty eight years. She is married to James and she sells stationery in Kiambu. She has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of fifty five thousand shillings.

This will be Magdaline's first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy more stock of pens, books, rubber stamps, etc. for her business. 

In the future, she wants to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to purchase books, pens, files, envelopes, etc.

loans.name: Abi

texts.en:
Abi is a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been in banana production, a business that she has been operating for six years as she obtains additional income from trade. She started her business to get more income from scarcity of food due to increasing population and demand in the area. She is faced with hardships of banana wilt disease, and lack of capital to expand her banana plantation to a large farm and buy fertilizers. 
Abi intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 43 years old and the father of six.  He started his business of selling clothes and textiles with a capital of 500,000 UGX and now he has 3,000,000 UGX worth of stock.  He faces the challenge of changes in tastes and preference of clients and his aspiration is owning a large retail shop with many varieties to suit different tastes.  James is requesting for a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a thirty one year-old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy another motorcycle. He also owns a salon for additional income that has helped him to support and provide for his family. He also has a few rentals located near the university that he dreams of expanding although he is limited by inadequate capital. John has requested for a loan to renovate his rentals.

loans.use: to renovate his rentals.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married and has two children, one adult and one who goes to school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Mwanaidi operates a cafe business making consumables like rice, tea, beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbours. She says seasonality is her major challenge.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, rice, beans, utensils and maize flour for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, rice, beans, utensils and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Caridad Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora caridad del Carmen en una señora que se dedica al comercio y reside en la ciudad de condega a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, ella tiene más de 60 años de vivir en esta dirección en su propia casa de habitación siendo una señora muy conocida por los vecinos.

Doña caridad se ha dedicado al comercio desde hace muchos años, en la actualidad ella alquila varios módulos en su casa de habitación a otros pequeños negocios, además ella también compra ropa interior para damas  de marca fina y ella los revende a una buena clientela que ella tiene.

Ella se muestra bastante positiva que el crédito le será aprobado y de esta manera ella podrá aumentar su inventario de mercadería y por ende aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Ella ha tenido 4 ciclos crediticios en ceprodel y dichos financiamiento le han ayudado muchos por lo que se muestra agradecida con la institución.
texts.en:
Cardidad del Carmen has a business and lives in the city of Condega, some 35 kilometres north of the city of Estelí. Caridad has been living in her house - which she owns - for over sixty years and she is well-known by her neighbours.

Cardidad has made a living from her business for many years. She currently rents out various rooms in her house to other small businesses and, in addition she buy branded women's underwear to sell to a number of customers.

Carmen says that she is very positive about her loan being approved and, with it, she will be able to increase her stock and therefore her sales and income. Carmen has had four loans from "Ceprodel" and they have helped her a lot. She is therefor grateful to the organisation.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 45 years old, married to Titus, and supports a family of four. She runs a butcher shop in the Kapsabet area. This has been her income generating business for the last 15 years and she gets an average monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

She has borrowed a loan of 40,000 KES, this being her third loan after paying the previous loans successfully.  She plans to use the amount borrowed of  40,000 KES to purchase animals for slaughter. She will use the profits from the business to pay her children’s school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase animals for slaughter

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a thirty-nine-year-old man. He is married to Christine and together they have three children. 

He operates a taxi business in Kangemi and he has been in this business for thirteen years now, getting a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.

This will be Charles' second loan with Vision Fund Kenya, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy cooking oil, charcoal, baking flour, etc.

In the future, he wants to be a successful business man.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour, charcoal, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Dúo Unidos Por La Paz Group

texts.es: Dúo Unidos por la paz este dúo esta conformado por la señora Magdalena de 45 años de edad ella se ha dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 12 años, gracias a su negocio a podido salir adelante ella y su familia, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa ya que el anhelo de ella es poder aumentar el capita para mejorar un poco mas sus ventas,es el primer credito que solicita a Kiva y promete ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en: The "Unidos por la paz" duo has 45-year-old Magdalena as one of its members. She has been making a living selling clothes for 12 years. Thanks to her business, she has been able to prosper with her family. On this occasion she is applying for a loan in order to buy clothes and she would like to increase her capital in order to improve her sales a little. This is Magdalena's first loan with Kiva and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 56 years old from Nakuru. She is widowed and a mother of one child, age 29 years old.

She is a farmer; a business she has been running for the last 14 years. To enable her to buy a water storage tank, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,400 from VisionFund Kenya. This will allow her to find enough time to work on her farm for more yields, since the water problem will have been solved.

Her monthly income right now is KES 10,000, and her plan is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya and expand her business further.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy a water storage tank.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has a rental housing business and has been running it for ten years now. She is 45 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with five children. She currently makes a monthly income of KES 20,000, and her business has been profitable. 

She will be using this loan to buy building materials for building more rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another plot of land. 

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya; she has repaid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to buy more plots of land.

loans.use: to buy building materials like stones, cement and iron sheets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is now 62 years old. She has a clothes-selling business in Kangundo town. She used her previous loan to purchase more clothes to resell in her business, like shirts, blouses, and skirts and her business has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to pay school fees for her child, who is in college. She plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to educate her son. 

This is Mary's third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has been successfully paying her previous loans. In the future, Mary hopes to grow her business and to be successful.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child, who is in college.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
Raymundo es un señor casado 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus ocho hijos de los cuales son: dos hombres y seis mujeres, ambos viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Don Raymundo es un hombre trabajador. Comenta que se dedica al cultivo de arveja china y brócoli y lo realiza a pocos metros de su vivienda. Eligió esta linda actividad, porque es rentable y productiva ya que tiene una fuerte demanda  este producto. A través de la labor que realiza obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias, es así como puede aportar  a la economía de su familia.
Ahora lleva ya quince años de trabajar en esta área, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de semillas de arveja y productos agrícolas, de esta manera podrá cultivarlo y comercializarlo, con el propósito de mejorar su economía.
Su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno en donde puede cultivar más arveja y brócoli para comercializarlo a diferentes lugares, solo de esta manera mejorara las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Raymundo is a 55 year old married man. He lives with his wife and 8 children, 2 boys and 6 girls, in the Department of Sololá. Raymundo is a hard-working man. He comments that he farms green peas and broccoli a few meters from his house. He choose this activity because it is profitable and productive as there is high demand for this product. Through his labor he makes good revenues and so he can support the family economy. He has been working in this field for 15 years. 

Raymundo is requesting a loan of 10,000 GTQ to purchase pea seeds and agricultural products so that he can grow them and sell them with the goal of improving his finances. His big dream is to buy some land where he can grow more peas and broccoli to sell in different places, in this way improving the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and agricultural products.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a very happy farmer living in Kisii, a very fertile area indeed.  He is married and has eight children.  He lives a very humble life with his children and some grandchildren who all depend on him.  He is practices mixed farming where he produces and sells milk, tea, sugarcane, bananas and maize.  He also has a transportation business with a motorbike.

Elijah chose Juhudi Kilimo because he believes that they will help him improve his living standards.  He believes that this loan will help him uplift his family's living standards and also assist with his children's education fees.  He appreciates Juhudi for their satisfactory service.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is a married mother of two children, one is an adult and one is in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanasiti prepares snacks using sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 66-year-old lady from Kakamega County who has two children, aged 27 and 29 years respectively.

She sells maize and has been doing so for the past year. She earns an average income of KES 3,000 per month. 

She is taking her first loan of KES 5,000 with VisionFund Kenya to be used in expanding her business by adding more cereals for resale. The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some savings.

Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding more cereals for resale

loans.name: Nsuari

texts.en: Nsuari appreciates her previous Kiva loan as it improved her living standards. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 KES to purchase reeds and paint for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase reeds and paint for her business

loans.name: Ketevani

texts.en:
Ketevani is a 28-year-old single woman from Tbilisi city. She lives with her brother, who works as an artisan and generates 350 - 400 GEL. 

Ketevani works at a private company as an office manager and has a fixed salary. She wants to advance and achieve success in life. She would like to start her own private activity, and that's why she has requested a loan. She plans to start a trading business with jewelry at the local jewelry market. She has already purchased some pieces of gold jewelry and now wants to add more. Her request was approved by the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program which enables people to start or re-start businesses. 

The loan will greatly assist Ketevani, and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of jewelry to start trading

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria,  no estudio, es acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, tienen 5 hijos el 1ro está acompañado y vive aparte, el 2do trabaja, la 3ra estudio bachillerato por el momento no estudia, la 4ta estudio bachillerato y la 5ta estudia 1er año de bachillerato. Con ella solo viven sus hijos y su esposo. 


   La Señora trabaja comprando y vendiendo granos básicos como maíz y frijol. Lo compra recién recogidas las cosechas para comprarlo más barato y venderlo a precio regulares o mejores en seguida. Ella lleva 2 años de ser comerciante, aprendió esta actividad por iniciativa propia porque no tenía a que dedicarse en ese tiempo. A veces recorre 1 km de distancia para ir a comprar los granos y cuando va vender lo llegan a traer a su casa, antes de ser comerciante solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos. En la actividad le ayuda su esposo e hijos.


   El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 8 quintales de maíz, 7 quintales de frijol y con el resto pagara una parte de un crédito que tiene pendiente en credicampo y así estar solvente. El crédito ayudara porque podrá comprar más barato y en seguida sacarle ganancias a las inversiones, lo que le ayudara a sacar adelante su familia.

Su sueño es un día terminar de construir su vivienda, para que sus hijos  vivan más cómodos sin pensar que se mojaran en la época lluviosa, también ayudar a sus hijos que estudian para que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Candelaria, who has had no education, is married and her husband makes a living growing basic grains. They have 5 children. The oldest son has a partner and does not live at home, the second son is working, the third, a daughter, studied at high school but isn't studying at the moment, the fourth, a daughter, studied at high school and the fifth is in her first year at high school. Only her husband and her children live with her. 

The work Candelaria does is buying and selling basic grains such as corn and beans. She buys as soon as the grain has been harvested, to get it at a cheaper price, and sells it soon afterwards at the regular or higher price. She has been trading for 2 years, having learnt the business on her own initiative as she did not have any work at the time. Sometimes she travels 1km to go to buy the grain and when she is selling the grain, people come to her to take it back to their house. Before she was in business she just did the household tasks. Her husband and children help her with her business. 

Candelaria is asking for the loan to buy 8 quintals of corn and 7 quintals of beans and will use the remainder to pay off an outstanding loan with Credicampo so she can be solvent. The loan will help her as she will be able to buy more cheaply and then quickly make a profit from her investment, which will help her to bring up her family. 

Her dream is to finish building her home one day, so that her children can live more comfortably without worrying about getting wet in the rainy season. She also wants to help her children with their schooling so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy 8 quintals of corn and 7 quintals of beans and to use the remainder to pay off an outstanding loan with Credicampo so she can be solvent.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 39 years old, married and supports 8 members of his family. He has seven children aged between 17 and 2 years old. He offers motorcycle transport in the Sacho area and has been in operation for over 6 years, earning an income of KES 20,000 monthly.

With this second term loan of KES 20,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, he intends to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds for his farming activities. The anticipated profit will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to prosper in his business and in life.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm nuts, peppers and egg-plantains for her business.
