loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school and the others are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has been operating a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her children, and to purchase vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children, and purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cookies, soft drinks, and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
The "Blessing" group, of which these two ladies are a part, has numerous members. They are both mothers and with a combined two children under their care. They are natives of Teshie, a place that is located in the coastal region of the country. 

These clients are known for selling foodstuffs and groceries. They are known for being hard-working and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement. Every day, they strive to provide their children with a better future. 

The group representative, Florence, has been selling cassava, maize, gari (cassava flour), tinned tomatoes and plantains. She works about twelve hours every day selling her products, as she has a desire to get ahead.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock Florence's business so that in the near future, she can improve her earnings. The "Blessing" group is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders have given people of little means, so that they may have a dignified source of income.

loans.use: To buy cassava, maize, gari (cassava flour), tinned tomatoes and plantains to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Nkome Nfa Group

texts.en:
The "Nkome Nfa" group has numerous members - both the people in the photograph are members. They are both parents and with a total of three children under their care. They are natives of Teshie, a place that is located in the coastal region of the country. These clients are known for selling drinks and fresh fish. They are known for being hard-working and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement. They fight day-to-day to provide their children with better futures. 

Felicia, the group representative, has been selling fresh fish in an effort to get ahead. She works about twelve hours a day selling her products. The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the near future, she can improve her earnings. The "Nkome Nfa" group is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders have given people of little means, so that they may have a dignified source of income.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 31 year old man from Kakamega region which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is a single man who supports three people in his family. 

Moses has a retail vendor of items like soda and biscuits which has been operating for the last two years and he makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more stock of sodas and biscuits to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profit to start a new business. 

His dream is to start a new business and support his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of sodas and other snacks

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 47-year-old lady from Kakamega town, within the western part of Kenya. She supports three people in the family and has two kids; their ages are 6 and 7 years old respectively.

She has a tailoring shop within her local town. She has been operating this kind of business for the last three years and comfortably makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more material for clothes making. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

Her dream is to grow her business and become a successful entrepreneur so as to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more material

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Asha prepares snacks such as samosa using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es:
Salomón de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto  grado, comenta que era muy difícil estudiar  pues la las condiciones económicas que pasaba su familia no eran muy buenas,  él no logro seguir estudiando para superarse en la vida, él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y a cuidar de sus 3 hijos de las edades de 17 años, una niña de 14 y el ultimo de 9 años y que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, en su vivienda solo vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos y que son las únicas personas que dependen de él.	

Salomón  se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijol) desde que él estaba pequeño sus padres le inculcaron a aprender este trabajo como era la única alternativa de trabajo y de ingresos en aquellos  tiempos, por eso se dedicaba a la agricultura. Aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura también se dedica a la ganadería en la compra y venta de  ganado que es otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos para su familia, él para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que caminar 30 minutos a pie que también recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y esposa para realizar los trabajos agrícolas.  

El financiamiento del préstamo lo utilizara,  para la remodelación de su vivienda, específicamente lo que él remodelara en su  vivienda es el techo, debido a que las condiciones que presenta no son las adecuadas para vivir y más aún que ya se acerca el invierno, tiene el miedo que se le moje sus pertenencias que tiene en su hogar, específicamente  comprara laminas y también tablas, este pequeño proyecto de inversión es un deseo que tenían junto a su esposa de mejorar su casa y le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos y su esposa, más seguridad y confianza. 

Salomón desea para el futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, vivir cómodamente en un lugar poder remodelar su casa y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que en el futuro sean personas profesionales y logren terminar sus estudios y sacar una carrera universitaria todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su esposa.
texts.en:
Salomón is 44 years old and studied until Grade 5. He comments that it was very difficult to study as the financial conditions of his family at the time were not very good. He could not continue studying to get ahead in life. He is married. His wife does the housework and takes care of the 3 children aged, 9, 14 and 17, who are actually studying in school. He lives in his house with his wife and children only and they are the only people dependent on him. 

Salomón is a farmer who grows basic grains (corn and beans). He was taught this at a very young age by his parents as it was the only form of work and income available at that time. So he became a farmer. Besides farming he raises livestock buying and selling cattle which is another source of revenue for the family. He has to walk 30 minutes to get to where he farms. He has the help of his children and wife to do the farming tasks. 

Salomón will use the money from the loan to renovate his house, specifically the roof of his house. It is no longer in adequate condition to live under and with winter on it's way he is afraid that his possessions will get wet. He will purchase laminate and boards. This is a small project that he and his wife have to improve their house and allow them to have a higher quality of living, more secure and comfortable. 

Salomón in the future wants to have a higher quality of living for his family, to live in a comfortable place and be able to renovate his house. He wants his children to continue to study so that one day they become professionals, finish their studies and their university life. All this he wants to accomplish with a lot of work and dedication together with his wife.

loans.use: to buy laminate and boards to renovate the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, flour, sugar and beans for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Alicia Elizabeth

texts.es: Alicia tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 10 años y 5 años de edad. Alicia se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace dos años. Es así como se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida llevan el sustento a su hogar. Alicia solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un pequeño cuarto dormitorio para dar mayor comodidad a su familia. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro.
texts.en: Alicia is 36 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life partner and two children, ages 10 and 5.  Alicia has been providing domestic services for two years and earns her living this way and she and her partner support the household.  Alicia is asking for a loan through FUSAI because she wants to build a small bedroom so that the family will be more comfortable.  She will use the money to buy cement, bricks, sand, and iron bars.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Iris Elizabeth

texts.es: Iris de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad. Iris es una mujer muy emprendedora con mucho esfuerzo puso en su vivienda un molino de nixtamal. Con la ganancia que su pequeño negocio genera colabora con su esposo en los gastos básicos de su hogar. Su esposo es empleado en otro molino del municipio. Iris está entusiasmada con mejorar su humilde vivienda por lo que ha decidido junto a su esposo instalar el piso de ladrillo ya que en la actualidad es de tierra, como se aprecia en la fotografía. Por esa razón Iris ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar el ladrillo para piso, cemento y arena, además pagará la mano de obra que éste trabajo requiere.
texts.en: Iris is 33 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 15.  Iris is a very enterprising lady who set up a corn mill in her home with great effort.  She uses her earnings from her small business to help her husband with the household expenses.  Her husband works at another mill in town.  Iris is excited about improving her humble home because she and her husband have decided to install a tile floor.  The current one is dirt, as shown in the photo.  It is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy tiles, cement, and sand.  She will also pay for labor for the job.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es: Gloria tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo quien se encuentra estudiando. Gloria posee una pequeña tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: arroz,sal, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea proteger las paredes de la vivienda para lo cual necesita material como: cemento y arena para repellar las paredes.
texts.en: Gloria is 28 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and young son who goes to school.  Gloria has a small store where she sells rice, salt, sugar, beans, snacks, sweet bread, etc.  She is asking for this loan, through FUSAI because she wants to make her parents’ house safer, so she will buy cement and sand to repair the walls.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Sango

texts.en:
Sango was born in 1978. She is a woman who always tries to work hard for the well-being of her family. She works hard to help her husband because together they are responsible for taking care of the three children. 

She always wanted to have her own business. She began her business selling clothes and jeans six years ago. Little by little, she developed her business. At first, she did not have a place to sell the clothing, but now she has her own business place. She successfully runs her own business. 

Sango wants to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of GHS 1,000 to buy more clothes to sell for increasing her working capital. This is her fifth loan cycle with ID Ghana and her second with Kiva. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more  clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 38-year-old mother from Kakamega County located in the western part of Kenya. She and her husband are blessed with three children who are 20, 16 and 12 years old, respectively.

She has a cereals stall that she has been operating for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES 5800. She has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase cereals stock. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock.

Her dream is to run a wholesale business and build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura vive con sus padres en la zona de Asunción, ella no tiene un trabajo formal pero en épocas de vacaciones de la universidad  le ayuda a su mamá en la costura   que esta hace, y con lo cual ayuda a Laura.
Está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias Médicas, ya que quiere ser una buena doctora que ayude a las demás personas. Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en la profesión y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para invertirlo en sus fotocopias, libros, materiales, gastos de manutención y demás, ya que su carrera es muy costosa y no le permite trabajar de tiempo completo.
texts.en:
Laura lives with her parents in the Asuncion zone.  She doesn’t have a formal job, but during breaks at the university, she helps her mother with the sewing that she does and helps Laura with it.

She is studying for medical science because she wants to be a good doctor who helps other people.  Her goals for the future are to work the field and be able to help her family.

She is asking for this loan to pay for copying, textbooks, tuition, and other costs.  Her studies are very expensive and do not allow her to work full time.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a 35-year-old single mother of two in Embu. She operates a salon business and she has been running her salon for the past five years, with a monthly income of KES 17,000.  She uses this to support her family.   

Selina is applying for her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She is delighted to have been introduced to VisionFund, where she will be able to obtain financial assistance to boost her business. She will use the loan to purchase hair oils, hair drier, hair chemicals, and weaves. With the expected profits from the business, she will reinvest in her business and improve the standard of living for her family. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a comfortable life and to construct her own permanent residential house.  This is because she is now living in a rented house.

loans.use: to purchase hair oils, a hair drier, chemicals, and weaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bails of clothing for children, towels and sheets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 40-year-old lady who is married and a mother of two children. She has been operating a tailoring shop in Nakuru for the last ten years where she has a monthly income of about 40,000 KES. 

She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by our credit officer and now she has been loaned 40,000 KES which serves as her third loan from the organization. Jane will use the loan to purchase additional clothing materials for her tailoring business. She intends to use the profits from the business to continue educating her children while also trying to expand her business. 

In the future, Jane wishes to further expand her business so she is able to increase her earnings and better the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 26-year-old married mother of one child. She has been buying and selling clothes in Nakuru for the last two years and she has been having a monthly income of about KES 10,000.

She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by our credit officer and now she has been loaned KES 20,000, which serves as her first loan from the organization. Mary will use the loan to purchase additional clothing stock for her business. She intends to use the profits from the business to continue educating her child while also trying to expand her business. 

In the future, Mary wishes to further expand her business to increase her earnings and better the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes for her business

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 68 years old and married to Cherop who also adds income to the family. Benjamin's children are all above 18 years old.  Benjamin supplies fresh milk to milk vendors in Kabarnet Town and has been in the business for a period of six years, earning an income of KES 10,000 monthly.

He is now servicing his sixth loan from VisionFund Kenya and intends to purchase farm inputs including fertilizers and seeds and till the land to get ready for the planting season. With the profits he gets, he will repay the loan and improve the living standards of his family.

His dream is to live a happy life at this old age.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles and his family are still doing well and so are his children. 

He repaid the previous loan advanced to him and he is now on his second loan of KES 45,000. He plans to use the funds to facilitate him in the purchase of goats for slaughter for his secondary business. His hotel business is currently doing well. 

He will use the proceeds to buy livestock so as to sustain the business with minimal expenditure. Charles hopes to open several butcher shops in the town.

loans.use: To buy goats for slaughter in his butcher shop

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a businesswoman who is very hard-working. She is married, with two school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Saumu has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Saumu wants to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, vive en un caserío y solamente estudió hasta cuarto grado debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, está soltera y no tiene hijos. 

María es una persona muy trabajadora, ella se dedica al comercio y a los oficios domésticos, es propietaria de una mini tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad y productos de medicina natural, ya tiene una experiencia de 15 años realizando esta actividad que fue producto de la enseñanza de su madre, la cual en aquellos tiempos lo realizaban los días domingos en la plaza del pueblo y los demás días de la semana se dedicaban al trabajo agrícola, es por eso que hoy en día María se dedica al comercio, pues le motivan las ganancias que este le deja, aparte de que no tiene que movilizarse a ningún lugar de trabajo, ya que el negocio está instalado en su casa y de esta manera tiene tiempo para cuidar a sus padres, personas que son de la tercera edad ya que es la única hija que se encuentra al cuidado de ellos.

Ella está solicitando este préstamo, para invertirlo en la ampliación y mejoramiento de su casa, ya que ha comenzado a construir los servicios sanitarios y necesita terminarlos para que su casa cuente con los servicios de saneamiento básico y otra parte será invertida en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, de esta manera podrá surtir la tienda y dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por lo cual mejorarán sus ganancias económicas. 

Las proyecciones que María tiene para un futuro, son las de fortalecer su negocio y tener un local más amplio que le permita montar una venta de pupusas los días de semana por la tarde y apoyar el estudio de sus sobrinos hasta que sean unos profesionales graduados y espera sacar un nuevo crédito para instalar un molino de nixtamal ya que en su comunidad el primer molino está a 1 km de distancia.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old and lives in a hamlet. She only studied as far as fourth grade since her family had very little money. She is single and does not have any children. María is a very hard-working person. She runs a business and does domestic work. She owns a small shop where she sells everyday groceries and natural health products. She has been doing this for 15 years, having been taught by her mother. In those days they used to sell the products in the town square every Sunday and during the rest of the week they did agricultural work. This is why María now runs a business, as she is motivated by the profits which it gives her. As well as this she does not have to travel to work as she runs the business from her home, and this gives her time to look after her parents who are elderly.  She is the one who looks after them since she is the only daughter.

María is asking for this loan so she can extend and improve her house. She has already started to put in a bathroom and needs to finish it so that her house can have basic sanitation. She will use another part of the loan to buy goods for her shop. This will enable her to stock the shop better and provide a better service for her customers, which will improve her profits. 

María's plans for the future are to strengthen her business and have bigger premises which will allow her to start selling pupusas [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] on weekday afternoons. She also plans to support her nephews in their education so they can become professional graduates. She also plans to take out another loan to install a corn mill, because in her community the nearest mill is 1km away.

loans.use: to extend and improve her house and finish installing a bathroom.

loans.name: Jeimy Catherine

texts.es: Les quiero hablar de una mujer llamada Jeimy Catherine, ella tiene 21 años, vive con la madre y un hermano menor, Jeimy tiene un lindo bebe de 2 años de edad, el cual está en el jardín. A ella le gusta mucho la enfermería puesto que es una mujer muy arriesgada, activa y solidaria con los demás, y gracias a esta carrera ella le quiere dar una mejor calidad de vida al hijo, la madre y hermano, en estos momentos no trabaja por motivo del estudio y la mama es la que le ayuda a cancelar las cuotas mensuales, pero en estos momentos es difícil para ella, puesto que  las cuotas son muy altas y no le alcanza debido a otros gastos, jeimy está buscando un trabajo los fines de semana pero le ha sido difícil, puesto que no hay quien cuide estos días el bebe, por este motivo pide  la colaboración del convenio kiva.
texts.en: I want to tell you about the woman named Jeimy Catherine.  She is 21 years old and lives with her mother and younger brother.  Jeimy has a beautiful two year old baby.  She likes nursing very much because she is a risk taker, is active, and united with others.  Thanks to this career she wants to provide a better quality of life for her son, her mother, and for her brother.  At the moment she is in school and doesn’t work and her mother helps her pay her monthly fees, but it’s difficult at the moment because the fees are very high and she doesn’t have enough because of other costs.  Jeimy is looking for work on the weekends but it hasn’t been easy because there is on one to car for her baby, so she is asking for Kiva’s help.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is now 41 years old and still happily married. They had four children now and they are all doing well.

He is still in the beauty products business in Naivasha town and he is happy with the progress of his business.

He has applied for second loan from VisionFund to enable him buy more stock such as earrings, necklaces, and watches, among other items. With the anticipated profits, he plans to pay for school fees and expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to own the biggest beauty kiosk in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, and watches.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 64-year-old man from the western part of Kenya. He is married to Benta and supports nine people in his family

He distributes water using his a cart, a business he has been doing for the last 26 years and generates a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He has applied for his fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which he will use to boost his business by adding two donkeys and a push-cart. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to have a good life and purchase a pick-up for transportation.

loans.use: to boost his business by adding two donkeys and a push-cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Naftaly

texts.en:
Naftaly, 45 years old, is married and has two children. He has run a retail shop in Kitengela for 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 48,000. 

Naftaly will be using the loan to buy more stock of goods such as flour, sugar and rice for resale. He will use the anticipated profits to grow his business. This is Naftaly's second loan term, having repaid the previous one successfully. 

His future hopes are to expand his business and to be able to support his family.

loans.use: To add more stock of goods for resale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 29 years old and she supports three members of her family. She runs a tailoring business in Kapsabet town. She has been in this business for the last five years and she gets an average monthly income of  Kshs. 25,000. 

She has borrowed a loan of Kshs 30,000 which she will use to purchase clothing materials. She will use the anticipated profits  to pay school fees  for her children. 

Her dream is to expand her business and open a wholesale shop to sell clothing materials.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Kizito

texts.en:
Kizito, 42 years old, is from Kakamega, in Kakamega County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Mrs. Sulvei, a businesswoman, and he supports 4 people in the family, including his three children, aged 13, 11 and 3 years old.

Kizito has been making bricks for the last 5 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. He  has applied for his first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to pay for the labor of making bricks and also buy firewood for hardening the bricks. He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business. 

His dream is to become a large scale dairy farmer and to support his family.

loans.use: to pay his laborers and buy firewood for making bricks

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 31 years old and from Nyahururu. He is not married yet, but he takes care of his parents and siblings.

He has been running his motorcycle transport business for the last two years. He would like to expand his income base and has applied for a new loan to enable him to start a clothing sales business. 

His monthly income right now is KES 20,000, and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to buy another motorcycle and pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an efficient energy system from Liquefied Petroleum Gas in order to prepare food for my family in time.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance. The 44-year-old man is married and blessed with three children. He hails from a village in Rukungiri municipality. 

He has been running a lodge business in Rukungiri municipality and has been in this business for so many years. His challenge has been limited capital to expand his business, which is where he gets income for catering to his family.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,800,000 to renovate his lodges so that they are habitable. He hopes this will increase his income, not forgetting about providing better services for his customers.

Herbert is a hardworking fellow, and he is hopeful that with this loan from UGAFODE, his business is going to expand.

loans.use: to renovate his lodging facilities.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is a married man who is blessed with three children. He hails from Western Ward, Western Division, Rukungiri Municipality. Ambrose is a very hardworking man but he faces the challenge of limited capital to add to his business and expand his studio.

Ambrose is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan to expand his studio and develop a plot of land that he recently acquired. He hopes this will help house his family. He is an old client of the institution and will use his loan to reduce the cost he spends on renting. With his loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) and continuous support from Kiva lenders, Ambrose is hopeful that his situation will gradually improve.

loans.use: for construction of a residential house

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 35 years old and lives in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Richard has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, which sells maize flour, cassava flour and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize flour, cassava flour and cooking oil. It will help Richard to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. Richard hopes that in the future, he will be able to acquire more assets. 




"

loans.use: buy more maize flour, cassava flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a divorced woman with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaisha has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-greengrocery in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Ana Group

texts.es: Dúo Ana este grupo esta conformado por la señora Sonia Noemi de 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas gallinas para seguir creciendo en su negocio esperando que le puedan ayudar nuevamente con un credito ya que en sus pagos anteriores no a caido en mora.
texts.en: The Duo Ana group includes Sonia Noemi, a married 32-year-old woman. She earns her living raising laying hens. She has been doing this activity for three years. This time, she is requesting a loan to buy more chickens. She will continue to grow her business. She expects to be able to be helped by this loan again because her previous loan was paid back and she did not fall into arrears.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of four children who are in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Mary K.

texts.en:
Mary K. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Mary K. has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Mary K. has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for the business and will help Mary K. to generate greater profits and expand the business. Mary K. hopes that in the future, she will be able to look after her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria es una joven de 22 años de edad muy trabajadora y muy dedicada a su familia y muy responsable. Ella está casada y vive junto con su esposo y su única hija la cual tiene una edad de 2 años. En compañía de su esposo trabajan diariamente para salir adelante y dar a su hija un mejor futuro y un mejor estilo de vida pensando a futuro evitar que su hija pase por lo que ellos en su juventud que no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar de forma completa y prepararse académicamente. Silveria no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar la primaria cursando únicamente hasta el quinto grado que por razones de dinero por sus padres quienes descienden de una familia económicamente humilde no pudieron apoyarle. Fueron sus padres quienes a muy temprana edad le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra para que pudiese en un futuro trabajar independiente o junto a quien podía ser su pareja y fuera apoyo para salir adelante. La tierra que hoy en día trabaja junto a su esposo es propia la cual fue gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres. 
Sus sueños ser una mujer superada y vivir en mejores condiciones siempre con el apoyo de su familia y de Dios a quien agradece diariamente por las muchas bendiciones que el da para su familia y demás. También sueña en convertir a su hija en una mujer de provecho, preparada académicamente para que tenga muchas más opciones de las que ella y su esposo en su juventud tuvieron. Silveria necesita pueda ser apoyada financiera mente para poder asistir su cultivo de café mediante la compra de abono, foliares, entre otros y trabajar más para seguir construyendo y fortaleciendo cada día más el patrimonio para su familia.
texts.en:
Silveria, who is 22 years old, is a very hard-working and responsible young woman who is devoted to her family. She is married and lives with her husband and their only daughter who is 2 years old. Together she and her husband work hard every day to make progress in life and to give their daughter a better future and a better lifestyle. 

Thinking to the future, they hope to avoid their daughter having the same experience that they had when they were young, because they did not have the opportunity to complete their schooling and get a good education.  Silveria did not have the opportunity to finish primary school, only reaching as far as fifth grade, since her parents come from a humble family and did not have the money to support her through school. 

It was her parents who taught her at a very young age how to work the land so that in the future she would be able to work independently or with whoever might become her partner and not need support to get on in life.

The land which she and her husband farm today belongs to them thanks to an inheritance from her parents.

Her dream is to be a successful woman and have better living conditions, always with the support of her family and God, whom she thanks every day for the many blessings which he gives to her family and others. She also dreams of her daughter becoming a resourceful woman with a good education so that she has a lot more opportunities than she and her husband had when they were young.

Silveria needs financial support to be able to tend her coffee crop by buying manure, foliar feeds and other items and she aims to work more so she can continue to build up and strengthen the assets for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for tending her coffee crop.

loans.name: Rito

texts.es: Don Rito, tiene 60 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 9 hijos y reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Anteriormente trabajaba en agricultura y también en una barbería donde adquirió experiencia y hace 11 meses el decidió establecer su propia barbería, ofrece el servicio de corte de cabello para hombres y niños. Este negocio lo tiene en un local del mercado. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 11,000 Lempiras para comprar un aire acondicionado para su barbería y ofrecer mejor servicio al cliente para hacer crecer el negocio. Su plan es tener siempre un ingreso mas para el sustento de la familia.
texts.en: Rito is 60-years-old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner. He has 9 children and lives in the town of San Pedro Sula. In the past, he worked in agriculture and also in a barbershop where he gained experience. Eleven months ago, he decided to establish his own barbershop offering the service of haircuts for men and boys. This business is located in a local market. He has requested a loan of 11,000 Lempiras to buy an air conditioner for his barbershop to provide better customer service to grow the business. His plan is always to have more income to sustain the family.

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner for his barbershop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package which is thermally efficient and reliable in order to prepare warm food for her children

loans.name: Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Del Carmen”

San Juan La Laguna is a peaceful village located on the southern shore of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala. The population is Tz'utujil, one of many distinctive indigenous Mayan groups found in the country. Agriculture, mainly high quality coffee, is grown in this area. The town sees an increasing number of tourists each year, drawn by several women’s textile cooperatives, the natural dye techniques used by the women as well as distinctive paintings by many talented artists.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Del Carmen” is located here. One member of the Trust Bank is Doña Zoila, a hard working 56 year old woman who produces beautiful textiles. She is pleased that her efforts have resulted in some much needed income so that she can successfully raise her seven children. Doña Zoila is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge which she will use to purchase high quality materials including thread and fabric. Her goal is to increase her inventory and earn more income. She is a busy mother with seven mouths to feed!

Doña Zoila is most aware that education is an essential component for her success. One year ago, she completed her primary education and now she is proud to have some basic skills. Recognizing this, her fellow Trust Bank members have chosen Doña Zoila to be President of the group. 

Educational trainings are a key component in the Micro-credit Plus program of Friendship Bridge. Each month, a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank officer meets with each Trust Bank. Besides taking care of loan business, she presents a non-formal educational training. Relevant and useful topics are discussed including effective business management, planning and budgeting, nutrition and health, as well as women’s rights and self esteem. 

Doña Zoila and the other Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Del Carmen” members really appreciate the confidence and support of KIVA investors throughout the world. The small loans and educational trainings are a winning combination for the ladies. They can step into a brighter future as empowered women, benefiting themselves, their family and their quiet community of San Juan La Laguna.

loans.use: to buy yarns and fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 26 years old, married to Joyce and they are blessed with one child aged three years. Samuel is a shoemaker and repairer and has been in the business for eight years. He makes a monthly income of 18,000 Kshs. 

He plans to use the loan to purchase soles and leather materials. This is his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loans successfully. He dreams of owning a plot of land and building to help himself in future life.

loans.use: To purchase soles and leather materials for his shoe-making business

loans.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Procora is 49 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Procora has a food vending business in the Philippines. Procora requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Procora has been in this business for 11 years. Procora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products. Mailyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Mailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en:
Medilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Medilyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Medilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Dúo Bucaro Group

texts.es: Dúo Bucaro este Dúo esta conformado por la señora Rosa de 39 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos ya que sus clientes han aumentado y no tiene el suficiente capital para trabajar, le agradese por su ayuda en el primer credito y desea seguir con su megocio ya que solo asi podra salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dúo Bucaro: this pair is headed by 39-year-old Rosa, who has worked in cosmetics sales for several years. She is requesting this loan in order to buy cosmetics, since her client base has increased and she lacks sufficient capital to operate.

She wishes to thank you for your help with her first loan which will allow her to continue her business, since only in this way can she progress.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for sale

loans.name: José Gabriel

texts.es:
José es un hombre pujante y trabajador de 60 años de edad, 40 de ellos dedicado a trabajar en el campo de la fabricación de calzado, el oficio lo aprendió con su madre quien siempre se dedicó a esta labor, luego de obtener todo el conocimiento y la experiencia, decidió independizarse y abrir su propio taller de producción hace 30 años; inicialmente se encontraba ubicado en Bucaramanga, donde su taller creció y por ello generaba muchos empleos directos, pero por razones ajenas a su voluntad tuvo que trasladarse para otra ciudad, pues estaba siendo amenazado y extorsionado por grupos al margen de la ley. Ya radicado en la nueva ciudad, reinició su labor y actualmente trabaja con su esposa y un empleado, todos los días de 7 am a 5 pm; así ha logrado generar los recursos para el sustento y la educación de sus 4 hijos. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar materia prima al por mayor (cuero, pegante, moldes de calzado), esto le permitirá aumentar la producción y tener más variedad de calzado para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, así tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar los ingresos.
José manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es volver a tener su taller bien acreditado y consolidado, con toda la maquinaria que requiere para elaborar toda clase de calzado, brindar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a vigorous and hardworking sixty-year-old man. He has been making shoes for forty years, and learned the trade from his mother, who always worked as a cobbler. After gaining all the knowledge and experience, he decided to start his own business and open his own shop. This was thirty years ago. Initially located in Bucaramanga, his shop started to grow, so it created a lot of jobs directly. However, due to issues beyond his control, he had to move it to a different city because he was being threatened and extorted by criminal organizations. Once he resettled in the new city, he went back to business and currently works with his wife and one employee from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm. This has allowed him to generate enough income to support his four children and pay for their education. 

He is currently requesting the support of a loan in order to purchase wholesale materials like leather, glue, and shoe molds. This will allow him to increase production and to have a wider variety of shoes to offer his customers and appeal to their different tastes in style, which will give him a chance to increase his income.

José says that his greatest desire is for his shop to become as reputable and well-established as it once was, having all the necessary equipment to make all types of shoes. He wants to offer new employment opportunities and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale leather, glue, and shoe molds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment to qualify for the Sheriff's Program.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 63 años de edad, vive en un cantón y está casada, tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y han formado sus propios hogares, por lo tanto solo ella y su esposo viven en casa.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura junto con su esposo, esta actividad la realiza desde muy joven, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, sus hijos están muy pendientes de ella, pues tratan de ayudarle económicamente por lo tanto son ingresos extras para ella, pero a pesar de eso les gusta trabajar, su esposo es el encargado de realizar el trabajo con algunos muchachos de la comunidad que les ayudan en un horario de 6:00 AM a 12:00 MD y el lugar de trabajo está a 15 minutos caminando desde su casa.

Ana está solicitando este préstamo a CrediCampo, para preparar la tierra donde sembrarán, quitar la maleza para tenerlo limpio cuando comience el invierno, además comprarán herbicidas y los fertilizantes necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha.
La necesidad a cubrir es garantizar la seguridad a alimentaria y tener una fuente de ingreso para la familia.

Sus planes a futuro son seguir cultivando la tierra hasta que Dios se lo permita, además desea ser un ejemplo a seguir para sus nietos y mostrarles lo importante que es el trabajo para lograr los objetivos establecidos.
texts.en:
Ana is 63 years old and lives in the countryside. She is married and has 5 children who are all now adults and live in their own homes. So her husband and her live alone in their house. Ana together with her husband are farmers. She has been doing this from an early age, being taught by her parents. Her children keep an eye on her, trying to help her financially so this is extra income for her. But despite this she enjoys working. Her husband is in charge of undertaking the work along with some people from the community who help him working from 6 am until 12 noon. The place they grow is a 15 minute walk from their house. 

Ana is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to prepare the land where they plant, to clear the undergrowth to have it clean for when winter starts and to buy fertilizer and herbicides to obtain a good harvest. This is necessary to ensure the crops and have a source of income for the family. Her future plans are to continue to farm as long as God allows her. She wants to set a god example for her grandchildren and show them the importance of working to obtain their objectives.

loans.use: to prepare the land for seeding, clear the underbrush and buy herbicides and fertilizers needed for a good harvest.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es: Noemy, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella trabajo varios años en una maquila y al no tener empleo ha decidido establecer un negocio de venta de frutas, vende sandia, melón, ciruela, bananos, mangos y otras de temporada. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ya ha invertido varios préstamos al negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 6,500 Lempiras para surtir el negocio con frutas de temporada como es la sandia, melón, mangos, zapotes, ciruelas, bananos naranjas y otras. Su plan es poner el negocio fuera de su casa donde haya más circulación de personas y poder vender también otra mercadería.
texts.en:
Noemy is 53 years old. She is a single mother of three children and lives in the municipality of Choloma, in Cortes. She worked at a factory for several years but since she doesn't have a job currently, she decided to start a business selling fruit. She sells watermelon, melon, plums, bananas, mangos, and other seasonal fruit. Her business is set up in her home. 

She has already invested several loans in her business. She is currently requesting another, in the amount of 6,500 lempiras, in order to stock up on seasonal fruit for her business. She will buy watermelons, melons, mangos, sapotes, plums, bananas, oranges, and other fruit. She plans to set up her business outside of her home where there is more customer traffic and also incorporate other merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to stock up on seasonal fruit like watermelon, melon, mango, sapote, plums, bananas, oranges, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Herlinda

texts.es: Doña Blanca, tiene 66 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara junto a uno de sus hijos. Ella anteriormente vendía cosméticos de productos de catalogo, y hace 5 años se ha dedicado a vender ropa para damas y caballeros como ser blusas, camisas, jeans, faldas, calcetas y ropa interior. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y es el tercer ciclo con la institución, con el cual va comprar ropa como camisetas y jeans para mantener inventario y vender. Tiene como meta llagar a tener su propio local para el negocio y vivir de las ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca is 66 years old. She is a single mother, has three children, and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, in Santa Barbara, with one of her children. She used to sell cosmetic products from a catalog, but for the past five years she has been working selling men and women's clothing like blouses, shirts, jeans, skirts, socks, and underwear. 

The loan she is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras. It is her third cycle within this organization and she will use the loan to buy clothing items like t-shirts and jeans in order to keep up with inventory and sales. Her goal is to one day have her own business space and live off the profits.

loans.use: to buy clothing items like t-shirts and jeans to keep up with inventory and sales.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Dios es Amor está conformado por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos hombres, padres y madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, en la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor  a sus hijos. 
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  María y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, cuajada, jugos, galletas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  La asociación comunal Dios es Amor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Dios es Amor" communal bank is composed of 10 members, eight women and two men. They are all responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children under their care. They are natives of Malpaisillo a place in the West of the country. They are all hard-working and responsible with 15 children under their care. Unfortunately they couldn't study due to lack of financial resources. Today they strive from day to day to provide their children a better future. 

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead María is the coordinator. Her business is running a grocery store where she sells food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, curd, juices and biscuits. She works 12 hours per day offering her product from her house. The objective of the loan is to invest in her working capital in buying and selling food products so in the near future she can generate more income. The "Dios es Amor" communal bank is grateful for the support that the lenders at Kiva offer to people of low economic resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store with food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, curd, juices and biscuits.

loans.name: Zoeth

texts.en:
Zoeth worked in the elderly care industry for over 16 years before she decided that it was time to be her own boss. She started Zoeth Home Care four years ago, a business dedicated to high quality care for senior citizens.

Her business predicates a low cost, therefore, low price model by visiting clients in their own homes to develop personal connections with her patients. 

With this loan, Zoeth will purchase additional healthcare equipment. Help this independent, hardworking entrepreneur grow her business and fulfill her dream of owning her own storefront!

loans.use: Purchase healthcare equipment

loans.name: Nafisatu

texts.en:
Twenty years ago in Ghana, Nafisatu began sewing clothes for her children as a hobby. But when Nafisatu immigrated to the United States in 2002, she was faced with the question of how to provide for her children while overcoming the language barrier. She turned her hobby into a business and began making clothes to showcase at local African markets and salons. 

Nafisatu’s clientele has increased over the years and she is now able to provide for her family while doing what she loves, using a trade and style that she learned in her home country. She hopes to one day move her business out of her home and into her own storefront. 

With this loan, Nafisatu will increase her supply of materials to create a larger inventory of fashionable merchandise. Help this mother provide for her children and reach her dreams of owning her own storefront!

loans.use: Buy raw materials to diversify her inventory

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es: Jose, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y café, sus cultivos los tiene en una zona montañosa y la producción de café la vende ya despulpado en el mercado local. Lleva cuatro ciclos de prestamos con el actual, el cual es por 28,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar urea y foliar para darle asistencia a su cultivo de café y poder mejorar la producción. Su plan es seguir produciendo café para tener un mejor sistema de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 years old. He is married, has four children, and lives in a village within the municipality of Gracias, in Lempira. He has always worked growing basic grains like corn, beans, and coffee. His crops are located in a mountainous area and he sells the coffee he produces at the local market once the pulp has been extracted. 

This is his fourth loan cycle, which is for 28,000 lempiras. He will use this loan to buy urea and foliar fertilizer to help him with his coffee crops so that he can improve production. He plans to continue growing coffee in order to enjoy better living standards with his family.

loans.use: to buy urea and foliar fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer and printer

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Originally from Mexico, Claudio moved to the United States 22 years ago in search of better opportunities for him and his children. When he first arrived, Claudio worked long, strenuous hours in U.S. factories with little social mobility in sight. One day, he chose to seize an opportunity and followed a longtime passion: farming.

For the last eight years, Claudio has successfully operated Gonzalez Farm and he currently leases two plots of land where he cultivates 50 different types of vegetables throughout the year. He uses six different, local markets, as well as three CSAs (Community Supported Agriculture), which embodies a number of citizens who pay for fresh vegetables delivered straight to their home. 

Claudio has said that he is the happiest when he farms fresh produce that satisfies his rapidly growing client base. To meet his demand, Claudio sought to build a greenhouse last year in order to extend his growing season. Harnessing the ability to produce climate sensitive crops year round, he achieved great success with his first greenhouse and hopes to continue building and expanding his enterprise.

Now he needs your help. Claudio has a huge customer base that will only continue to grow, and therefore, he needs the tools and land to satisfy it. With the construction of two more greenhouses, Claudio should be able to quit his second job and focus solely on his farming business. 

Help Claudio realize his dreams of operating a successful business to both support his children and produce savory vegetables for his ever-growing customer base.

loans.use: to construct two new greenhouses

loans.name: Libia

texts.en:
Libia is a compassionate woman who was born in Cuba, but has been living in the United States for 15 years. Driven by her altruistic heart, she chose to open Personal Support and Assistant, Inc, a self-run organization that cares for the needs of people with disabilities. 

Libia hopes to continue to expand her business and provide a better life for her children. Being a single mom with only one source of income, she works long hours to support her family. 

With this loan, Libia will purchase new medical equipment in order to service a larger customer base.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Don Marcos, tiene 66 años de edad vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 4 hijos, reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula, junto a dos de sus hijos. Don Marcos anteriormente trabajo en empresa privada y hace dos años decidió por dedicarse a la compra y venta de calzado, vende zapato de vestir, sandalias, chinelas, para niños, zapato tipo burro, etc. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante en varios sectores de la comunidad. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar mas calzado y vender, con el objetivo de ampliar su clientela y mercado. Su meta es seguir con el negocio ya que es su fuente de ingresos para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Marcos is 66 years old and lives with his life partner with whom he has four children. He lives in San Pedro Sula together with two of his children. Previously, Marcos worked for a private company but two years ago he decided to work at buying and selling shoes. He sells dressy shoes, sandals, flip-flops and slides, children's shoes, work boots, etc. He sells door-to-door in various parts of the community.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras so he can buy more shoes to sell with the goal of expanding his customer base and his market. He intends to continue with the business because it is his source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna acts as the administrative side to her family-run automotive repair shop. Working with her husband, they provide quality care to repeat customers acquired over the years, mostly garnered through word of mouth. 

Due to unrivaled service and compassion, their business has rapidly expanded. However Johanna knows the value in modern advertising. 

She will use a loan from Accion to increase her customer base, modernize marketing capabilities, hire additional mechanics and eventually increase the size of her facility in order to keep up with the ever increasing demand.

loans.use: to increase marketing, labor force, and size of facility.

loans.name: Hersel

texts.en:
Hersel worked for 10 years in restaurant management until he decided to open his own location in order to earn more for his wife and two children. He opened Naturally Delicious, a healthy food restaurant located in the main floor of a busy office building in the heart of the financial district. He has created a mouthwatering menu of classic American and Italian dishes.

Using friendly service, satisfying cuisine, and a fully functional and modern looking website, Hersel has found his niche in New York. He has weathered difficult times after Sandy and 9/11, but his business continues to thrive and offers employment to 10 others. 

Due to his large success and passion for more, Hersel is seeking to expand his business. He is looking for capital to remodel the restaurant and add a juice bar. 

Help this hardworking father of two expand his restaurant and provide for his family!

loans.use: To remodel the restaurant and add a juice bar

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge worked in the eye care industry for years until eventually accruing the proper amount of experience and resources to start his own business. Driven by inspiration to promote a successful future for his daughters and provide quality eye care assistance to his customers, Jorge has recently upgraded from a mobile truck to a permanent storefront. 

Jorge’s business provides quality eye care and exceptional frames at a reasonable price. That business model, combined with his incessant desire to succeed, has allowed for a very successful operation. 

He hopes to continue to expand his enterprise, hire more employees, and upgrade his supply to the latest fashion trends.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 60 years old and widowed with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional rice, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Anita has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs. Anita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rice, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Inventory

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a  parent of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a soft broom making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Arlene is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her soft broom making business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for soft broom making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase embroidery software

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is married and a mother of four. She provides for her family with her farming income. She grows rice on her own land, which is about a 5 minute walk from her home. After 15 years of experience in growing rice, she is able to earn well for her family. Her income goes for food and allowances for her children's schooling.

Mom would like to purchase a parcel of farmland to improve her farm, but she has inadequate capital now. To realize her dreams of having large farming areas for rice cultivation, she is asking for a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited, a longstanding Kiva partner. With the loan help, she will continue to work hard in order to earn greater income because she wants to give a better lifestyle and education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a parcel of farmland to improve her farm

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Andrea works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dressed chicken business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Andrea is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of dressed chicken to sell for her buy-and-sell dressed chicken business.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dressed chicken to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 48 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell.

Estela has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell nipa roofing for 29 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Estela aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 55 years old and has nine children. Conchita is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Conchita has been farming rice for 30 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a business to buy and sell rice and rice grains in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and rice grains to sell for her rice and rice grains business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and rice grains to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has a business to buy and sell rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Leonila is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to  purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business to buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

Emerenciana has been in this business for 13 years. She earns additional income from food vending and a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that will help her protect her potato crops.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita is 30 years old and married with 2 children both of whom are school aged.  She lives in Punta Sulong, Baliangao.  She has engaged in fishing for 3 years together with her husband. She has a monthly income of Php 10,000 doing this type of work. She joined Paglaum Cooperative last 2005. She has applied for a loan of Php 40,000 to buy fishing net.  The profit from her business will be used to support the school expenses of her children and renovation of their house.

loans.use: purchase fishing net

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Antonieta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from meat vending. Antonieta is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables and spices to sell.

Antonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, oil, sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Estelita has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, oil, sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, ice cubes, salt, etc for her ice cream vending business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 13 years. Lourdes earns additional income from farming coconuts and rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, ice cubes, salt, etc

loans.name: Magelyn

texts.en:
Magelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6500 through NWTF to buy additional items like fabrics, thread, etc. for her tailoring business.

Magelyn has been in this business for 2 years. Magelyn earns additional income from fish vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like fabrics, thread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase insulation material for his workshop to enable him to work in a comfortable place making wooden inventory to meet clients' orders on time

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina accessed a 5,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings have been a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Divina hopes to be more successful in life and dreams of having a longer life to see her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil and spices for her business

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

Maria Fe has been in this business for 2 years. Maria Fe earns additional income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: El señor Jose Noel se dedica a prestar servicios en su taller ubicado en el barrio Santa Ana desde hace 30 años, en su negocio a tiende a la población en general que necesitan de este servicio, es un hombre muy trabajador, se esfuerza por sacar el sustento de su hogar, es padre de 4 hijos todos en edad escolar, se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante . solicita el financiamiento para comprar repuestos para vehículo y así ofrecerles a sus clientes  el repuesto que va a necesitar .
texts.en: Jose Noel has been providing services from his workshop in the district of Santa Ana for 30 years. In his business he caters for those in the general population who need this service. He is a very hard-working man, who makes every effort to make a living. He is the father of 4 children, all of whom go to school, and he strives to help them get a good education. He is asking for the loan to buy vehicle spare parts so that he can meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles and chainsaws.

loans.name: Teopela

texts.en:
Teopela is 34 years old with three children. She sells fruits and says that her day begins very early in the morning. She always tries to help her family with her work and gives them the best so they do not want for anything.

Teopela requests this loan to invest in the purchase of seasonal fruit such as apples, watermelons, melons and other fruits to continue working as she has been.

loans.use: to buy apples, watermelons, and melons

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming flowering plants in the Philippines. She has been farming flowering plants for two years and also earns additional income from farming coconuts and bananas.

Gina is borrowing 6,500 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase fertilizers and other supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is 57 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Generosa requested a 6,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items like sugar, charcoal, eggs, shampoo, and groceries to sell. She has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like sugar, charcoal, eggs, shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Ahliniso

texts.ru: Ахлинисо 35-летняя жительница района Джиликуль. Она живет там с мужем и двумя несовершеннолетними детьми. Ее муж дехканин. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Ахлинисо помогает мужу в ведении сельского хозяйства. Одновременно она занимается шитьем и у себя дома принимает заказ на пошив женских национальных платьев. Ахлинисо занимается этим делом более 15 лет. На протяжении этих лет она шила на старой машинке и теперь она хочет купить новую, чтобы расширить свою деятельность. Для этой цели она обратилась за кредитом. Ахлинисо с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Ahliniso is a 35 year old resident of Jilikul.  She lives there with her husband and two minor children.  Her husband is a farmer and grows various crops.  Ahliniso helps her husband with the farming.  She also has a home sewing business and custom sews traditional women's dresses.  Ahliniso has been in this business for 15 years.  For all these years she has used an old sewing machine and she wants to buy a new one in order to expand her business.   She has applied for a loan for this purpose.  Ahliniso is waiting hopefully for support.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is happy with his family. He is 49 years old and married with children living with them. 

In his rice field, he plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. His income usually goes for meals, bills at home and revolving capital for his business.
