He aims for better crop production but has had insufficient funds to sustain his crop; that is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. These products will help ensure good nutrition to his crops and someday give him abundant harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.en: Mukaddam is a kind woman. She was born in 1975. She is married and has three children. Her husband has been busy with animal husbandry. Mukaddam always helps her husband feed the cattle. She organized her own business in animal husbandry six months ago. Mukaddam, little by little, has developed her business but her working capital is small. She wants to increase her working capital but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy cattle to increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 31 years old and married with one child.  With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for the family.

She buys and resells charcoal in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years.

Jonalyn requested an 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita works hard to support her family. She is married and buys and resells charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Lenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en: Umedjon is 20 years old. He is a hardworking and industrious man. Umedjon is a student of the second course at National Tajikistan University. He studies in the departments of History and Law. Umedjon likes all of the subjects that he learns in university. He is one of the best students. He often goes to the library and reads interesting books there. He is not married and lives with his parents. He is asking for a loan of 1,800 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Mykola

texts.ru:
Микола предоставляет услуги, сдавая в аренду оборудование для турпоходов, а именно палатки, спальные мешки, кариматы, шлемы для катания на горных велосипедах, а также сдавая в аренду байдарки и лодки. Микола также устраивает сплавы по горным речкам. Место для бизнеса он арендует, в бизнесе работает на собственном автомобиле. Товар держит дома, в гараже, и еще арендует склад в другом месте. Самые популярные из его услуг – это туры в горы и сплав на байдарках для туристов.  
Микола планирует вложить 36 000 гривен в приобретение туристического оснащения, которое он потом сможет предоставлять напрокат в своем туристическом бизнесе. Новое оборудование поможет ему расширить ассортимент предоставляемых услуг и укрепить позиции своего бизнеса. Со временем Микола мечтает построить собственный дом для своей семьи – жены и 3-х детей.

Примечание: на фото Микола вместе одним из своих сыновей на спортивных соревнованиях.
texts.en:
Mykola offers the service of renting out camping equipment like tents, sleeping bags, mattress pads, mountain biking helmets, as well as canoes and row boats.  Mykola also arranges rafting on the mountain rivers.  His most popular services are his mountain hiking tours and rafting.  He rents his business location and uses his personal car for work.  He keeps his rental equipment in his home garage as well as in a second off-site storage unit.   

Mykola is planning to invest 36,000 hryven (UAH) in equipment that he will then rent out through his business.  The new equipment will allow him to expand the range of services he can offer and strengthen his business.  It's Mykola's dream to one day build a home for his wife and three children.

loans.use: to purchase tourist equipment to rent it out to tourists

loans.name: Khayankhyarvaa

texts.en:
Mr. Khayankhyarvaa, 36 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been transporting passengers between districts using his microvan since 2008. Before the transportation business, he had been selling foodstuffs at the outdoor market for a living. His wife is working as a therapist at a kindergarten. Their son studies at college, while their daughter goes to elementary school. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy furniture, such as a television, drawers, a sofa and chair. By doing so, he will make his home a more comfortable place to live.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is from an occupied zone of Azerbaijan - Zangilan city. For 21 years, she has been an Internally Displaced Person. 

Sona is 51 years old, married for 29 years, and lives with her lovely family in Abseron region. She has four children. Her elder daughter and elder son are married, and the other two children are studying. 

Sona is a maid; she cleans around, watering trees etc. Today Sona needs a loan, but this loan not for her business. She wants to repair her kitchen. Therefore, she has applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 1,900 Azerbaijan New Manat. 

She is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is 26 years old. She is divorced and has 2 little children. Nasiba has a pedagogical higher education. She has worked as a teacher for more than 8 years in a local school. Nasiba teaches computer science. She is smart and works very hard. Her colleagues know her as kind and responsible woman. Nasiba has no water in her house now, because the water system in her house is broken. She does not have the money to repair it. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni to repair the water system. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair the water system for her house

loans.name: Gulguncha

texts.ru: Гулгунча молодая девушка из маленького района Шахритуз. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем. Гулгунча живет вместе с мамой, бабушкой и старшей сестрой. Ее отец находиться в Российской Федерации. Он не нашел работу и уехал заграницу на заработки. В семью в основном доход приносит Гулгунча. Она на рынке занимается продажей обуви. В работе ей стараются помочь все члены ее семьи. Гулгунча в сфере торговли 1 год. На данный момент у нее возникли финансовые затруднения, по которой она не может привести новый товар, чтобы привлечь больше покупателей. И она решилась обратиться за кредитом. Гулгунча верит, что мир не без добрых людей  и ей помогут и поддержат.
texts.en:
Gulguncha is a young woman from the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 20 years old and not married.  She lives with her mother, grandmother, and older sister.  Her father works in Russia, where he found a job after he couldn't find one locally.  Gulguncha brings in her family's main income.  She sells shoes at the market.  All the members of her family try to help her with the business.  She has been in this business for 1 year.

Currently, Gulguncha has encountered financial difficulties that have prevented her from being able to buy the new inventory necessary to attract more customers.  Because of this, she decided to apply for a loan.  Gulguncha believes that there are kind people out there who will help her and support her.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley has been operating a general store in their village while her husband earns from his work. Shirley always finds ways to augment their living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase a stock of groceries. She is hopeful of seeing her business progress and her children successful.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 54, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nemrod, a caretaker and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household as she works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nenita makes and sells rice cakes and rice dishes. These are foods commonly eaten for snacks and sometimes after a meal for dessert. She sells it per order and it is in demand on special occasions and holidays. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like rice, sugar, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  

Nenita hopes to grow her business and dreams to make a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products like rice, pork, chicken, sugar, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy is 42 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers for her coconut.

She has been farming coconut for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her coconut.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is 52 years old and has ten children. She is married and three of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Nory requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nory has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 53 years old, married and had three children. To earn income, she fattens hogs and sells them to butchers in the village. She only earns about Php2,000 per hog disposal. She would like to keep growing healthy hogs for higher weight and more income upon selling them, but she needs additional capital to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her hogs' sustenance. She is asking for Php4,000. She wants to improve her skills in managing her small business in order to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.pt:
Lucinda nasceu em Manjacaze província de Gaza, vive maritalmente é mãe de 1 filha maior de idade, responsabiliza−se pelos seus dois enteados que vivem em sua casa. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para revender no mercado informal vulgo shoprite. 
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio construindo um estabelecimento comercial para a venda de produtos da primeira necessidade. O seu maior desafio é de manter o seu negócio como meio de subsistência.
texts.en:
Lucinda comes from Manjacaze, in the province of Gaza. She's married and has an adult daughter. She's responsible for her two stepchildren who live with her. With this loan she intends to purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling in the informal market commonly known as "shoprite".
In the future she intends to expand her business by building a store where she can sell products that are household staples. Her biggest challenge is keeping her business afloat as a means of livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.pt:
Bonifácio nasceu em Marromeu na província de Sofala tem 42 anos de idade, casado oficialmente é pai de 3 filhos todos frequentam a escola responsabiliza−se pelas duas irmãs que se encontram em Sofala.
Com este fundo almeja adquirir material de construção como: cimento, área, chapas de zinco e varões para concluir a sua casa. O seu maior sonho é de ultimar a sua obra e construir mercearia, mais tarde adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Bonifácio comes from Marromeu, in the province of Sofala. He's 42 years old and officially married. He has three children, all of whom attend school. He's responsible for his two sisters who live in Sofala.
With this loan he intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand, metal sheets and rods so he can finish his house. His biggest dream is to finish the construction work and build a grocery store, then later on acquire a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand, metal sheets and rods so he can finish his house.

loans.name: Marlene Emperatriz

texts.es:
La Sra Marlene Emperatriz, es una   mujer trabajadora, labora diario en un centro  educativo  de primaria .Es madre soltera con  una persona a su cargo en edad escolar, tiene15 años de trabajar allí.
     
Solicita el  préstamo a esta institución para invertir en compra  de uniforme  y útiles escolares, pago de matricula, lo cual será para un mejor nivel de vida.

 Agradece  a  Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en la educación de su hijo para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Marlene Emperatriz is a hard-working woman. She works every day at a primary school, where she has been employed for 15 years. She is a single mother and looks after one school-age child.

She is asking for a loan from this institution to buy a school uniform, school supplies and fees, which will pay for a better quality of life. She is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for this opportunity and for the confidence that has been placed in her. She therefore intends to invest this loan in her son's education to achieve a better future.

loans.use: to cover educational costs.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Rosario operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, like bananas which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells papaya and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits to expand her product inventory.

Rosario hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of fruits to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 44 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. 

Sara has been fattening pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from fish vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lisimaco

texts.es: Lisimaco, está casado, tiene 44 años y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. El con el dinero va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su maíz como el abono, fumigaciones y plaguicidas. El espera poder darle a su plantación una muy buena nutrición y así poder aumentar su cosecha para este año. El espera generar mayores ingresos que en años anteriores y satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar a su vez poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lisimaco is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children, who are his top priority. He will use the money to buy supplies to tend his corn, such as fertiliser, fumigation sprays, and pesticides.

By giving his plantation optimum nutrition, he hopes to be able to increase his yield for this year and thus generate a higher income than in previous years. This will allow him to meet his household's needs while also offering his family a better quality of life and economic stability.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Although he had no previous loan history with state banks, FUDECOSUR granted him the loan with better conditions and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow corn

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a married woman from Maynaguri who is raising her two children with great difficulty. Her husband is running a business of raw materials for production of industrial goods. She herself completed up to grade 9 so she would like to give proper education to her children. Her elder daughter is now studying in class VI (grade 6) and she wants to give her further education.

Her husband’s income is not sufficient to run a family, so Rima has had to struggle  for her daughter’s proper education but she failed. As soon as she met BJS field officers she came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) funding and she applied for a loan for her child’s education. She hopes she can improve her daughter’s education with this loan money. With the loan amount she will bear all the education-related costs for her daughter, Jayita, to cover her child’s education smoothly without any financial hazards.

She believes that no one can lead a happy, smooth life without education, and that is why she decided to expend all the loan money for her daughter’s education. She hopes that, with more support, her daughter Jayita will be able to succeed in the higher classes and will be properly educated. 

Rima and her daughter Jayita (as in the photo) are both very happy to get the financial support from BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear all the education-related costs for her daughter.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is married to Monoj and together they are raising three children (two sons and one daughter).  They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, straw and mud) in the small village of Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri. Minu is 33 years old and has a primary education whereas her husband, aged 33 years, is a labourer on daily wages.  Two of their children are students.  They are in grade 2 and grade 7.

Minu's husband's income is not good enough to cover all the necessities of their family, so it is scarcely possible for him to afford the increasing educational expenses of his children. Their son Bittu is 14 years old and is in grade 7. As Bittu is an intelligent student, his education is the main goal for Minu and her husband. They are trying their best to keep on providing him what he needs as best as they can and to help him to become an important person in future.

Minu heard that BJS gives education loans to needy and meritorious students so that they can keep on with their studies.  So, she has taken a loan from them. She plans to utilize the total loan amount for her son's education.  She will pay school fees and private tuition fees and purchase essential materials (books, pens, notebooks, geometry box, uniform, etc.) so that her son will not have to face any difficulties and can reach his goal smoothly.

Minu and her son (in the picture) give their thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to pay school fees and private tuition fees and purchase essential materials to give her son sufficient educational support.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase consumer goods such as a bed, a refrigerator and a stove.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 51-year-old mother of two who helps her husband earn a living by operating their own retail store while he works in a private company as a construction worker. For five years of selling grocery goods, the couple was able to provide for the family. Aida had to be determined in her work to give a better education to her children.

In order to enlarge her store, she is borrowing a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase more groceries to sell. She wants to have a better life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn, a mother of two, helps her husband operate their own retail business to make a living. For more than two years, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. Her husband also works as a collector in a private company. Edelyn borrowed a loan to buy additional beverages to sell in order to improve sales. In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional beverages to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Abejitas De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo abejitas de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está conformado por doña Ana Lucrecia, ella tiene 39 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, caballero y niño, en el área de Santo Tomaas de forma ambulante y los días sábados realiza su venta de la misma forma en Zacapa, ella está solicitando el crédito con el propósito de comprar pantalones de dama, caballero y niño, así como blusas y ropa interior para dama, con el  incrementar su mercadería y sobre todo, incrementar sus ingresos de ganancias, en cada mes, y asi satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y apoyar a su esposo a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, su anhelo es seguir siendo una mujer de negocios y seguir superándose, de la misma manera.
texts.en: The communal bank "Duo Abejitas de Santo Tomas" includes two women, one of whom is Ana Lucrecia.  She is 39 years old, and she has a business selling clothing for men, women, and children.  She sells from place to place in the area of Santo Tomas, and on Saturdays she sells the same way in Zacapa.  She is requesting a loan to buy pants for men, women and children, as well as blouses and underwear for women.  With this loan she will increase her inventory of merchandise and, most importantly, increase her income from her sales each month.  This way she will be able to meet the needs of her household and support her husband in order to improve her children's quality of life.  Ana Lucrecia's main desire is to continue being a businesswoman and excel in what she does.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a rural housewife, 27 years of age, and married to Dipen, who is 31 years old. They are raising three children (two sons and one daughter). They live in Maynaguri in the Jalpaiguri district in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, straw and mud). Anita studied up to grade 10 and her husband attended school up to grade 8.

Anita's children are receiving education and they are in grades 8, 5 and 3. The income of her husband is not satisfactory. Their income is irregular and not reliable for monthly expenditures, including school fees and other necessary expenses related to their children's education. But Anita and her husband are tireless and determined – they work hard to give the best to their children. Their younger daughter Anima, is in grade 5. She is a very meritorious student. She needs the help of a private tutor, which her parents cannot afford.

Anita has taken out a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) for her daughter's uninterrupted education. She wants to utilize the loan to pay for private tutors for her daughter and, at the same time, pay the school fees and purchase necessary educational articles for her daughter.

Anita and her daughter (in the picture) are very much thankful to the lenders BJS and Kiva for helping them to fulfill their dream.

loans.use: To purchase necessary  educational equipment and pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en: Fozia is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of that, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to purchase a new rickshaw as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of purchasing a new rickshaw. Therefore, Fozia, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Fozia is so much thankful to Kiva

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Vina is 45 years old and has five children. She is married and four of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs. In the future, Vina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Siridi Sai Group

texts.en:
Anima, aged about 27 years, is the group leader of a 12-member Self-Help Group of Bolangir Town situated in Bolangir district of Odisha, India. Her family comprises three members, her husband, one son of four years, and herself. The member seating first from the right in the first row, with a mobile phone in her hand is Anima. 

At present she is running a Fancy (personal products) store in the Daily Market of Bolangir. Her husband helps her in running the business in the morning and evening time when she is busy with her household work.  Anima is a very active lady who wants some extra income with her own efforts.

At present her family income is Rs.5,000 per month which is not sufficient to maintain her family. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income she wants to access a loan.  From the loan she will purchase mirrors, combs, beauty creams, face wash creams, soaps, etc., as Fancy items from a nearby wholesale market (Raipur) for her shop at a cheaper rate.  She has a dream to buy a stall from her income and educate her son in a better school.

The other 11 members of her groups are Nalini, Rebati, Sashikala, Sangita, Snehalata, Sima, Sabita, Arati, Sadhabani, Arati and Susmita. They also want a loan for different purposes like vegetable vending, grocery shop, betel shop, tailoring shop, utensil shop, brick making and selling, shoe shop and salon.

loans.use: to purchase mirrors, combs, beauty creams, face wash creams, soaps, etc., as Fancy items

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a hardworking woman with two children who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is also a responsible and hardworking person who is the family’s sole breadwinner. 
Abida is a client of Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is applying for a 25,000 PKR loan to buy a spray gun for her husband to use in his job painting cars. She feels it would be a good and helpful investment for him. 

Abida wishes to say she is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a spray gun to paint vehicles.

loans.name: Scarlyn Patricia

texts.es:
Scarlyn Patricia es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder continuar sus estudio, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Scarlyn Patricia, tengo 17 años y vivo en Higüey, provincia la Altagracia. Vivo con mi mama y mis dos hermanos menores,  mi padre falleció hace tres años y mi mama es quien ha hecho todo lo que está a su alcance para sostenernos, actualmente mi mama trabaja limpiando una Oficina. 
Desde que yo tenía 11 años me ha fascinado ayudar y servir a los demás, por eso quiero estudiar Medicina, porque veo esto como la oportunidad de ayudar en grande. Yo empecé a estudiar esta carrera y apenas voy en el primer cuatrimestre, estoy tomando las materias básicas y mis favoritas son las Ciencias Naturales, Química y Biología.  
En verdad necesito este préstamo porque no cuento con los recursos necesarios para pagar mis estudios y en caso de recibir este préstamo cambiaría mi vida, porque lograría todo lo que he anhelado, sé que puedo lograrlo también poniendo mi esfuerzo y dedicación. 
Mi meta es terminar mi carrera y convertirme en una excelente Doctora, una de las mejores. Mis sueños son tener mi propio centro de salud en el cual se ayude a las personas de muy pocos recursos  y también quiero ayudar a mi familia económicamente y servir de ejemplo de superación para los demás jóvenes de mi país.   Cuando termine mi carrera deseo también especializarme en Cardiología, ya que me gusta ese área de la medicina.
texts.en:
Scarlyn Patricia is a young student in medicine and she will use this loan to continue her studies. This is her story: My name is Scarlyn Patricia and I am 17 years old and I live in Higüey, a province of Altagracia. I live with my mother and my two younger brothers. My father passed away three years ago and my mother is who has been responsible for raising us on her own. She currently works as a cleaning lady in an office. 
Since I was 11 years old, I have wanted to help and serve others and that is why I want to study Medicine, because I see it as an opportunity to help on a larger scale. I began my studies in this field and I have just begun my first trimester. I am taking general education classes and my favorites are life sciences, chemistry and biology. 
The truth is, I need this loan because I do not have sufficient resources to pay my school costs and if I get this loan it would change my life because I would be able to achieve all I have dreamed. I know I can do so on my own with hard work and dedication. 
My goal is to finish my studies and become a great doctor, one of the best. My dream is to have my own practice where I will help lower income patients. I also want to be able to help my family financially and I want to serve as an example for other young people in my country. When I finish my core studies I want to specialize in Cardiology because I like this area of medicine.

loans.use: pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Дилбар. Ей 32 года. Она с мамой живет на районе Рудаки.  Дилбар не получила высшего образования она больше увлекалась шитьем. Ее мама научила ее шить и кроить, и вот уже течение 12 лет Дилбар самостоятельно берет заказы на шитье штор и занавесок. Дилбаре нравиться сам процесс работы. У нее есть швейные машинки старой модели, которые часто ломаются. Частые поломки тормозят ее работу. Но для приобретения новой швейной машинки у нее не хватает достаточной суммы денег. По этой причине она решилась обратиться за кредитом. Она надеется, что с Вашей помощью она сможет купить долгожданную швейную машинку
texts.en: The woman in the photograph is named Dilbar.  She is 32 years old.  She and her mother live in the district of Rudaki.  Dilbar did not receive a higher education - she is more fond of sewing.  Her mother taught her to sew and to tailor, and for 12 years now Dilbar has been filling orders for hand sewn curtains.  Dilbar likes the process of her work.  She has an old sewing machine, which often breaks.  Frequent break-downs impede her work, but she does not have sufficient funds to purchase a new sewing machine.  For this reason she decided to take out a loan.  She hopes, that with your help, she can purchase her long-awaited sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Imteiaz

texts.en:
Imteiaz is conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her son appears in the photo.

Imteiaz  is a 44-year-old married woman from Deir el Balah city. She lives with her husband and three kids; one son and two daughters. Imteiaz's husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. Imteiaz 's son works iwith his rickshaw; he buys groceries and food and resells them to the supermarkets in his area. It is a good business and he covers part of the family expenses. 

Imteiaz took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her son to buy a new rickshaw to work with instead of the old one . This will improve his job and also his income.

loans.use: to help her son to buy a new rickshaw to work with instead of the old one

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her new storefront location

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn is 43 years old and married, with four children. She currently lives with her spouse and two children in Baray, Kampong Thom while her two oldest children live and work in Phnom Penh. Vorn is engaged in raising pigs to supplement her husband’s income, earned from farming activities and providing motor transportation services.

Vorn is borrowing a loan in order to buy a plot of land for housing purposes. As she mentioned, she won’t use the land for herself, but for her children, after they get married. 

In the future, she will strive to work to ensure the overall welfare for her family and to save money to expand her family-owned business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for her children.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector founded MONHEC Corp in 2010 but has been working in the cleaning supply industry for years. He acts as an intermediary between small businesses and cleaning supply companies by offering a direct partnership with which smaller businesses can purchase relatively small cleaning supply orders. 

Hector works on a 15% commission and hopes to continue to expand his enterprise by finding additional small businesses in need of his services. He hopes to expand his marketing potential and increase his capital supply to help increase the overall reach of his enterprise. 

Hector serves an invaluable role for small businesses that would not otherwise be able to buy cleaning supplies. He has tapped into a growing and needy market, but simply lacks the resources to make his services known. 

Help Hector fulfill his vision and continue to facilitate small businesses with their cleaning supply needs.

loans.use: to increase his marketing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace, who is married, works hard to support her family. For 32 years now, she has operated a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines. 

Now requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo for weaving, Mary Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo for weaving

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell fish business. Elvira is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net for her business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net for her business

loans.name: Barsha Shg Group

texts.en:
The self help group “Barsha Shg” is starting its first loan cycle with People's Forum. This group consists of 10 members and Maina is the president. She is the lady standing with her hand raised in the picture. The members of this self help group are engaged in various businesses such as producing and selling vegetables, selling food, producing milk, and selling flowers.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Maina. She says that she has a business in which she produces and sells vegetables and also sells cow's milk. She learned the trade from her family since they had the same type of business. With a small amount of capital, she was able to start her own enterprise. 

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying cows. She will acquire the animals in her community and raise them. Maina will sell her products at the markets in the city of Jeypore. Working in this manner enables her to generate income so that she can support her family. Maina is 36 years old a married lady and has one son. 

When asked what she likes about People's Forum, Maina said that she enjoys the loans and the training classes offered by the organization. She is very grateful to KIVA lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: To purchase cows for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.en:
Jose owns and operates Mobile Works Express, a motorcycle repair shops that is dedicated to timely repairs and customer satisfaction. After obtaining motorcycle repair certification, Jose sought to pursue the American Dream and create his own enterprise. 

He currently has a steady stream of demand for his services and does not have any employees at this time. He is hoping to expand. However, his business has limited reach due to the lack of necessary tools and machinery.
 
Help Jose purchase the necessary tools for the success of his business. Jose hopes to purchase a box truck with a tire changer and balancer to better facilitate his customers' needs. 

Help Jose achieve his business needs and enable him to expand.

loans.use: to purchase a box truck with a tire changer and balancer

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda works hard to support her family. Rolinda is married, and has a buy and sell vegetable and spices business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of vegetables and spices to sell.

Rolinda has been in this business for four years now, and also earns an additional income from a general store and a coconut grinder.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, no estudio ya que sus papas, no la mandaron a la escuela, por su situación de pobreza en la que vivían,esta acompañada y su pareja trabaja como vigilante para un ingenio, ellos viven solos, ya que sus hijos están acompañados. 


Ella trabaja en la criá de ganado de engorde en repasto, aprendió este trabajo, ya que no sabia hacer otra cosa  y por falta de estudio, nunca pudo encontrar un empleo digno, todos los días por la mañana arrea sus animales por casi 2 kilómetros, hasta llegar al potrero y por la tarde va a traerlos de regreso a casa.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a  CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una vaca que este próxima a parir, para obtener ingresos diarios de la venta de leche y suplir otras necesidades de su familia. 

Reina, planea trabajar muy duro para ahorrar y comprar 7,000 metros cuadrados de tierra, para pastar  sus animales y sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Reina did not study because her parents did not send her to school due to the poverty in which they lived. She has a partner who works as a security guard for a factory. They live alone, since their children all have partners.

She works raising beef cattle. She learned this work because she did not know how to do anything else, and due lack of education she could never find decent employment. Every day in the morning she drives her animals for almost 2 kilometers until arriving at the pasture, and in the afternoon she brings them back to the house.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy a cow that is close to giving birth in order to obtain daily income from the sale of milk and to cover other needs of her family.

Reina plans to work very hard in order to save and buy 7,000 square meters of land to pasture her animals and grow corn.

loans.use: to buy a cow that is close to giving birth

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.en:
Maria Rita is 62 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maria Rita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from buy and sell nipa roofing.

Maria Rita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, age 39, is a house wife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers sheltering services. Shehnaz is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Shehnaz hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails and iron sheets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.en:
Nuriya is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, in the department of Business Administration. Here is her story:

“I am a freshmen student of AUCA from Tajikistan. Tajikistan's economy is not stable and needs specialists to develop it economically. For this, the country needs young and energetic people who would bring change to the country so that most of the migrants could come back from Russia and be employed locally. Therefore, my goal is to study and be part of the team who are ready to sacrifice their time and contribute towards prosperity of their country.

I want to be a leader in my society, to lead the communities towards a better life through seeking opportunities to create employment.  I would be able to achieve my goal through studying at a university such as the American University of Central Asia. AUCA is one of the most prestigious universities in whole central Asia . The alumni of this university, today, are working in governmental and non-governmental organizations and are leaders in societies.

I liked being a part of the school team who have been volunteering in different activities. Since 2011, I have actively been engaged in the school life and organized different activities; for example, in 2012 I was leading the team who was responsible for organizing a 'high-school winter ball' event for students finishing school. I actively volunteered in the Aga-Khan health service organization (AKHS) as a finance assistant. Sometimes I translated for foreign workers, who came from other countries.  It is my pleasure to help other people, and the most perfect thing about my volunteering is that I got a lot of experience in the field of financing by watching how other people work in this field. Moreover, I volunteer in a civil society club; as a volunteer, I have been participating in a fund raising project to help disabled children with buying books and drawing accessories so that they would also be part of the society and not ignored. So, an AUCA education will be an invaluable experience contributing to the long run to the fulfillment of my career goals.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, a 55-year-old married woman, is requesting a loan for the maintenance of her son’s auto rickshaw. He provides transportation services to passengers primarily during the evening when fares are higher than those charged during the day. 

Unfortunately, a few weeks ago Razia's husband borrowed the rickshaw at night and had an accident, resulting in significant damage to the vehicle. In order to get it operational, Razia has requested a loan for repairs. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for their support.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her son's rickshaw

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is a 37-year-old married woman with three children who are attending school. She has a few pieces of land for rice cultivation. This is her major source of income for her family. She has been doing this for nearly 15 years, and earns a proper income of USD 4.16 per day.

Kheng had planned to improve her household sanitation practices in order to promote their health. 

Due to inadequate money, she is asking for a loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. With the remaining funds, she will renovate her kitchen to be a good place to serve food for her family. 

Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Kheng is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Mama Sadio

texts.fr:
Mama Sadio habite au sud du Sénégal mariée âgée de 53 ans ,mère de 10 enfants :dont 8 enfants vivants,5 garçons 3 filles.L'aine et son frère sont des enseignants , ainé enseigne dans le française son petit frère dans l'arabe.Une fille et un garçon sont à l'université 2fills sont mariées,les 2 garçons sont dans le métier .
Mama sadio a bénéficié de 2 crédits au sein l'imcec qui ont été remboursés dans de bonnes conditions .Mama sadio a fait 10 ans d'expérience dans le commerce de fruits et légumes.Avec son commerce elle a acheté un terrain dans la ville,ou son fils ainés a construit sa maison.Elle fait le commerce présentement pour épargné de l'argent et faire de petites dépenses pour ses petits fils
texts.en:
Mama Sadio lives in South Senegal and is 53 years old. She is married with 10 children from  whom she has eight grandchildren, five boys and three girls. Her eldest child and his brother are teachers, the eldest teaches in French and the younger brother teaches in Arabic. One boy and one girl are at university, two girls are married and the two boys are in the business.
Mama Sadio received two loans from Imcec which were repaid correctly. Mama Sadio has 10 years’ experience in selling fruit and vegetables. Thanks to her business she purchased a plot of land in town where her oldest son built his house. At present she continues the business to save up some money for small expenses for her grandsons.

loans.use: to buy gumbo and chili.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Eldoret area of North Rift Kenya with her husband and four children, ages 8 to 14 years. She has been involved in farming for 11 years with her primary income source coming from the sale of milk, eggs and crops. She loves dairy farming the most. Her biggest challenge is difficulty feeding the animals during the dry spell.
Rose chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they will help her improve her dairy farming business. During the training, she learned that after taking the loan she will not divert it for something else. This loan will help increase her feed supply for the dairy cows so they will produce more and increase Rose's income level. Her family will have an improved lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, cooking supplies and Khangas (native garments).

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock to sell like chips, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

Eufemia has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock to sell like chips, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc

loans.name: Walter Alexander

texts.es:
Walter de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta septimo grado de eduación básica, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica alas oficios domesticos, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian los grados de tercero y septimo, con su pareja son los responsables de mantenerlos.

Al cliente desde que tenia 10 años de edad, su padre lo llevaba al campo a sembrar y fue asi que aprendió y se dedicó a la agricultura. Actualmente, tiene sembrado 7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca, a unos 10 metros de su casa y se va caminando.

Walter necesita el prestamo, para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde siembra y pagar el sueldo a las personas que le limpian y clasifican el frijol que acaba de consechar, para venderlo al gobierno.

El sueño para el negocio, es que siga en aumento y poder sembrar mucho más para generar mayor ingresos, tambien que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Walter, who is 34 years old, has a seventh-grade education. He lives with his partner, who is a homemaker, and has three children. Two of them are in third and seventh grade respectively. He and his partner are responsible for supporting them. 

When Walter was ten years old, his father started taking him to the fields to farm, and that is how he learned and became a farmer. He is currently growing cassava on 1.7 acres of land, located about thirty feet from his house. 

Walter needs this loan in order to pay rent on the land he uses, and to pay a salary to the people who will clean and sort the beans he has just harvested before selling them to the government. 

He hopes his business to stay on the rise and to be able to plant a lot more so that he can generate higher income. He also wants his children to have a career.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land he farms and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo-3 Group

texts.en:
Priscilla is 46 years old, single mother of two children. She is no longer living with her children’s father and does not depend on him to support her children. For the past three years, Priscilla has run a business selling African fabric. She has been a client of ID-Ghana for one year. Priscilla is the leader of a two-member loan group called Ekome Feemo-3. Eric is 33 years old and has a business selling ready-made menswear. 

Priscilla is requesting a loan to buy more African fabric to sell to customers. She will use the profit from her loan to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy African fabric to sell to customers

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
Theresa, a member of Promise group, is 47 and a married mother with two children who are 19 and 13 years old. Both of her children go to school. She is standing in the middle of the photograph and sells ladies dresses door to door.

She has been doing this job for three years to support her husband who is a mechanic. As a mother, she would not sit back and leave all responsibilities on her husband so she saved some money from the sale of charcoal, which enabled her to engage in the sale of ladies dress in town. This has enabled her to meet her family needs.

Theresa has dreams of expanding her business and educating her children up to higher levels of learning so they have a bright future.

Theresa lacks enough capital, which has led to the sluggish growth of her business. She, therefore, needs a loan to boost her business.

So together with Emelia and Diana, the group needs a total of GHS 2200 to boost their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more ladies dresses to sell

loans.name: Khara Shg Group

texts.en:
Subhadra is 27 years old, a married lady who has two children and lives with her husband in a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. In the photo the lady standing with raised hand is Subhadra. She has been earning a living through cultivating vegetables for 10 years. The current business earns her about 3,000 INR per month to meet the family’s needs.

Now Subhadra is leading her group called "Khara Shg" to ask for a loan.  Subhadra is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and to buy goats to raise. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to improve her living conditions.

She is very grateful to KIVA and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and to buy goats to raise

loans.name: Majeeda's Group

texts.en:
Majeeda is a 54-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four; her husband is doing a job in a nearby factory. 

She owns a small business selling ladies ready-made garments at home. She purchased ready-made garments from the market, along her husband, at a low price, and sells it at a high price. The ladies of the town like her clothing selection for dresses, and demand more variety to wear at wedding ceremonies. She suggests to the ladies which dress best suits the person and which should be worn according to occasion.  

Her husband is able to cover all of the expenses from his earnings, so she contributes her earnings to savings. 

She has requested a loan so she can buy a bigger variety of garments to fulfill the demand.

Majeeda dreams of a bright future for her children; her dream to provide better facilities for them.

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Candida Dolores

texts.es: Candida tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos de 17 años, 15 años, 13 años, 10 años y 8 años de edad. Candida se dedica a la venta de hojas de banano que son utilizadas para la elaboración de tamales comida típica del país. Candida desea terminar un cuarto que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento, hierro y lámina galvanizada. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder terminar el cuarto lo antes posible.
texts.en: Candida is 52 years old and lives in in her own home with her husband and their five children, aged 17, 15, 13, 10, and 8 years old. Candida works selling banana leaves, which are used for making tamales - a typical food in El Salvador. Candida wishes to finish constructing a room in her home, which for lack of economic resources she has not yet been able to complete. As a result, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to buy bricks, sand, cement, iron bars and sheet metal. She hopes to receive this loan in order to finish the room as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, iron bars, and sheet metal to finish constructing a room

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer empresaria de 41 años de edad, acompañada, con cuatro hijos, su negocio es de una mini pulpería en su domicilio, tiene siete años de tenerla y 13 años de ser cliente de la institución anteriormente vendía mercadería en general, este crédito lo invertirá en productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite en bidón, queso, mortadelas, salsa naturas, café presto, medicamentos populares etc.
texts.en: Silvia is a 41-year-old businesswoman. She is in a relationship and has four children. Her business is a mini grocery store in her home, and she has had this business for seven years. She has been a client of the institution for thirteen years; previously she sold general merchandise. She will invest this loan in products such as rice, beans, sugar, canisters of oil, cheese, mortadella, natural sauces, Presto instant coffee, popular medications, etc.

loans.use: to invest in products such as rice, beans, sugar, canisters of oil, cheese, mortadella, natural sauces, Presto instant coffee, popular medications, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, iron, sand, purlins, and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz es una empresaria exitosa soltera,  su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, y ropa usada, de tener su negocio tiene cinco años, ella misma atiende su negocio. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa nueva, actualmente vende ropa usada que a diversificado su actividad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas mixtas de primer calidad.
texts.en: Luz is a successful entrepreneur. She is single and has her own business selling new and used clothing items. She has run her business for 5 years and is the one serving the customers. She used to sell only new clothes, but now includes used items to diversify the activity. She will use the loan to buy mixed clothing sets of the first quality.

loans.use: to buy mixed sets of used clothes of the first quality.

loans.name: Logan Javier

texts.es: Logan es un empresario de éxito, es soltero le tienen dos hijos desde hace 18 años tiene su negocio de la venta de lubricantes, repuestos de vehículos. El mismo y uno de sus hijos le ayudan en  la administración del negocio, con el préstamo anterior logra mantener en existencias productos que antes  no vendía, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de aceite en litros, aceite de dos tiempos, llantas para moto, calcomanía, filtros etc.
texts.en: Logan is a successful businessman. He is single and has two sons. He has had his business, selling auto lubricants and doing repairs, for the last 18 years. He runs the business with one of his sons. He used the last loan to maintain stock of products which he wasn't able to sell before; and will invest this loan in the purchase of liters of oil, 2-stroke oil, motorcycle tires, bumper stickers, filters, etc.

loans.use: to buy car accessories, tires, batteries, additives, lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large-scale cleaning equipment

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Ekofusion Group

texts.es:
Grupo EKOFUSIÓN
San Antonio de Belén, Heredia

El grupo está integrado por 5 mujeres que pertencen a una familia, y ellas desarrollan alternativas que contribuyan al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de cada una de las integrantes, por medio de la producción y comercialización de productos elaborados bajo la técnica  de Vitrofusión, utilizando materiales de vidrio reciclables, aportando así un beneficio al medio ambiente. 

La Vitrofusión es el arte de moldear el vidrio sometiéndolo a altas temperaturas en hornos especiales, obteniendo objetos y accesorios de gran belleza gracias al color aplicado y a la transparencia del material, con un toque de creatividad. Se trata de una técnica propia del siglo XX, ya que requiere contar con una herramienta muy especial que es el horno de termo formado, que toma las piezas de vidrio y las moldea para generar elementos únicos e innovadores.

EKOFUSION es una alternativa de acceso a la actividad productiva,  apropiada para mujeres que por su condición de vulnerabilidad, y su situación económica, no han podido  accesar a estudios superiores, lo cual sumado al desempleo del país, obliga a buscar un desarrollo económico y social. Ileana, es la presidenta del grupo, madre de 2 hijos, busca apoyar económicamente a su familia con este negocio, trabaja durante las mañanas y dedica la tarde a la comercialización. Trabaja en el taller y otras 2 compañeras asisten a ferias a promocionar el producto en las comunidades cercanas.

Con este proyecto se quiere abrir una puerta de esperanza para el  desarrollo y formación, generando una solución no sólo económica sino asegurando calidad de vida, y generación de empleo a corto plazo.

Al mismo tiempo se aporta beneficio al cuidado del medio ambiente al utilizar materiales reciclables como botellas y vidrio reciclado, estas se obtienen en la comunidad a un costo mínimo y ayudan a los vecinos enseñando la manera de reciclar el vidrio y contribuyen a disminuir la contaminación.
texts.en:
Ekofusion Group
San Antonio de Belén, Heredia

This group is made up of five women who belong to the same family. They are developing alternatives that contribute to the improvement in their quality of life through the production and sale of products made through the Vitrofusión technique, which uses recycled glass materials. This supports the well being of the environment.

Vitrofusión is the art of molding glass by using high temperatures in special ovens. It produces very beautiful accessories and objects due to the colors applied and the transparency of the material, with a touch of creativity. It is a unique 20th century technique, as it requires a very special tool, a thermoformed oven, that takes the pieces of glass and molds them to create special and innovative items.

Ekofusion is an alternative for working women to access a productive business given their vulnerability and financial circumstances. They were unable to access higher education, which, together with the unemployment in the country, pushed them to find economic and social opportunities on their own.

Ileana, one of the members of this group, is a mother of two children. She wants to support her family financially with this business. They work in the mornings, and in the afternoons they sell their product. She is one of the women that works in the workshop and two other women go to markets and sell their product in the nearby communities.

They want to open a door of hope for their own development and growth with this project, creating not just an economic solution, but also ensuring quality of life and creating jobs in the short term. At the same time they are helping to care for the environment by using recycled materials like bottles and recycled glass that they get from their community at minimal cost. They also help their neighbors by teaching them how to recycle glass and helping to decrease pollution.

loans.use: to buy raw materials,

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Meet Dorcas, a resident of the Eldoret area of North Rift Kenya. She is a farmer and is married and with four children all of whom are of school age. She is a mixed farmer but enjoys dairy farming most and has been in it for five years. She produces and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops.

Dorcas chose Juhudi Kilimo because they give out their loans at low interest rates. During the training, she learnt that micro finances do help small income earners to grow economically. This loan will increase milk for selling and for her family to consume.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

Lolita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 53 years old and the mother of four children. Her son owns a clothing business, buying from a wholesaler and selling it as a retailer from his shop. He has lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him. He has good reputation in his town and his business is going well. Due to the increasing demand, he wants to benefit from this opportunity.
Therefore, Safia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy more clothing to fulfill the demand and generate more profit.
Safia dreams of a bright future for her children, establishing their businesses to improve the living standard of her family.
She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her son's business.

loans.name: Miriam Lizeth

texts.es:
Miriam es una joven de 33 años de edad agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 4 hijos quienes están estudiando en la primaria en la escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación. Ella en compañía de su esposo se dedica al cultivo de café realizando actividades como limpieza, abono, corte, recolecta entre otras como proceso para llevar a cabo la venta del grano al final de la temporada. Aprendió esta actividad desde niña con sus padres ya que ellos son agricultores por tradición familiar y la tierra que juntos trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia familiar la cual está ubicada a 10 kilómetros desde su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan en autobús de ruta de la comunidad. Sus clientes tienen bodegas que exclusivamente se dedican a la compra-venta de café y en otras localidades cercanas de donde ella vive. Como segunda fuente de ingresos doña Miriam también se dedica a la cría de cerdos los cuales están en la parte de atrás de su casa de habitación.  
Ella solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL que permitirá adquirir suministros agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, foliares, entre otros que ayudaran  a proteger sus cultivos de café y obtener una excelente cosecha. Su mayor anhelo y más grande sueño es poder graduar a sus hijos de la universidad para que en el futuro puedan valerse por sí mismos ya que como herencia es lo mejor que puede brindarles. También seguir fortaleciendo la propiedad para poder seguir cultivando más café y sus ingresos puedan cada día mejorar.
texts.en:
Miriam's a 33-year-old young woman.  She's a farmer, a homemaker, and the mother of four children who are in different grades of elementary school in the community school.

Miriam and her husband grow coffee, doing jobs such as weeding, fertilizing, cutting, and harvesting so they can sell the beans at the end of the season.  She learned this job when she was a little girl from her parents, who are farmers by family tradition.  The land Miriam farms is her own, thanks to a family inheritance.  It's located 10 kilometers from her house so she gets there on the community bus.  Her customers have warehouses devoted exclusively to buying and selling coffee in other areas near where she lives.

Miriam has a second source of income from raising pigs, which she keeps behind her house.

She's asking the COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan so she can buy soil amendments, fertilizer, foliars, and other agricultural supplies to help protect her coffee crops and get an excellent harvest.

Miriam's greatest desire and biggest dream is for her children to graduate from college so they can take care of themselves.  This is the best legacy she can give them.  She also wants to continue strengthening her property so she can grow more coffee and improve her income every day.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is a married mother of four children. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Doris Isabel

texts.es:
Doris tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera y tiene dos hijos, uno vive con ella que estudia primer año de bachillerato y el otro vive con su tía, además la madre de Doris también vive en casa.

Doris se dedica solamente a los oficios domésticos y lo hace desde que tuvo su primer hijo, ella recibe la ayuda económica de su madre y una parte del padre de sus hijos, quien le ayuda con los gastos educativos.

Ella necesita este préstamo, para comprar laminas (material de metal), madera y construir el techo de la cocina pues prácticamente está descubierto y necesita repararlo, además se acerca la época de invierno y le urge evitar que entre agua a su casa, lo que es riesgoso para su familia.

Doris sueña con que sus hijos terminen de estudiar bachillerato y que puedan estudiar en la universidad, además desea mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doris is 35 years old, she studied through high school, she is single and she has two children: one lives with her and is a student attending the first year of high school, the other lives with his aunt; Doris' mother also lives with her.

Doris is a housewife, having been engaged in household tasks only since the birth of her first child; she gets economic help from her mother, as well as from the father of her children, who helps her paying for education expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy tiles of metal and wood to build a roof over the kitchen: the room is practically exposed and the roof needs repairing. Moreover, the winter season is approaching, and she urgently needs to avoid that water enters her house, as this would be very dangerous for her family. 

Doris dreams that her children will complete their high school studies and that they will be able to attend university; she also wishes to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy tiles and wood to repair the kitchen roof.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Jaime tiene 55 años y más de 30 años de casado. El tiene 3 hijos, todos ellos ya son independientes y uno vive en Estados Unidos y el quisiera que regresara. Su esposa mi esposa se llama Mirelia y actualmente tiene 3 hermosos nietos. Jaime tiene una papelería desde hace 10 años, en ella vende todo tipo de articulos,como; cuadernos, plumas, lapices, resistol, etc. También tiene un negocio de articulos de limpieza, y los sabados y domingos vende carnitas. Gracias a todos estos negocios ha podido adquirir una casa propia y comprar un coche. Esta solicitando el prestamos para comprar mercancía para su papelería y en el futuro le gustaría tener una casa más grande.
texts.en:
Jaime is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story.

Jaime is 55 years old and has been married for over 30 years.  He has three children, all of whom are independent, and one of whom lives the in United States and he wishes he would come back.  His wife's name is Mirelia and they currently have three beautiful grandchildren.  Jaime has had a stationery shop for 10 years where he sells all kinds of things, such as notebooks, pens, pencils, glue, etc.  He also has a cleaning products business and on Saturdays and Sundays he sells carnitas.  Thanks to all of his businesses, he has been able to get his own home and to buy a car.  He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for his stationery shop and in the future he would like to have a larger home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his stationery shop like notebooks, pens, etc.

loans.name: Markhabat

texts.en:
Markhabat is a freshman student in the International and Comparative Politics program. This is her story:
“ICP program is very interesting for me. I think it is very important and good to know the problems and news of different governments in the world as politicians enact legislation which regulates vital processes of the citizens. For example, as for our government, two of our presidents had run away during the revolutions which caused instability in Kyrgyzstan. In my opinion, we have too many deputies in our little country and most of them just rest in the government. If we had some new, modern, well-educated and practiced young politicians, who could bring forth the new ideas and be able to govern properly, Kyrgyzstan would have been investment-attractive and developed.
Therefore I have chosen to study ICP at AUCA. AUCA education is very qualified and I am sure that I will get real knowledge here. Since the University is  international, I strongly believe that I would have a chance to participate in presentations of peer students who will share their experience that would greatly influence my knowledge and expertise. I would have a chance to understand my world better through listening to others. As my mother is the only one who supports our family, I am in need of Kiva loan. I will do my best to study well, to graduate successfully and to become one of the best alumni of AUCA.”

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Gabriela tiene 47 años, esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio desde hace más de 20 años, anteriormente trabajaba en una mueblería pero esta quebró, con el dinero que le dieron de liquidación decidio inscribirse en un curso de cosmología y así como inicio su negocio.
Ella tiene un consultorio donde ofrece distintos tipos de masajescomo:  anti-estress, reductivos, para cenos, drenaje linfatico, anti-celulitico, obesidad y otros dependiendo del servicio que el cliente le pida.  Ella esta solicitando el préstamo, porqué le surgió la oportunidad de comprar una maquina que le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos. 
Gabriela dice que sus principales logros son verse bien, sentirse bien y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a client up Kubo Financiero and this is her story. 

Gabriela is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  She has been a business owner for over 20 years; she used to work at a furniture store, but it went bankrupt and with the severance money they gave her she decided to enroll in a cosmetology course, which is how she started her business.  

She has a studio where she offers different types of massage, such as anti-stress, weight-loss, breast, lymphatic drainage, anti-cellulite, obesity, and others, depending on the service the client requests.  She is asking for this loan because an opportunity arose for her to buy a machine that will help her increase her earnings.  

Gabriela tells us that her main achievements are looking good, feeling good, and having financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a massage machine and an air conditioner for her massage studio

loans.name: Djenebaton Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Djenebaton vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Daoulabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce du beurre de karité, d’habillements, des ustensiles et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire.
Madame Djeneba (1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de beurre de karité  dans le village de Daoulabougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité suffisante de beurre de karité pour satisfaire d’avantage la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Djeneba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the Fotemaban group all live in polygamous families. They average 35 years old with 3 children each. They all live in the village of Daoulabougou, in the Ségou region (4th Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). They met through neighbors, relatives, marriage, and their businesses in the village. 

They sell shea butter, clothing, utensils and condiments. With the goal of increasing their business in mind, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their 1st solidarity loan cycle. 

Djeneba (the woman standing on the left in the photo) is a successful shea butter vendor in the village of Daoulabougou and the surrounding areas. She intends to use her loan to buy enough shea butter to better meet the demands of her customers. She sells her shea butter for cash or on credit to mostly female customers. 

Djeneba hopes that the loan will enable her to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 CFA Francs, which will be used to pay the schooling fees for her children and to increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes and cereals.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa, está casado, tiene 39 años y vive con su esposo y 4 hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su plantación. Ella se dedica a la plantación del cacao desde ya hace varios años y le ha ido muy bien por lo cual quiere mejorar su plantación para estas próximas cosechas y así poder generar más producción para generar mayores ingresos para su bienestar. Ella espera poder aumentar sus ganancias económicas y mejorar su nivel económico y salir adelante con su proyecto. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ana Luisa is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 4 children who are her first priority. With the loan she will purchase inputs to protect her plantation. She has been working her cocoa plantation for a number of years and things have been going well. She wants to improve her plantation for the next harvests so that she can generate more production and generate more income for her well-being.
