She hopes to increase her revenues and improve her standard of living and get ahead with the project. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never had a loan with the State Banks but FUDECOSUR has offered this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant cocoa.

loans.name: Norlie

texts.en:
Norlie is 39 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Norlie has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from selling split bamboo.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Madeleine Nadine

texts.fr: Madeleine est une jeune dame mariée âgée de 31 ans mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 7 et 12 ans. Elle a un bar qu'elle gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 2 ans. c'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux, elle a développer une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital, d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité car il lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter ses casiers de boissons mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a young woman who is 31 years old. She is married and the mother of four children between the ages of 7 and 12. She has been running a bar in the capital for two years. Thanks to this business, she can meet the needs of her family.  

Her know-how has helped her develop a growing clientele. She can no longer satisfy their needs due to limited capital. She needs a business loan, as it will allow her not only to increase her drink storage, but also her profit margin. She will reinvest the profits in her business so that it can grow. The rest will help her family.

loans.use: increase her storage for drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, wheat flour, and charcoal

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat, 44 years old, is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children and a very hard working and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and tuition in evening. It is a challenge for her to afford the school and tuition fees, so she has to do a lot of hard work to run her house. She owns a small beauty parlor at home and her husband is doing small jobs at a firm. Both contribute their full income to pay the household expenses. With the passage of time, her beauty products are going to be depleted and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Riffat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and combs for her salon. She hopes that through this loan, she will be able to enhance her business.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as facial cream, hair color, scissors and combs

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Alice est une femme âgée de 49 ans marié mère de 5 enfants donc le moins âgé est de 15ans et le plus âgée est de 26 ans son activité date de 2 ans dans un marché de la capital elle fait dans la vente des assiettes surfilage des vêtements. elle se retournée vers nous pour de l'aide dans le but d'augmenter sa marchandises dans l'objectif de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèles et de pouvoir prendre soins de sa famille , et de pouvoir léguer plus tard.
texts.en:
Alice is a 49-year-old married woman with five children.  Her youngest child is fifteen years old, and the eldest is twenty-six years old.  She has been selling clothing at a market in the capital city for two years.  She has requested this loan from the field partner in order to increase her stock of merchandise, so she can satisfy her customers.  

Alice would like to be able to provide more for the needs of her family, and to be able to bequeath something to them in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is 49 years old, married and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw days and nights. He has been continuously driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional condition. 

For this reason, Raheela has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw. He wants to buy new tires and do some engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her family and will bring positive changes to her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is the 35 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a plumber by profession. He has been doing plumbing services for many years and meeting all the expense of his family by himself. He provides the services for underground piping connections, fitting of taps, and digging wells. He obtained a list of good customers in a short time and his business is going well. He does not have a drill machine for well digging so he has been renting a drill machine. Now, he wants to buy a well drill machine and some new tools such as a wrench, tube cutter, pipe threader, tube flaring, soldering torch, tile spade, shovel, digging bar etc. to continue his services but he does not have enough cash on hand.  Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a well drilling machine and other tools for plumbing. 

Shakeela thanks Kiva and field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a well-drilling machine and other tools for plumbing

loans.name: Nonnami Floride Clémence Ahomagnon's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Nonnami Floride Clémence (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans, est mariée à un certain Jules. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Nonnami Floride Clémence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Nonnami Floride Clémence et son mari. C’est pour cette raison que Nonnami Floride Clémence vend à son domicile des jus à base de fruit de baobab et de feuille de bissap depuis cinq ans. Nonnami Floride Clémence s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Nonnami Floride Clémence ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, named Nonnami Floride Clémence (shown in the photo with her hand raised) is 29 years old, and is married to her husband, Jules. The couple has two children, both of whom are in school and are their dependents. Nonnami Floride Clémence lives with her ​​husband and children. The various family expenses are borne by Nonnami Floride Clémence and her husband.

For this reason, Nonnami Floride Clémence has been selling baobab and hibiscus leaf juices from her home for the past five years. Nonnami Floride Clémence purchases her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to increase her level of business, and to satisfy her clientele, Nonnami Floride Clémence, together with the other members of her group, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hibiscus leaves and fruit of the baobab

loans.name: Fifonsi Gbenondou 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI GBENONDOU 2 est constitué de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe nommée Houevi Jeannette(celle qui a la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans, n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Houevi Jeannette est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Michel. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Houevi Jeannette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. Pour cette raison, Houevi Jeannette vend de la bouillie, du thé et des liqueurs dans sa région depuis trente ans. Houevi Jeannette s’approvisionne dans un  marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Houevi Jeannette et les membres du groupe FIFONSI GBENONDOU 2, sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Fifonsi Gbenondou 2 group is made up of two people who live in the same area. The representative of the group, Houevi Jeannette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 48 years old. She did not go to school. She is married to a fisherman named Michel. The couple has five children, who are under their care and who go to school. The family lives together, and together the couple takes care of the various household expenses.

For this reason, Houevi Jeannette has been selling porridge, tea, and liquors in her area for 30 years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin.

This is the second time that Houevi Jeannette and the members of the  Fifonsi Gbenondou 2 group are seeking financial support from Alide. Their goal is to strengthen their businesses in order to better respond to customer needs. Their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy additional porridge and liquors for sale

loans.name: Harvey

texts.en:
Harvey chose to found Alberlin Transportation in 2009 and has enjoyed every second since. Working with his wife and now servicing larger contracts from Midwest Manufacturing, Harvey hopes to continue to expand his business and increase his customer base. 

Due largely to his innovative personality, Harvey has found a way to cut costs and help to save the environment. By installing new filters and slightly modifying his truck’s engine, he can reduce emissions and become 20% more fuel efficient. 

He needs your help to finance this endeavor. The savings alone will help to pay and even build a return on the investment in the near future. 

Help Harvey continue to initiate a more cost effective business model today.

loans.use: to modify his engine to decrease fuel costs

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a farmer living in Eldoret area of the North Rift region of Kenya. He is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 14 years. He has been farming for 14 years and his main source of income is from the sale of milk, eggs, and mixed crops. He really enjoys feeding his dairy cows so that they become more productive. His biggest challenge is feeding his animals during dry seasons.
Abraham chose Juhudi Kilimo for his loan because they target small-holder farmers in improving their livelihoods and he wants to improve his livelihood. During the training, he learned how to develop a savings mentality. The output from this loan will cause his dairy cows to produce more milk for him to sell and hence generate more income. This will help him pay his children's school fees and also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José Santos tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Puente Techin, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente arroz, frutales, café, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El tiene una pequeña bodeguita donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, José ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de barrotes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Nestor is 69.  He lives with his wife and children in Puente Techin, a rural area in the Pucará district.  This community has a hot climate and people there work in agriculture, raising livestock and growing mainly rice, fruit, and coffee, which they also sell.  The area is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the Cajamarca region in northern Peru.  He has a small shop where he offers essential products with the help of his wife.  He has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a variety of groceries so he can grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of essential products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eight bales of new clothes

loans.name: Epuphanie

texts.en: Epuphanie is a Cameroonian aged twenty-five, married with a child aged two. She has been in this business for over a year now, which makes her experienced. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her revenue by fifteen percent.

loans.use: to buy things such as groundnuts, oil, ovaltine, eggs, bread, salt, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Diego Fernando

texts.es:
El es diego fernando, estudiante actual de la institución campo alto, se encuentra realizando el programa técnico en ensamble y mantenimiento de computadores, el cual desea finalizar, tiene 17 años de edad, termino el bachillerato en el colegio Instituto Cultural rafael maya con mención de honor y alto puntaje en el  ICFES, ahora por los resultados académicos  del primer semestre a demostrado interés en continuar este programa, tanto a si que el proyecto es culminarlo profesionalmente, quiere estudiar y trabajar para pagar la carrera profesional ayudar a la mama en el estudio del hermano menor,  ya que no han contado con el soporte del padre.    
 En este momento quiere el convenio con Kiva, para que pueda seguir con la carrera, puesto que el  convenio que tenia antes ya no esta, el convenio que tenia antes era de gran ayuda económica para la familia, el convenio impulsaba el desarrollo académico y facilitaba el desempeño de diego.    
El vive con la mama quien es cabeza de hogar, es empleada domestica  por días,  cuenta con ingresos que cubren los gastos básicos  y el hermano de 5 años que se encuentra estudiando, vive en un barrio estrato 2 en la localidad de suba. 
Las expectativas son, ser profesional en Ingeniería de Sistemas  y crear empresa, pues desde niño siempre demostró curiosidad por reparar los juguetes y objetos en general. 

A los señores de Kiva  le da gracias por la atención prestada y que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en:
He is Diego Fernando, current student of the Campo Alto Institution. He is found carrying out the technical program in computer assembly and maintenance, which he desires to finish. He is 17, he finished high school in the Instituto Cultural Rafael Maya school, with honors' mention and high grades on his final standardized exam. Now because of the academic results of the first semester, he has demonstrated interest in continuing with this program. Because his plan is to complete the professional program, he would like to study and work to pay for his degree program and to help his mother with his younger brother's school costs.

Currently, they ask the favor of Kiva so that they can continue on. They need this support again this semester, as the help before was a great help economically for the family. This support boosted academic development and facilitated Diego's development.

He lives with his mother, who is the head of household, domestic employee by day, has income that covers the basic expenses and the 5 year-old brother who is studying, lives in the Estrato 2 neighborhood in the Suba district.

The plans are to be a professional in Systems Engineering and create a business. Since he was a boy, he always demonstrated curiosity for repairing toys and objects in general.

To the people of Kiva, they give thanks for the attention, loan and that God blesses them.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Jessika Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es una mujer llamada jessika alejandra que vivía en un pueblo, que luchaba con darle un mejor futuro al pequeño hijo de dos años, ella intento trabajar pero con el trabajo solo lograba sobrevivir, pero no conseguía todo lo que soñaba para ella y el pequeño hijo.
Después de ahorrar por un tiempo decidió buscar nuevos horizontes en la ciudad de Bogotá, vivió por un tiempo con una de las hermanas, ayudándo muy poco ya que no podía conseguir todo lo que deseaba y aspiraba porque no tenía una carrera profesional, ella trabajaba como aseadora en la Clínica Universitaria Colombia, gracias a el carisma consiguió muy buenas amistades y era la alegría de los días de trabajo de muchas de esas personas, un día jessika alejandra llego a la clínica y una de las gerentes de farmacia solicito hablar con ella y en la conversación le ofreció el trabajo de auxiliar de servicios farmacéuticos pero no pudo aceptar el trabajo ya que no tenía los conocimientos necesarios para ejercer esa profesión, la gerente  le dio la opción de darle los turnos de los sábados para que tuviera el tiempo de trabajar y prepararse para tener la propia profesión, ella encantada acepto la propuesta. Poco tiempo después tomo el puesto y pudo sacar el propio apartamento para vivir con el pequeño hijo, ya tenía las propias cosas y Vivian muy bien e inclusive le quedaba para ahorrar.
Al transcurrir cinco años pudo tener el propio negocio, una farmacia llamada “la salud de la vida” ahora ella promueve entre la juventud el habito de estudiar y luchar por la vida y los sueños que se tienen en mente.
Ahora trabaja de día en la droguería y estudia de noche para conseguir el titulo como química farmacéutica, en este momento después de tener el negocio el presupuesto se ve un poco mas reducido ya que la farmacia tiene diferentes gastos de los cuales le queda muy complicado el pago de las mensualidades del semestre, por lo tanto necesita la ayuda de convenio kiva para poder terminar la carrera y ampliar los conocimiento adquiridos.
texts.en:
This is a woman called Jessika Alejandra who lives in a village. She has fought to give a better future to her small two-year-old son. She tried to work but with the job she only managed to survive, not achieve all that she dreamed of for herself and her small son.

After saving for a while, she decided to search out new horizons in the city of Bogota. She lived with one of her sisters for a while, helping very little since she was not able to achieve all that she wanted and aspired to because she did not have a degree. She worked as a cleaner in the Clínica Universitaria Colombia. Thanks to her charisma, she managed to develop good friendships and it made her happy to work with many of those friends. One day Jessika Alejandra came to the clinic and one of the pharmacy managers asked to speak with her. In the conversation they offered her the job of pharmacy assistant, but she was not able to accept the job since she did not have the knowledge necessary to do it. The manager gave her the option of doing Saturday shifts so that she would have time to work and study; she was delighted to accept the offer. A short time later she took the post and was able to get her own apartment for herself and her son. They already had their own things and they lived very well and even had enough to save. 

Five years later she was able to start her own business: a pharmacy called “la salud de la vida”. Now she encourages the youth to study and fight for the dreams they have in mind.

Now she works by day at the chemist and studies by night towards a degree in pharmaceutical chemistry. At the moment after having the business the budget is a little lower since the pharmacy has different expenses, which makes the monthly fee payments for the semester very complicated. For this reason, she needs Kiva's help in order to be able to finish her degree and increase her knowledge.

loans.use: to pay her fees for a semester

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es: Ella es Lina Marcela, se encuentra estudiando  administración en salud, ella solicita el convenio de kiva,  ella quiere ser favorecida por el convenio, para poder continuar con los estudios en Administración En Salud segundo semestre ya que por los propios recursos no le alcanza para pagar la totalidad del presupuesto requerido, ya que ella no tiene estabilidad laboral y no cuenta con un trabajo, la  madre que se desempeña como ama de casa es la que le brinda colaboración, pero se le es difícil ya que son 4 hermanas menores y tiene que responder por todas, es por eso que le queda muy pesado cubrir la totalidad del dinero requerido, ella siente que es de vital importancia terminar los estudios para así lograr tener un mejor futuro para ella y la familia.
texts.en:
Lina Marcela studies health administration and she's requesting a Kiva loan.  She wants to be considered favorably for the arrangement so she can continue with the second semester of her studies.

Lina Marcela doesn't have enough resources of her own to pay the entire required amount because she doesn't have job stability or a job.  Her mother's a homemaker and helps her, but it's difficult because her mother's also responsible for Lina Marcela's four younger sisters.  For this reason it's very difficult for Lina Marcela to pay the entire amount.

Lina Marcela feels it's vitally important to finish her studies so she and her family can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for a semester

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: Esta carta tiene como motivo pedirles una ayuda educativa para Maria Fernanda, una niña que tiene muchas ganas de estudiar de progresar y salir adelante ella acaba de entrar al instituto campo alto a estudiar auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos, carece de recursos económicos para una universidad, por esto se inscribió en este instituto, pues le parece que es muy bueno, puede proyectarse y tener un buen nivel académico, pero como les comenta los recursos son un poco limitados, por eso recurre a kiva con la esperanza de poder acceder al beneficio del convenio, pues los sueños son convertirse en una excelente auxiliar de farmacia y conseguir un buen empleo.
texts.en: This letter has the intention of asking help for Maria Fernanda's education. She has a lot of desire to study, to progress and to get ahead. She has just begun at Alto Campo studying to be a Pharmaceutical Assistant. She does not have the economic resources for university so she registered at this institute as it appears to be excellent. She can undertake this and maintain a good academic standing, but as stated her economic resources are modest. So she has come to Kiva in hopes of getting a loan, as her dream is to become an excellent Pharmaceutical Assistant and get a good job.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 38 years old and has been sewing clothes for the past several years. 
She sews for the people of her community and uses the income received to support her entire family. Her sewing machine is out of order and due to a lack of savings and funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason; she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. 
She intends to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine so that she may generate a healthier source of income.
Shakeela hopes that this loan will prove positive and beneficial for her and will be the cause for getting more income. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor-Tinyari Grande Group

texts.es:
NANCY ES UNA JOVEN MADRE QUE PERTENECE AL GRUPO DIOS ES AMOR - TINYARI GRANDE, CONFORMADA POR 9 PERSONAS, QUE TIENE COMO PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA  A LA AGRICULTURA Y GANADERÍA; Y OTROS SE DEDICAN A BORDAR PRENDAS TIPICAS DE LA REGIÓN.

NANCY ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE SU HOGAR, LA APOYAN EN EL CULTIVO DE SU CHACRA Y EN LA CRIANZA DE SUS ANIMALES( VACAS, OVEAS, CERDOS, ETC.) SUS HIJOS Y FAMILIARES QUE VIVEN CON ELLA.
EL PRÉSTAMO, LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS QUÍMICOS (PESTICIDAS, GUANO, INSECTICIDAS, ETC.) 
EL SUEÑO QUE ELLA TIENE ES DE QUE SUS HIJOS SEAN PROFESIONALES.

ELLA Y SUS COMPAÑEROS SE ENCUENTRAN AGRADECIDOS Y ORGULLOSOS POR EL APOYO DE LOS INVERSIONISTAS DE KIVA, YA QUE CONFÍAN EN ELLOS, AUN SIN CONOCERLOS,FINANCIANDO SUS NEGOCIOS.

NANCY EN LA FOTO SE ENCUENTRA VESTIDA CON UN BUZO VERDE Y SOMBRERO BLANCO
texts.en:
Nancy is a young mother who belongs to the "Dios Es Amor-Tinyari Grande Group" communal bank, which has 9 members. Their principal activities are agriculture and livestock raising, but others embroider traditional garments of the region. 

Nancy is the only breadwinner in her household. Her children and the other family members who live in her house help her with the work on her farm and caring for the animals (cows, sheep, pigs, etc). The loan will be used to buy agricultural inputs (pesticides, guano, insecticides, etc.). Nancy's dream is that her children become professionals.

Nancy and her companions are grateful and proud of the support from the lenders at Kiva who have confidence in them even when they don't know them finance their loans. In the photo Nancy is wearing a green sweater and a white hat.

loans.use: to buy guano, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
LAIDOU est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la restauration à l’image de SATA qui est la première personne  assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Sous Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités de la vente de restaurant : viande, haricot, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
SATA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires et des céréales pour ses activités de restauration.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité de la restauration.
texts.en:
Laidou is a group in the Benkadi association in Tiele. The group is made up of four married women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. They have an average age of 24 and are all married, with two children on average. 

The women are all involved in different businesses, such as selling produce, like Sata who is pictured sitting on the left. The women live in large traditional families in Tiele in the Baguineda sub-prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali).

They have all been running small businesses for several years and are highly sought-after for the food they sell: meat, beans, etc. 

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme four years ago. This is their sixth solidarity loan. 

Sata intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of cereals and other produce for her catering business. She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her produce to individuals in Tiele, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Sata hopes to make 20 000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her catering business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à   OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs treizièmes prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme AMINATA fait de la mercerie et la vente de tissus de toutes sortes dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient à l’extrême droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 20 pièces de bazin à BAMAKO, elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour de la qualité de sa marchandise.
Elle les revend au marché et à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Danaya’s five members are married women, who are on average 45 years old with four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. To meet customer demand, this is their thirteenth loan with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso.

In this group of women, Mrs. Aminata works in food service. She is standing all the way to the right in the photo. With her loan, she is planning on purchasing twenty swaths of brocade from Bamako. She is very much in demand because of the quality of her merchandise. She retails from home and at the market, to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and grants credits.

She is expecting an average monthly profit of 35,000 XOF; part of it will be used to pay back her loan, with the rest going to her savings.

loans.use: to buy brocades.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego vive con sus padres y trabaja  en el negocio de la familia, ellos se dedican a la compra venta de electrodomésticos.
Diego esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Civil, la cual es una de las más difíciles, y comenta que sus metas futuras son la de recibirse y  trabajar en lo que es  su profesión para obtener un mejor estilo de vida y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar su matricula, y de esa forma seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Diego lives with his parents and works the family business, selling household appliances.

Diego is studying for a civil engineering degree which is one of the hardest and says that his future goals are to recover and work in his profession so he can have a better quality of life and help his family.

He is asking for this loan to pay tuition and continue his education as he has been doing.  He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Yanaturo Alto  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanaturo Alto está formado por 12 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les han permitido aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Las socias son personas muy amables y cordiales  que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por el sector de Yanaturo Alto en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es la tercera de mayor importancia económica del país, esta ciudad se mezcla entre lo colonial y moderno, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Miriam, es una socia activa y se encuentra desde hace 3 años en el grupo de crédito Yanaturo Alto, tiene 21 años de edad,  es casada y aun no tiene hijos, su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Miriam por el momento pasa en casa y esta dedicaba a buscar trabajo, pero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar tiene un galpón de pollos, estos animalitos los vende en pie o pelados, por el momento le va bien en el negocio y está creciendo poco a poco. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar pollos y alimento para los mismos. Su sueño es  tener su título universitario.
Las dos fotos adjuntas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Yanaturo Alto communal bank is made up of 12 women who work in different jobs, which have enabled them to contribute to their household economy and bring up their children. The members are all polite and friendly people who still keep the culture and traditions of their towns alive. They live in the Yanaturo Alto area of the city of Cuenca, which is the country's third most important city in terms of economy. The city is a mixture of colonial and modern styles and has a varied cuisine. 

One of the members of the group is Miriam. She is an active member and has been in the Yanaturo Alto communal bank for 3 years. She is 21 years old and is married but does not have any children yet. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not have their own house and so live in rented property. 

At the moment Miriam is at home and is looking for work, but in order to help her husband with the household expenses she has a poultry shed. She sells the birds live or plucked. At the moment the business is going well and is growing slowly. The money from the loan is to buy chickens and chicken feed.

Miriam's dream is to have a university degree.

The two attached photos are of two borrowers that could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Sad Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SAD a comme présidente Baka , elle est composée de 7 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans la même maison et pratiquent la même activité. Leur président s'appelle BAKA  c’est lui qui a levé la main sur la photo. Il évolue dans le maraîchage. il demande ce crédit pour acheter des engrais et semences pour la pratique du maraichage. il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans cette activité et gère les dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité des enfants .il commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 20h. A l’avenir il souhaite vivre dans le confort et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille .
texts.en:
The 'Sad' Group has seven members and its president is Baka.  The group members all live in the same household and all work in the same type of business.

Baka (shown with his hand raised in the photo) grows vegetables.  He has requested this loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer.  He has more than ten years' experience in this business and shares responsibility for the expenses of his household and the school fees of his children, with his wife.  His working day begins at eight in the morning and finishes at eight in the evening.

In the future, he would like to live more comfortably and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for their vegetable growing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks for his poultry raising business.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Oumar est un homme agé de 58 ans qui vit avec sa femme et ses 04  enfants dont le plus grand est  agé de 28ans et le plus petit a 10ans. Il évolue dans l’aviculture depuis 3ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 16h. Il sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 150.000 pour construire un poulailler et relancer son activité. Il prend en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir il voudrait achever ses travaux de construction et grâce au crédit de l’institution diversifier sa production  sur son activité d’aviculture et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumar is a man of 58 who lives with his wife and his four children, of whom the eldest is 28 and the youngest 10 years old. Oumar has been developing his  poultry-raising business for three years and begins his workday at 7 am to end at 4 pm. 

Oumar is requesting this loan in the amount of 150,000 XOF to build a chicken-yard to get his business back up and running. He covers the daily expenses of his family and the school fees of his children. In future he would like finish his construction work and, thanks to the loan from the micro-finance institution (UIMCEC), diversify the production of his poultry business, and grow his income so as to be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy iron and cement to build a chicken-yard for raising poultry.

loans.name: Djiapalé Djiguène Gni Group

texts.fr: DJAPALE DJIGUENE GNI est un nom de groupement composé de 5 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et pratiquent la même activité. Elles font parties toutes dans un même groupement de femme. Mamadou est leur présidente, on la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, sucre, le lait, le savon et le pain. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui a comme charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et  parfois les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée  de 9h  pour la terminer à 19h. Elle veut avoir une expérience du crédit et épargner le maximum possible pour ensuite être autonome financièrement.
texts.en:
The Djiapale Djiguene Gni group is made up of five women who live in the same area and work in the same type of business. 

Mamadou is their president, and she has her hand raised in the photo. She works selling foodstuffs like rice, sugar, milk, soap, and bread. Mamadou is married and a mother of a family. She supports her family's everyday expenses and sometimes her children's school fees. She starts her day at 9 a.m. and finishes at 7 p.m.

She wants to have experience with credit and to save as much as possible so that she can become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to resell

loans.name: El Hadji Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima, âgé de 31 ans, est un commerçant qui exerce le métier depuis 13 ans déjà. Il évolue dans la commercialisation des prêts à porter comme les pantalons, jeans, t-shirt  etc.  . Avec le crédit, il va acheter pour revendre des habits et  divers autres produits. Ibrahima  est marié et père de 6 enfants dont le plus âgé a 17 ans et le cadet 4 ans. Il s’occupe des besoins familiaux. Le crédit va impacter sur  la situation du client car il va voir son stock augmenter. Comme projet futur : il veut ouvrir d’autres boutiques  et avoir une autonomie financière dans  son activité et  augmenter ses sources de revenu. Et ce projet, il désire le voir se réaliser avec l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is 31 years old and has been running his business for 13 years already. He is expanding his clothing business, which sells trousers, jeans, t-shirts, etc. With this loan, he will buy various items of clothing and other products. 

Ibrahima is married and the father of six children, the eldest of whom is 17 and the youngest four. It is Ibrahima who provides for his family’s needs. 

Ibrahima's loan will improve his ability to meet customer demand as he will be able to increase his stock. His future projects include opening other shops, achieving financial independence for his business and broadening his sources of income. He hopes to achieve these projects with the support of lenders.

loans.use: buy and sell clothing such as trousers, jeans, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Margarita has been in this business for 3 years. Margarita earns more income from pig fattening.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can buy a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee and noodles.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a hard working lady. She is working hard to ensure her family is well sustained. She is requesting for another loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy flour, cooking oil and some cereals for her business. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and some cereals for her business

loans.name: Mwanaiki

texts.en:
Mwanaiki is married with one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a big business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products, grains, soda, etc.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
INES, una mujer emprendedora y dinámica que desde hace más de  25 años vive en San Lorenzo, ella vive con su padre de 80 años.
Inés realiza varias actividades, entre ellas recargas de crédito a teléfonos móviles, venta de huevos, y venta de pollo por libras y enteros.
Ella se esfuerza mucho en atender el estado de salud de su padre, 
Inés, espera con este préstamo, mejorar el local en el que se encuentra, comprar canastos para los pollos, comprar más pollos, y de esta manera contratar a una persona para que le ayude con las ventas en la mañana ya que se vende mucho.
Inés está segura que mejorara sus ventas porque se encuentra en un lugar muy comercial en San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
Inés, an enterprising and dynamic woman, has lived in San Lorenzo for more than 25 years. She lives with her 80-year-old father.

Inés has several jobs, including selling top-up vouchers for mobile phones, selling eggs, and selling chicken by the pound.

She strives to look after her father’s health.

With this loan, Inés hopes to improve her business premises, buy baskets for the chickens, buy more chickens, and employ a salesperson to help her in the morning since she sells a lot at that time of day.

Inés is sure that her sales will increase because her business is located in a very commercial area of San Lorenzo.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell whole and by the pound

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es un joven responsable, que con 20 años de edad emprendió su negocio de vender ropa bajo pedido y puerta a puerta en la cuidad del Carmelo y lleva 6 meses en dicho negocio. El crédito será invertido en comprar mercadería en ropa para luego venderla y con los ingresos que obtenga poder pagar sus estudios universitarios y ayudar en los gastos de su sobrino que vive col él.  El joven vive con su madre y su sobrino  que por falta de recursos económicos Luis no está estudiando pero dice que el año próximo va a dividir su tiempo en estudiar y trabajar. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes fijos ya que les da buen servicio y  les vende a crédito y de contado.
texts.en:
Luis is a responsible young man. At the age of 20, he started his business of selling clothes. He takes orders and travels door-to-door in the city of Carmelo. Luis has been in this business for six months.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise that he can sell later. With the revenue he generates, Luis will be able to pay for his university studies and the expenses for his nephew who lives with him.

This young man lives with his mother and his nephew. Due to the lack of financial resources, Luis is not studying at the moment, but he says that next year he will divide his time between studying and working. Luis says that he already has many regular customers since he offers good service and sells his goods for cash or on credit.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Su nombre es Viviana, ella tiene 20 años cumplidos, tiene una vida poco agitada y con muchas responsabilidades a tan corta edad, actualmente vive con el novio Juan, los dos trabajan, estudian y quieren sacar adelante el lindo hogar, aunque él le ayuda con los gastos del hogar a Viviana le corresponde llevar el conteo de los pagos y la contabilidad de los gastos, ella trabaja en una reconocida clínica de medicina alternativa, aun así no gana un sueldo superior al mínimo, este le debe alcanzar para pagar arriendo, hacer mercado, pagar servicios, ayudar a la madre y pagar el estudio, se esfuerza por lograr lo que quiere, pero le es difícil continuar estudiando con una mensualidad tan alta, debido a esto se entero del convenio de kiva y le pareció una buena ayuda para ella en este momento donde la situación económica está un poco grave, demuestra tener amor por el estudio ya que en las calificaciones sobresale, hoy en día quiere terminar el técnico en cosmetología y estética integral en Campo alto y empezar a trabajar en la profesión, gracias a Kiva ella encontró una nueva  ayuda para seguir luchando, disminuyo los gastos del estudio aunque siguen aumentando las responsabilidades, ella está muy agradecida y muy orgullosa del esfuerzo que está haciendo y quiere seguir sobresaliendo en todo lo que hace.
texts.en:
Her name is Viviana and she is 20 years old. She leads a stable life with many responsibilities for such a young age. At present, she lives with her boyfriend Juan. They both work, study, and wish to advance their lovely family. Though he helps with household costs, Viviana also must contribute to payments for covering expenses. 

Viviana works in a recognized alternative medicine clinic. Although she doesn't make a salary above the minimum, it helps her pay the rent, cover shopping, pay for services, help her mother, and pay for her studies. She struggles to achieve what she wants, but it's difficult for her to continue studying with monthly costs so high.

That's why when she heard about the agreement with Kiva, it seemed to her a good source of help at this moment when the economic situation is somewhat grave. Viviana has demonstrated her love of study, having done very well in qualifying exams. Today, she wishes to complete technical studies in cosmetology and integral beauty at Campo Alto and to begin working in the profession. 

Thanks to Kiva, Viviana has found a new source of assistance to continue her struggle, diminishing the costs of study, although her responsibilities continue to grow. She is very grateful and very proud of the effort she is making and she wishes to continue advancing in all that she does.

loans.use: to pay a semester's matriculation at Campo Alto.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
The "Unity" group is composed of five members, four women and one man. They are all part of one family or another and are working so hard to support their various families. They are natives of Dansoman-Accra, a place in the coastal region of the country. They are hardworking and responsible and want to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to their living conditions and low economic situation, they couldn't study to higher level of education, so they had to work hard to help their families with the household expenses. Today, they struggle day to day to offer a better future to their children, give them better living conditions and help them become professionals.

Stella is the group representative, and she has been selling African wax-prints for three years. She spends 10 hours a day selling her product. She is standing on the left in the photograph. The aim of the loan is to stock her business with good-quality African wax-prints, in this way providing good service to her clients, so in the near future, she can generate more revenue. 

She is grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders who help people of low resources and countries like Ghana to enjoy dignified work.

loans.use: To stock her business with good-quality African wax-prints

loans.name: Wiliam

texts.en:
Wiliam is widowed with four children. He is 72 years old and lives in Tangub, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.

Wiliam is a farmer and plants papaya to earn a living. He has been doing this for one year. He has requested a loan to expand his papaya plantation. He wants to buy more papaya seeds and fertilizer. 

Wiliam has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, he hopes to own a another papaya plantation in nearby municipality.

loans.use: to pay for papaya seeds and fertilizer.

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 37, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eugene, who is a driver, and Josephine is a mother to their children. Josephine, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Josephine maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Josephine hopes to expand her business and have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Adriana Teresa

texts.es: Adriana es una chica de 23 años de edad, vive con sus padres y sus 4 hermanos, ella solicita este crédito para comprar  animales menores ya que  se dedica a este negocio desde que era adolecente debido a que su madre le enseño a realizar esta actividad. Sus padres se dedican trabajar en el campo y su madre también se dedica al negocio de animales menores. Esta joven luchadora aspira que su negocio crezca para poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, en los gastos de educación de sus hermanos que se encuentran asistiendo al colegio y también sueña con terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Adriana is 23 years old and lives with her parents and 4 siblings. She is asking for this loan to buy small animals. She has been working to raise such animals for many years, since her mother taught her how to do so as a teen. Her parents work in the field and her mother also works raising small animals. 

Adriana is a strong young woman who aspires to grow her business to help her family with their home expenses. She also hopes to assist with the education expenses for her siblings who are in high school, and hopes to finish her own university studies.

loans.use: to buy small animals

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 38 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzi is a 37-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives a rickshaw in Lahore city which is a very populated area. A few days ago he was in a road accident. He was standing beside the road for looking passengers when a speedy car collided with the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any fracture but the rickshaw body is seriously damaged and needs to be replaced with a new one. Therefore, Fouzia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy the body of auto rickshaw.

Fouzia is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honor.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: María Fermamda

texts.es: María es una mujer casada, tiene 2 hijas de 4 y 6 años que actualmente se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, María es muy trabajadora, vive en casas de su abuelita juntamente con su hermana, tíos y sobrinos, el crédito que le otorgo Fodemi es para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos. Lo que aspira es que sus hijas sigan asistiendo a la escuela, mejorar sus ingresos para poder comprar una casa para vivir con su esposo y sus hijas y así ellas tengan un ambiente mas agradable y de ser posible María  quisiera entrar a estudiar a la universidad y terminar de su carrera.
texts.en:
María is a married woman who has two daughters, ages 4 and 6, who are currently in school.  María is a hardworking woman.  She lives in her grandmother's house with her sister, uncles and nephews.  

The loan that Fodemi granted her will be used to purchase pigs.  She hopes that her daughters will continue going to school, and that she will be able to increase her income so she can buy a house to live in with her husband and daughters where they will be in a more pleasant environment.  If possible, María would like to enroll in the university and finish her degree.

loans.use: pay for pigs.

loans.name: Elisabeth Johana

texts.es: Con 25 años de edad, Elisabeth es una mujer casada tiene dos hijos, una de 8 y el niño de 3 años de edad que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, ella es una mujer emprendedora  y se siente muy contenta con su negocio, el préstamo que le otorgó Fodemi es para comprar mercadería en ropa y ofrecerla en la ciudad de San Gabriel. Son 3 años que se dedica  a este negocio y anteriormente trabajaba de vendedora en un almacén de ropa. Lo que más desea es tener un almacén propio  para vender la ropa y de esta manera que mejoren sus ingresos y darles los útiles escolares, los uniformes y  todo lo que necesiten para que estudien sus hijos.
texts.en: At 25-years old, Elisabeth is married and has two children.  Her daughter is 8-years old and her son is 3-years old.  They both go to school.  Elisabeth is an enterprising woman.  She is very happy with her business.  The loan she was granted by Fodemi is for the purchase of clothing merchandise, which she sells in San Gabriel.  She has had her business for three years and previously worked as a salesclerk in a clothing shop.  What Elisabeth wants most is to have her own shop to sell her clothing from.  That would improve her income and provide her children with their school supplies and uniforms and everything they need to be able to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to plant 1,000 coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement and sheets of zinc and wood.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es:
Juanito tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos como llantas y espejos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio a sus pasajeros, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juanito, 35, lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucara, a place of warm weather where its population works mainly in agriculture, trade and livestock. Pucara is located in the Jaen Province, which is part of the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He provides public transport services in his own mototaxi, transporting his passengers from the surrounding villages to his district. He is asking for this loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy parts, such as tires and mirrors, for his vehicle and in this way continue to provide services to his passengers and generate higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts for his mototaxi, such as tires and mirrors

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years of age, with three children and presently residing at Bagakay, Ozamis City. 

Antonia has existing businesses of a restaurant, and a sari-sari store. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 pesos to buy sacks of rice, beverages, soft drinks, and other products to sell. 

Antonia saves for her future. She has been a member of PMPC for two years, and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice for her restaurant and stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nora has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of retail items. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Liaster

texts.en:
Liaster is 19 years old and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Liaster requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, etc.

Liaster has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, and vegetables

loans.name: Virgencita

texts.en:
Virgencita works hard to support her family. Virgencita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Virgencita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods like canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future Virgencita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alba Mary

texts.es:
Alba, a sus 38 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos adolescentes, por quienes lucha incansablemente.
Desde hace 11 años inició su propio negocio de venta de mercancía, la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar; trabaja sola todos los días y tiene como ventaja que su puesto de trabajo está ubicado en una zona muy transitada del centro de la ciudad.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio y la economía familiar, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (calzado) con lo que podrá satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de su clientela, mejorando así los ingresos que son fruto de las ventas.
Alba tiene como propósito para un futuro cercano, poder montar una tienda de abarrotes en la casa donde reside, esto le dará la posibilidad de generar mayor rentabilidad, además desea construir un apartamento nuevo para arrendarlo y así tener un ingreso adicional para estabilizar la economía y brindar a sus hijos una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba, 38, is characterized as a strong and hard working woman. 

She lives with her husband and two teenage children for whom she fights tirelessly.

Eleven years ago, she started her own business selling merchandise. The idea came from the need to generate resources to help support her husband with the economic responsibilities of the home. 

She works alone every day and has the advantage that her work place is located in an area with a lot of transit in the city center. 

With the enthusiasm to strengthen her business and the family economy, she is requesting a loan to invest in buying an assortment of shoes at wholesale. 

This way she can satisfy the tastes and needs of her clientele and improve her income with the fruit of her sales. 

Alba has a near term goal of setting up a grocery store in her home. This will give her the ability to generate higher returns. 

She also wants to build a new apartment to rent out and in this way have additional income to stabilize the economy and to give her children a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman who lives together with her husband and six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is a 27-year-old married woman from the Vani district in Georgia. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and school-aged son. The family's employed persons are Tamar and her husband, who works as a baker and generates 300 GEL monthly. Tamar is a private worker at nuts factory and gets small salary. 

In order to increase her productive activity, Tamar plans to start her own business. In particular with the requested loan she will purchase stock of used clothing and will sell it locally in her community. Tamar received credit with the start-up loan program that provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Tamar and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: To start used clothing business

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Albertina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes and milk. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Albertina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes and milk

loans.name: Jazbleidy Jineth

texts.es:
Ella es jazbleidy jineth, es una persona responsable, carismática, la cual escogió esta carrera con porque le pareció que cuenta con varios aspectos significativos  las cuales son: enseñar a los niños con un método diferente, darles más seguridad, autoestima, respeto por ellos mismos, en cuanto a lo económico, pode tener una estabilidad económica  para poder realizar la otra carrera que quiere.  
En cuanto a la familia quiere darle un buen apoyo económico  en todo lo que necesiten. 
En cuanto a los aspectos significativos personales, cada día crecer más en esta carrera y salir adelante honestamente con el principal apoyo que es el estudiando.
Necesita el convenio que en este momento ofrece kiva, porque ella es el  único apoyo económico, ella misma paga las cuotas de la carrera y en este momento el valor a pagar está un poco costoso.  
Los planes en el futuro son trabajar en un jardín y estudiar la carrera profesional al mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
This is Jazbleidy Jineth, a very responsible and charismatic person who chose this career because she believes she has several significant traits such as teaching children with a different method and providing more security and self-esteem for them.  As far as finances, she can have financial stability so she can have the other career she wants.  She wants to provide her family with financial support for all they need.

As far as personal characteristics, she wants to grow more in this career each day and get ahead honestly through education.

She needs the deal that Kiva is offering at the moment because this is her only means of financial support.  She pays her own fees and the amounts are a bit high.

Her plans for the future are to work at a kindergarten and study for a professional career at the same time.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 54 years old, happily married with four children and a resident of Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through tending a sari-sari store business to generate income.

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy stocks for her sari-sari store business.

Demetria deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 58 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children. 

Alberto has been engaged in coconut production activity for 20 years already and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations. Alberto has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Alberto hopes to acquire additional parcel of cocoland to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa helps her husband in their fishing business to earn a living.

She sells the fish while her husband does the fishing, and she earns well for the family. She successfully repaid her previous loan which was used to buy fishing nets used for fishing.

Recently, she took a new loan to buy more fish to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Garry

texts.en: Garry, a father of one provides services in his village to make a living. For more than six years of catering food services in his cafeteria, he has earned well to provide for his family. His wife works as a teacher and they want to earn more because they want to give their child a better education. With the micro finance loan of GDMPC, he was able to buy raw ingredients to prepare more food.  In the future, he wants to build a cafeteria where he can provide more comfort and better service for his costumers.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare more food

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Estela works hard to support her family. She has a entertainment business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load and a restaurant. 

Estela is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit videoke machine for her entertainment business.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit of videoke machine for her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Angelita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 53 years old, married, and has four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell like eggs, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Rosemarie requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

With your help Rosemarie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena lives on an island and most of her daily income is from selling fish and seaweed. Her husband is a fisherman. She is now applying for a loan of $1,000. She will use the loan to buy fish net and other materials for her husband to do his activities as a fisherman. Fish that her husband gets, she will bring to the market to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other materials to catch fish.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with four school going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Fatuma has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells as a retailer to dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Liah Mhe

texts.en:
Liah Mhe is 27 years old and lives in Tangub city in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Liah Mhe and her husband have a transportation type of business and earn approximately PHP1,000 each day doing this type of work. Liah Mhe has requested a loan to purchase sound box to add to their sound system services. 

Liah Mhe is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Liah Mhe deeply wishes for a good education to her kids and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to purchace sound box system

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, aged 48, is a responsible mother of five children. She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys baby goats, heifers, bull calf etc. at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices to the butchers. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. She contacted BRAC Pakistan and applied for a loan to purchase two more cattle. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.
Rukhsana thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase and sell cattle

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is married, 65 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Estelita requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business like linen, tailoring chalk, etc.

Estelita has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business like linen, tailoring chalk, etc.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marichu works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Marichu is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy finishing materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Marichu has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy finishing materials, like paint and wood, for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a married woman and the mother of four daughters and three sons. She has been running her business of trading clothing for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality clothing in her community. Rehana has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy stocks of different clothing for resale. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Glorelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Glorelie works hard to support her family. She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal, and from a general store. Glorelie is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of water to sell through her business selling purified drinking water.

Glorelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of water to sell.

loans.name: Nemfel

texts.en:
Nemfel is a 32-year-old education student and lives in Tangub City in the Philipines. She is married to a private driver and has two children. Nemfel's husband earns PHP8,000.00 each month doing this type of work. Nemfel has a requested a loan to pay for her tuition fee. 

Nemfel is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Nemfel wishes to become a teacher, and hopes to finish to her study so that she can help to provide their daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Elika, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children who are still at school. She has been selling Masai type of shoes for four years. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Elika's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy Masai type of sandals and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay for school fees and household expenses. She dreams of building her own house.

Elika will share this loan with her loan group "SARANGA" which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more of the Masai type of sandal to sell

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing for her kids.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food business, selling to her neighbors and to students of a neighboring school. In addition, she also performs farming business which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, salt and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Dolly is 40 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Dolly works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell including shampoo, groceries, etc. Dolly has been in this business for four years. In the future, Dolly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell including shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Bijeli is a mother of four children - one son and three daughters - who have finished schooling. She is taking care of her grandkids who are still in school. She is aged mid forties and is single. For six years now, Bijeli has made her living by running a mamalishe business selling rice, stiff porridge with meat, fish, vegetables and beans. Bijeli learned this business after her life seemed to be becoming hard, but still her mamalishe itself does not provide a satisfactory income.
