Later on, she introduced a local drinks (Komoni and Chibuku) business so as to increase her income. Now, she also manages another business selling local drinks like Komoni and Chibuku. She opens her business from 6am to 11pm each working day and is able to make a good profit per month. 

Bijeli used to be a client of Tujijenge a long time ago when the company commenced. She stopped taking loans after her shake business had a high fall in sales. Since Bijeli started taking loans again, this is her third loan request. She will use this loan to buy ten crates of local drinks and food ingredients for cooking including kilos of rice, sugar, beans, etc. With her previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she used the funds to start her mamalishe business and restock the food items. Bijeli managed to earn an extra income which she used to buy a TV, radio and house sofa set. She also covered school fees and home food expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a nice family house and improve her business. 

Bijeli will share this loan with her loan group Ddc which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ten crates of local drinks and food ingredients for cooking including kilos of rice, sugar, beans, etc.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe is a married woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water. For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural business, selling produce from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. Kwekwe decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan that she is requesting of 15,000 KES, she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a divorced woman with one school-going child. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mwanajuma has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbours. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocer in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support. With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a 29-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a butcher shop; he earns insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy beef from the market and sell it from his butcher shop. Recently, he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which damaged his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. 

Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy meat to sell from his butcher shop. She wants to provide a higher education for her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy meat for her husband's butcher shop.

loans.name: Fritz Andrew

texts.en: Fritz Andrew, 24, is single with one dependent child. His major business activity is selling used shoes. He started this business on a small scale and has been running for five years already. He availed a loan previously, intended for purchasing additional inventory for his business since the investment of the business has good return. Now, he is reapplying for another loan for stock since the demand of shoes is increasing this season. His plan is to have more expansion of the business for his child and his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his used-shoes retail business.

location.town: Dipolog-Lower Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 56 years old and lives in St. Maria, Tangub City. She is a widow with three children. Conchita engages in dried fish vending and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan to add to her capital. She wants to purchase additional kilos of dried fish to sell.

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for two years and six months. In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her livelihood in order to cater more services for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase addiitonal kilos of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en: Clarisa is married with two children and operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, her husband works as a security guard in a private company to earn extra income. For three years running the business, she earned well enough to support the needs of her children and was able to sustain it. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the future education of her children and for better living with the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Mtama

texts.en:
Mtama is a married mother and has kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated a mat selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase raw materials for making mats for sale.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making mats for sale.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanatumu has operated a cafe business making food stuffs like rice, tea, beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as a major challenge. She joined Yehu to get financial support. With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and beans for her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and beans for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Luz En Mi Camino Group

texts.es:
DÚO LUZ EN MI CAMINO
La encargada de este grupo es la señora María Martina, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general, como cremas, champo, desodorantes, colonias , talcos para damas y caballeros desde hace 11 años, cortinas de diferente calidad y  también venta de jabón en polvo y bola. Le han hecho varios pedidos de cremas y perfumes porque se aproxima el mes de la amistad donde aprovecha las  ventas para tener  bonitas ganancias.  No cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacer los pedidos en los catálogos de cosméticos que vende y se ve en la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para poder comprar más  producto y ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de cosas.  Su esposo la apoya en todo y sus hijos la ayudan a vender,  ya que es una vendedora ambulante por el momento, ya su sueño es tener su local propio en la orilla de la carretera y no caminar más.
texts.en:
DÚO LUZ EN MI CAMINO [Light in My Path Duo]

The woman in charge of this group is María Martina, who has made a living for the last eleven years by selling cosmetics in general, such as lotions, shampoo, deodorants, colognes, powders for women and men and hair extensions of various qualities. She also sells soap in powder and bar form. She has gotten various requests for lotions and perfumes because the month of friendship is approaching, in which she takes advantage of the sales in order to have good earnings. She doesn't have enough money to request the items from the catalogs of cosmetics that she sells, and sees the need to ask for a loan to be able to buy more products and offer her customers a variety of things. Her husband supports her with everything and her children help her to sell, as she is an itinerant saleswoman at the moment. Her dream is to have her own place on the side of the highway and not to walk around anymore.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is married with six children. She is 60 years old and lives in Danlugan. Lilia sells goods and dry goods to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 18,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy five cases of beer, 10 cases of Coke and other goods for her sari-sari. Lilia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lilia hopes to have her own grocery store some day.

loans.use: to buy five cases of beer, 10 cases of Coke and other goods for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Fredisminda

texts.en: Fredisminda is 64 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from raising pigs. Fredisminda has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is married with one child. She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. Paulina is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Paulina has been a member of PMPC for five years. She has requested a loan to buy four sacks of feed and two piglets. In the future, she hopes to have her own piggery someday.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of feed and two piglets.

loans.name: Rubabu

texts.en: Rubabu thanks you for the support of the previous Kiva loan that helped her to boost her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of 25,000 KES to buy rice, wheat flour, beans and maize flour for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour, beans and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. 

For the past three years, she has been preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread and beans to sell to her customers who come to the cafe, neighbours and passersby. She mentions seasonality as her major challenge. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business With this 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is married with six children. She is fifty-six years old and lives in Anonang, Dumalinao, ZDS. Marieta is a farmer and grows corn fields to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her corn fields. Marieta has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her farm so that she can buy land in her town.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers for her corn fields.

location.town: Pagadian - Anonang, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Nubia Constanza

texts.es:
Ella se llama Nubia Constanza, tiene 25 años, en este momento está estudiando en Campo Alto, Técnico Auxiliar Administrativo  en Salud cursando segundo semestre. Se enteró del convenio KIVA por medio de una compañera y desea pertenecer a este ya que en este momento la situación económica no es la mejor y anhela seguir estudiando para poder salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y la familia. 

Escogió esta carrera por que le gusta el área de la salud y servicio al cliente, con el fin de estudiar en profundidad la problemática de la administración del sector salud. 

Nubia busca formarse tanto personalmente como profesionalmente y ve en esta institución todas las herramientas para alcanzarlo y tener la capacidad para desempeñar diferentes actividades, ya que esta carrera así lo permite.

Ella se  ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable en las tareas, es una persona honesta y emprendedora que quiere dejar en alto el nombre de la institución.
texts.en:
Her name is Nubia Constanza and she is 25 years old. At this time she is studying in Campo Alto in her second semester of an Auxiliary Administrative Technician in Health program. She found out about the Kiva program from a friend and she wants to be a part of it, as at this time the economic situation isn't the best. She longs to keep studying to be able to get ahead so she and her family can have a better quality of life. 

She chose her career because she likes the field of health and customer service, and with the purpose of studying problems in the administration of the health sector in depth. Nubia is seeking both personal and professional training, and she sees in this institution all of the tools to achieve this and to have the capacity perform a variety of activities, as this career will allow her to do. She is known for being someone who is responsible with her tasks; she is an honest and enterprising person who wants to uphold the name of the institution.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Doña María Francisca es originaria del área de San Martin Jilotepeque, actualmente tiene 51 años de edad y desde hace mas de 23 años se dedicado a la compra venta de granos básicos como lo son: Café en oro, Pepita, Frijol blanco y negro y como actividad secundaria bordados y tejidos típicos. Es una persona responsable durante su crédito solo se atraso cuatro días, el sueño de María Francisca es invertir más en su negocio para obtener más ganancias y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Agradece a Kiva y Fape el apoyo que le han dado ya que por medio de eso ha logrado hacer muchas cosas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de 10 quintales de frijol blanco, café en oro y materiales para elaborar tejidos.
texts.en: María Francisca is a native of San Martin Jilotepeque.  She is 51 years old. For the past 23 years she has been buying and selling basic grains such as coffee beans, seeds, broad beans and black beans. As a secondary activity she has been embroidering and doing traditional weaving. She is a responsible person who during her last loan was only late 4 days. María Francisca's dream is to invest more in her store so she can make more money and help her husband with the household expenses. She thanks Kiva and Fape for the support they have given her. Because of this she has been able to do many things. She is requesting this loan to buy 10 quintals of broad beans, coffee beans and material for weaving.

loans.use: to buy food products for sale.

loans.name: Ernanie

texts.en:
Ernanie is 47-years-old and married with six children.

Ernanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, noodles, etc.

Ernanie has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Ernanie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs and noodles

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo known as Pastor Ronald, is a father of two kids, he is minister who works at a church in Port-au-Prince. His family lives in Cap-Haitian while he lives in Port-au-Prince. In order to improve their economic situation Pastor Ronald wants to buy “recho gaz blan” (kerosene cook stove) from Enèji Pwòp, EarthSpark’s Haitian clean energy brand, in Port-au-Prince and send them to his wife in Cap-Haitian to resell. Among all the Enèji Pwòp products he is interested the most in the recho gaz blan, according to what he says there is great need for a product like that it is more economical and safer for people who kids at home.
Pastor Ronald used to sell products like “ti-soley” a light that comes with radio. Which means he already has connection with his target market. With a Kiva loan Pastor Ronald will be able to help his family and his community. He is very excited to become a retailer for Enèji pwòp, a Kiva loan is what he needs to make that happen.

loans.use: To purchase "recho gaz blan" from Enèji pwòp to resell in Cap-Haitian

loans.name: Deb

texts.en:
Deb, aged 43 and a mother of six, has managed a farm for more than 25 years in Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. Her family relies on the income from agribusiness, including farming and fishing. She primarily grows rice, and she is able to earn well to support her family. 

As her present house has deteriorated over the years, Deb is asking for a loan to buy wood for home renovations. She hopes that she will be able to provide a suitable living condition for her family members through the loan support. 

Deb expresses her thanks to all lenders who have contributed their loan to help poor people like her to develop her living status.

loans.use: to buy wood for home renovations.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 41 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Herberth Yermain

texts.es:
Herberth es un joven de 26 años de edad, no pudo prepararse académicamente por lo que solo estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, actualmente él está soltero y todavía no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su madre a quien él ayuda con los gastos y nadie más depende de él.

El joven se dedica a manejar un microbús de una institución de radio, ya tiene alrededor de 5 años desempeñando esta labor,  Herberth adquirió este trabajo, debido a que desde hace mucho tiempo aprendió a manejar carro y eso le sirvió para adquirir el trabajo, también él se dedica a la agricultura en el tiempo que no está trabajando para la institución, el lugar de trabajo está a 9 kilómetros de su casa y tiene un horario de 8 horas diarias. 

Con la ayuda de este crédito, Herberth podrá comprar adobe, madera y teja de barro, ya que una parte de su casa está dañada y es urgente repararla,  esto le ayudará a estar en un lugar más seguro junto con su madre.

Las proyecciones a futuro de este joven son,  poner su propio negocio (tienda) pues dice que en su comunidad no hay tiendas cercanas, también desea que su familia siempre esté bien y pretende ayudarlos a que ellos logren sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Herberth is 25 years old. He couldn't prepare himself well academically as he only studied until Grade 9. He is single and has no children yet. He lives in his mother's house and helps her with the expenses. No one else is dependent on him. He drives a minibus for a radio institution. He has been doing this for 5 years. He got the job as he learned to drive a car many years ago and this helped him get the job. He also farms in the time when he is not working at the institution. His land is 9 km from his house and he works 8 hours a day. 

With the help of this loan Herberth can buy adobe bricks, wood and clay tiles as one section of the house is damaged and urgently needs repair. This will help him to have a secure place to live with his mother. This young man's plans are to start his own business (a store) as he says that there are none close to his community. He also hopes that his family is healthy and wants to help them so they can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy abode, wood and clay tiles to repair his house.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 43-year-old married woman.  Her financial condition is not good.  She has to think many times to start any task. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a motor rickshaw. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bear jerks over the roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced with a new one because it rattles during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his motor rickshaw.

Parveen has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the rickshaw body and it can drive smoothly.

loans.use: To help her husband buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with four children. Gina is 45 years old and lives in Anonang, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Gina has a livestock and farming business. She has been doing this for five years. 

She has requested a loan to buy sacks of feed for her piglets and fertilizer.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Gina hopes for expansion for her business.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of feed for her piglets and fertilizer for her vegetables.

location.town: Pagadian - Anonang, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like soap, eggs, canned goods, chips, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like soap, eggs, canned goods, chips, etc

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 32-years-old and married with one child.  With one child in school, Divina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Divina has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Divina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cassava business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cassavas to sell to her customers. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cassavas to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 40-years-old.  She lives with her two children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling onions (vegetables) for many years.  He sells fresh onions from his shop in his home town. The people like to buy onions from him because his rates are very reasonable. Due to the onion’s suitable prices, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. Due to his reputation, the demand for onions has increased and by noon his stock is finished.

Rehana feels proud of her husband's business and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is taking a loan for her husband so that he will be able to buy onions in more quantity and equilibrium. 

Rehana wants to save the excess profit amount so she can utilize the savings for sudden needs in the future and for her children's education. She is thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy onions for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, etc.

Mary Jane has been in this business for six years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, etc

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol is 58 years old and a widow with three children. She lives with them in the village of Baray district, Kampong Thom. People living in her area work in agriculture, commerce, animal husbandry and poultry raising. As other residents, Sol makes a living by growing rice bean and cassavas, one after another crop among the seasons accordingly.

Sol requested a loan, which she will use to buy farm inputs like a feed sprayer, beans and fertilizer for business improvement. 

This is her second loan cycle with HKL, and first loan with Kiva. 

With her profits, Sol hopes to continue doing her farming to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like a feed sprayer, beans and fertilizer for business improvement.

loans.name: Arcela

texts.en:
Arcela is 29 years old and single; she helps her parents to generate additional income. She has a pearl vending business in the Philippines. Arcela has been in this business for four years.

Arcela requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional stock of pearls to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of pearls to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki operates a retail shop business selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Bintiomar

texts.en:
Bintiomar is a married woman with one child who is in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of selling leso (a woman's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase pieces of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of lesos (women's wraps) for resale

loans.name: Merrydith

texts.en:
Merrydith is 35-years-old and married with four children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Merrydith has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loads.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, rice and other retail stock.

loans.name: Abroriddin

texts.en: Abroridin is 40 years old and is an industrious man. Abroridin is married with 3 children. He lives with his family in a village which is located in the southern part of Tajikistan. He works hard to earn a living. He has been busy growing agricultural products for more than 20 years. He grows potatoes, carrots and cabbage. Abroridin has his own land. He has additional income. He is also a master of repairing the house. Abroridin always tries hard for the well-being of his family. He is the only breadwinner for his family. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is married and lives in Upper Lumbia, Pagadian City. She is 39 years old and has 2 children who are in school-aged.

Mirasol ventured into the retail business to earn a living and has had a business for 1 year now. Each month, she earns 20,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP for this kind of business.

Mirasol has been a memmber of PMPC for six years. In the future, Mirasol hopes to expand her business,

loans.use: to buy food products such as dressed chicken, hotdogs etc.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 43 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

Tessie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Tessie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is 40 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, shampoo, soap, etc.

Leonidas has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like soap, canned goods, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 36-years-old and has two children.  She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeralyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jeralyn has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates Kiva and Yehu's support.  She has managed to grow her business to another level.  This time, she is requesting a loan of Kshs 15,000 to buy ten litres of kerosene for sale.

loans.use: to buy ten litres of kerosene for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of ground nuts

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with four school-going children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Beatrice sells household items, selling various items such as cutlery, plates, cups, basins, carpets, among other items.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more stock of household items, such as kitchen utensils and carpets, for her business.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household items, such as kitchen utensils and carpets, for her business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 27 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicado a su familia, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad y su pareja se dedica actualmente a los trabajos domésticos.

Julio se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, además de cultivar maíz, cultiva frijol, maicillo y caña de azúcar, oficios que aprendió de su padre, ya que antes le ayudaba mucho con los trabajos en el campo.

Con el préstamo que él ha solicitando se le estará ayudando, para que pueda pagar la mano de obra, para rozar la caña y así poder molerla y sacar su producto final.

Julio desea para un futuro aumentar su producción de caña de azúcar ya que le es muy rentable.
texts.en:
Julio is 27 years old, is a very hardworking person and is dedicated to his family. He lives with his wife and their 5-year-old son. His partner currently makes a living by doing domestic work. Julio has made a living from agriculture since he was twelve years old. In addition to growing corn, he grows beans, sorghum and sugar cane. He learned these tasks from his father, as he used to help him a lot with work in the field.

With the loan he has requested, he will be helping to pay for labor and to grate the sugar cane, and he will thus be able to grind it and extract his final product. In the future, Julio wants to increase his production of sugar cane, as it is very profitable for him.

loans.use: to pay for labor, to grate the sugar cane and to grind it to extract the final product.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 56-years old woman living with her four children in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a small canteen in a school and offers chips, spicy food items, stationery etc. to the students. She wants to sell burgers and sandwiches as well but she does not have money to buy the ingredients.
 Razia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan which is the field partner of Kiva so that she can buy spicy ingredients to make burgers. She hopes that with this amount, she will be able to enhance her business. She is very thankful for Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy books, food items and stationery.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is a woman who has a kind heart. She was born in the year 1982 in a rural area. She is divorced and has a little child. Her former husband doesn’t help to provide for their child. Muhabbat is the only one who feeds and keeps her child. Muhabbat has a medical education. She works in a local hospital as nurse. She likes her job. Muhabbat lives with her mother. Her mother is an old and ill woman. She must buy medicine for her mother's treatment but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy medicine for her mother's treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her mother's treatment

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean is 35 years old, married, and, together with her husband, she is raising three children who still depend on their income and are attending school.

Ean finished her education at the primary level and she started a farming business as her main source of her income. Ean grows rice on her own farmland for personal consumption and sales. She has been doing this for over 15 years.

She is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials to support her husband’s fishing activities, as their existing equipment has been ruined. With this loan amount, she hopes to sustain her business and continue working to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials to support her husband’s fishing activities.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old, married and she works hard to help her husband.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for food production for her restaurant business. 

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Romamel

texts.en:
Romamel is 35 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Romamel has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish nets.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Meet Veronicah a resident of the Muranga area in Central Kenya.  She is married and has 2 children,and has been doing farming for 6 years.  Her primary source of income is eggs, poultry, meat, tea,and seasonal crops and she also has a retail business.  She enjoys farming because she likes feeding the chicken well.  Her biggest challenge is watering her crops.

Veronicah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer good and affordable services that caters for low income earners.  This loan will help her to pipe water to her crops making her crops yield more which, in turn, will improve her income level.  The income will enable her to educate her children well,and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: For purchasing water pumps.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en: Tima appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She is requesting for a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to purchase cooking oil, salt, wheat flour and maize flour for resale . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, salt, wheat flour and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer living in the Murang'a area of Central Kenya.  She lives with her mother and her three children, who are of school-going age.  They all depend on her source of income which she gets from selling seasonal crops and also from a retail business.  She enjoys farming and has been doing it for 20 years.  The biggest challenge is low prices of farm produce at the market.

She wants to venture more into poultry farming so she has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo because they finance small scale farmers to help them grow financially. Juhudi also offers its loans at low interest rates, achievable by even the lowest income earner.  Her highest monthly expense is school fees, but with the income from the loan she will cover them comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en: Mariamu appreciates the support given from Kiva and Yehu. The previous loan helped her to boost her business. She is again requesting a loan of 35,000 KES to pay school fees for her kids.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her kids..

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is married and has seven children, five in school and two adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 41 years old and has nine children. Annaliza is married and has six children who are currently in school.

Annaliza is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Annaliza requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Annaliza has been farming corn for 25 years now and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the farm.

In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour and other retail commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a posho milling machine.

loans.name: Débora Raquel

texts.es:
Débora tiene 35 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, vive en un cantón y está soltera y actualmente vive con su mamá. 

Débora trabaja para una amiga suya que tiene un negocio de ropa, en la cual le ayuda y de ahí provienen la mayoría de sus ingresos, ella sale a vender ropa de casa en casa en las comunidades cercanas y ya tiene un año de dedicarse a esta labor. 

El crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar materiales para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, con el cual comprará madera, lámina para el techo, hierro para construir las puertas y cancelar la mano de obra. Con la ayuda del crédito ella estará cubriendo esta necesidad de mejorar su vivienda y tener una casa segura en mejores condiciones.

Sus planes a futuro son, seguir trabajando para mejorar económicamente y si Dios se lo permite formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Débora is 35 years old. She was only able to study up until sixth grade. She lives in a canton, is single, and currently lives with her mother. 

Débora works for one of her friends, who owns a clothing business. She helps her out and this is where the majority of her income comes from. She goes from door to door to sell clothes in the neighbouring communities. She has been doing this for one year.

She needs the loan she is requesting in order to buy materials for making improvements to her house. She will use the loan to pay workers and buy wood, metal sheets for the roof, and iron for building doors. With the help of the loan, she will be fulfilling her need for improving her home and having a safe house in better condition.

Her future plans are to continue working in order to improve her financial situation and, if God wills it, to have her own family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making improvements to her house. She will pay workers and buy wood, metal sheets for the roof, and iron for building doors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails and glue

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es:
Arnulfo es una persona muy trabajadora que tiene 47 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela del cantón donde residen y le ayudan a los trabajos agrícolas cuando tienen tiempo libre. 

Arnulfo se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño, pues trabajaba con su padre en la milpa, y fue así como aprendio esta actividad, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto, ya que tiene 1 vaca y un toro.

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar los insumos para  cultivar 2 hectáreas de maíz, una de frijol y 2 de sorgo.

Arnulfo tiene como propósito a futuro, seguir trabajando en la agricultura, además quiere que sus hijos se superen y se preparen académicamente  para que puedan tener un trabajo que les ayuda a seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Arnulfo is a very hard-working person. He is 47 years old and married with three children, who are studying at the school in the canton where they live. They help him with the farm work when they have free time.

Arnulfo has been working in agriculture since he was little. He worked with his father in the maize field, which is how he learnt how to do this work. He also raises beef cattle, since he has a cow and a bull. 

He needs the loan he is requesting from CrediCampo so he can buy supplies for cultivating two hectares of maize, one hectare of beans, and two hectares of sorghum.

Arnulfo’s goal for the future is to continue working in agriculture. He also wants his children to better themselves and prepare themselves academically so that they can have a job that will help them to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing two hectares of maize, one hectare of beans, and two hectares of sorghum

loans.name: Dúo Esperanza De Vida Group

texts.es:
DUO ESPERANZA DE VIDA
Este dúo esta conformado por Maria Olivia ES originario del municipio de Sumpango, ella se dedica  a la agricultura y cuenta que entre los deseo que tiene es de comprar otro carro para poder trabajar mejor. Es el segundo crédito que solicita y  gracias a Dios el primer crédito pago puntualmente en cada fecha y  por eso agradece a kiva por la oportunidad que le brinda  para poder sacar otro crédito y poder desenvolverse mejor, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y fertilizante para la agricultura.
texts.en: This group was formed by Maria Olivia. She is originally from the municipality of Sumpango. She makes a living from agriculture and among the desires she has is that of having another car so that she can work better. This is the second loan she has requested and, thanks to God, she paid off the first loan on the dates stipulated and for this reason she is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity they have given her of taking out another loan and managing better. She is requesting this loan so she can buy seeds and fertiliser for agricultural work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser for crops

loans.name: Anna Lee

texts.en:
Anna Lee is 34 years old and married with one child, who is currently in school. Anna Lee works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, coffee and milk.

Anna Lee has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. In the future, Anna Lee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, coffee and milk

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married mother of four adult children. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. 

For the past sever years, Riziki has operated a business at the market where she grinds grain into flour using a grinding machine. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan she wants to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her grinding machine

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 59 years old and married with seven children. She is in the business of raising pigs on the island of Cebu in the Philippines. Aurelia has requested a 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Aurelia has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.en: Ziyodullo is 60 years old and is a kind and smart man. He is married, has five children and is a master of repairing houses. He has ‘golden hands’, does high quality work and has regular customers. Ziyodullo is the only provider for his family and that is why they only have a low income. Ziyodullo’s son is 26 years old and does not have a job in Tajikistan so he wants to go to Russia to find work. But he does not have enough money to buy an air ticket and thus is asking for a loan of 3000 Tajiki somoni (TJS). He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket to Russia for his son

loans.name: Qerime

texts.en:
Qerime is a 54-year-old married woman who has five children, and a husband who earns a living by cutting wood. She is planning on starting her own self-employed business, making handicrafts from her home. She is a very hard working woman who wants to be able to contribute to her family’s needs, as her husband makes a very low salary and they need more money to support a large family. 

Qerime hopes to have a lot of customers and orders for her work, because many people in her area prefer and purchase hand made items for gifts and their own use. She is requesting a loan to purchase the materials to make her items and sell them. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions and save money towards her children’s education. She is very thankful for the help.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make her items and sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products for his shop.

loans.name: Chereque

texts.en:
Chereque is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Chereque is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Chereque has a general store business in the Philippines. Chereque requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks to resell in her general store.

Chereque has been in this business for four years. Chereque would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from frozen foods vending. Leonila is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to resell in her general store.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat was born in 1969. She is married and has five children. Sharofat began her own business selling clothes nine years ago. Sharofat sells women's clothes. She sells goods in a local market. 

Sharofat every season renews her goods. Sharofat must buy women’s clothes for the new spring season, but she has no money. She hopes that after renewing goods she will attract more clients. From the profit she is going to improve her living conditions. 

She is asking for a loan of 8,500 Somoni to buy women’s clothes for the new spring season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes for the new spring season

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which she used to help her renovate her business work area and purchase a new sewing machine. 

She was very satisfied with the lending process and the results she had from her business. As she wants to be able to continue her work, she is requesting another loan for the same business, but this time, to purchase materials in order to meet the needs and satisfaction of her customers. 

She was able to improve her living conditions and generate more income. She is hopeful and excited to see her profits grow more with the help of another loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials in order to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Luchi

texts.en:
Luchi is a married mother who works hard to support her family with her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luchi has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs
